30 import math;

33 real Infinity=1.0/(1000*realEpsilon);
34 
35 /**
36  * A rotation in the direction dir limited to [-90,90]
37  * This is useful for rotating text along a line in the direction dir.
38  */
39 private transform rotate(explicit pair dir)
40 {
41  real angle=degrees(dir);
42  if(angle > 90 && angle < 270) angle -= 180;
43  return rotate(angle);
44 }
45 
46 
47 /**
48  * Variable used in the approximate calculations.
49  */
50 real epsgeo = 10 * sqrt(realEpsilon);
51 
52 /**
53  * Add margins to `pic` with respect to the current bounding box of `pic`.
54  * If `rigid` is false, margins are added iff an infinite curve will be prolonged on the margin.
55  * If `allObject` is false, fixed - size objects (such as labels and arrowheads) will be ignored.
56  *
57  * @param pic picture to be drawn in
58  * @param lmargin
59  * @param bmargin
60  * @param rmargin
61  * @param tmargin
62  * @param rigid
63  * @param allObject
64  */
65 void addMargins(picture pic = currentpicture,
66  real lmargin = 0, real bmargin = 0,
67  real rmargin = lmargin, real tmargin = bmargin,
68  bool rigid = true, bool allObject = true)
69 {
70  pair m = allObject ? truepoint(pic, SW) : point(pic, SW);
71  pair M = allObject ? truepoint(pic, NE) : point(pic, NE);
72  if(rigid) {
73  draw(m - inverse(pic.calculateTransform()) * (lmargin, bmargin), invisible);
74  draw(M + inverse(pic.calculateTransform()) * (rmargin, tmargin), invisible);
75  } else pic.addBox(m, M, -(lmargin, bmargin), (rmargin, tmargin));
76 }
77 
78 real approximate(real t)
79 {
80  real ot = t;
81  if(abs(t - ceil(t)) < epsgeo) ot = ceil(t);
82  else if(abs(t - floor(t)) < epsgeo) ot = floor(t);
83  return ot;
84 }
85 
86 real[] approximate(real[] T)
87 {
88  return map(approximate, T);
89 }
90 
91 /**
92 Return \f$\frac{n!}{(n - k)!\cdot k!}\f$
93 */
94 real binomial(real n, real k)
95 {
96  return gamma(n + 1)/(gamma(n - k + 1) * gamma(k + 1));
97 }
98 
99 /**
100 Computes Carlson's elliptic integral of the first kind.
101 `x`, `y`, and `z` must be non negative, and at most one can be zero.
102 */
103 real rf(real x, real y, real z)
104 {
105  real ERRTOL = 0.0025,
106  TINY = 1.5e-38,
107  BIG = 3e37,
108  THIRD = 1/3,
109  C1 = 1/24,
110  C2 = 0.1,
111  C3 = 3/44,
112  C4 = 1/14;
113  real alamb, ave, delx, dely, delz, e2, e3, sqrtx, sqrty, sqrtz, xt, yt, zt;
114  if(min(x, y, z) < 0 || min(x + y, x + z, y + z) < TINY ||
115  max(x, y, z) > BIG) abort("rf: invalid arguments.");
116  xt = x;
117  yt = y;
118  zt = z;
119  do {
120  sqrtx = sqrt(xt);
121  sqrty = sqrt(yt);
122  sqrtz = sqrt(zt);
123  alamb = sqrtx * (sqrty + sqrtz) + sqrty * sqrtz;
124  xt = 0.25 * (xt + alamb);
125  yt = 0.25 * (yt + alamb);
126  zt = 0.25 * (zt + alamb);
127  ave = THIRD * (xt + yt + zt);
128  delx = (ave - xt)/ave;
129  dely = (ave - yt)/ave;
130  delz = (ave - zt)/ave;
131  } while(max(fabs(delx), fabs(dely), fabs(delz)) > ERRTOL);
132  e2 = delx * dely - delz * delz;
133  e3 = delx * dely * delz;
134  return (1.0 + (C1 * e2 - C2 - C3 * e3) * e2 + C4 * e3)/sqrt(ave);
135 }
136 
137 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="rd(real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
138 real rd(real x, real y, real z)
139 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Computes Carlson's elliptic integral of the second kind.
140  x and y must be positive, and at most one can be zero.
141  z must be non negative.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
142  real ERRTOL = 0.0015,
143  TINY = 1e-25,
144  BIG = 4.5 * 10.0^21,
145  C1 = (3/14),
146  C2 = (1/6),
147  C3 = (9/22),
148  C4 = (3/26),
149  C5 = (0.25 * C3),
150  C6 = (1.5 * C4);
151  real alamb, ave, delx, dely, delz, ea, eb, ec, ed, ee, fac, sqrtx, sqrty,
152  sqrtz, sum, xt, yt, zt;
153  if (min(x, y) < 0 || min(x + y, z) < TINY || max(x, y, z) > BIG)
154  abort("rd: invalid arguments");
155  xt = x;
156  yt = y;
157  zt = z;
158  sum = 0;
159  fac = 1;
160  do {
161  sqrtx = sqrt(xt);
162  sqrty = sqrt(yt);
163  sqrtz = sqrt(zt);
164  alamb = sqrtx * (sqrty + sqrtz) + sqrty * sqrtz;
165  sum += fac/(sqrtz * (zt + alamb));
166  fac = 0.25 * fac;
167  xt = 0.25 * (xt + alamb);
168  yt = 0.25 * (yt + alamb);
169  zt = 0.25 * (zt + alamb);
170  ave = 0.2 * (xt + yt + 3.0 * zt);
171  delx = (ave - xt)/ave;
172  dely = (ave - yt)/ave;
173  delz = (ave - zt)/ave;
174  } while (max(fabs(delx), fabs(dely), fabs(delz)) > ERRTOL);
175  ea = delx * dely;
176  eb = delz * delz;
177  ec = ea - eb;
178  ed = ea - 6 * eb;
179  ee = ed + ec + ec;
180  return 3 * sum + fac * (1.0 + ed * (-C1 + C5 * ed - C6 * delz * ee)
181  +delz * (C2 * ee + delz * (-C3 * ec + delz * C4 * ea)))/(ave * sqrt(ave));
182 }
183 
184 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="elle(real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
185 real elle(real phi, real k)
186 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Legendre elliptic integral of the 2nd kind,
187  evaluated using Carlson's functions RD and RF.
188  The argument ranges are -infinity < phi < +infinity, 0 <= k * sin(phi) <= 1.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
189  real result;
190  if (phi >= 0 && phi <= pi/2) {
191  real cc, q, s;
192  s = sin(phi);
193  cc = cos(phi)^2;
194  q = (1 - s * k) * (1 + s * k);
195  result = s * (rf(cc, q, 1) - (s * k)^2 * rd(cc, q, 1)/3);
196  } else
197  if (phi <= pi && phi >= 0) {
198  result = 2 * elle(pi/2, k) - elle(pi - phi, k);
199  } else
200  if (phi <= 3 * pi/2 && phi >= 0) {
201  result = 2 * elle(pi/2, k) + elle(phi - pi, k);
202  } else
203  if (phi <= 2 * pi && phi >= 0) {
204  result = 4 * elle(pi/2, k) - elle(2 * pi - phi, k);
205  } else
206  if (phi >= 0) {
207  int nb = floor(0.5 * phi/pi);
208  result = nb * elle(2 * pi, k) + elle(phi%(2 * pi), k);
209  } else result = -elle(-phi, k);
210  return result;
211 }
212 
213 /*<asyxml><function type="pair[]" signature="intersectionpoints(pair,pair,real,real,real,real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
214 pair[] intersectionpoints(pair A, pair B,
215  real a, real b, real c, real d, real f, real g)
216 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Intersection points with the line (AB) and the quadric curve
217  a * x^2 + b * x * y + c * y^2 + d * x + f * y + g = 0 given in the default coordinate system</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
218  pair[] op;
219  real ap = B.y - A.y,
220  bpp = A.x - B.x,
221  cp = A.y * B.x - A.x * B.y;
222  real sol[];
223  if (abs(ap) > epsgeo) {
224  real aa = ap * c + a * bpp^2/ap - b * bpp,
225  bb = ap * f - bpp * d + 2 * a * bpp * cp/ap - b * cp,
226  cc = ap * g - cp * d + a * cp^2/ap;
227  sol = quadraticroots(aa, bb, cc);
228  for (int i = 0; i < sol.length; ++i) {
229  op.push((-bpp * sol[i]/ap - cp/ap, sol[i]));
230  }
231  } else {
232  real aa = a * bpp,
233  bb = d * bpp - b * cp,
234  cc = g * bpp - cp * f + c * cp^2/bpp;
235  sol = quadraticroots(aa, bb, cc);
236  for (int i = 0; i < sol.length; ++i) {
237  op.push((sol[i], -cp/bpp));
238  }
239  }
240  return op;
241 }
242 
243 /*<asyxml><function type="pair[]" signature="intersectionpoints(pair,pair,real[])"><code></asyxml>*/
244 pair[] intersectionpoints(pair A, pair B, real[] equation)
245 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the intersection points of the line AB with
246  the conic whose an equation is
247  equation[0] * x^2 + equation[1] * x * y + equation[2] * y^2 + equation[3] * x + equation[4] * y + equation[5] = 0</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
248  if(equation.length != 6) abort("intersectionpoints: bad length of array for a conic equation.");
249  return intersectionpoints(A, B, equation[0], equation[1], equation[2],
250  equation[3], equation[4], equation[5]);
251 }
252 // *........................HEADER.........................*
253 // *=======================================================*

255 // *=======================================================*
256 // *......................COORDINATES......................*
257 
258 real EPS = sqrt(realEpsilon);
259 
260 /*<asyxml><typedef type = "convert" return = "pair" params = "pair"><code></asyxml>*/
261 typedef pair convert(pair);/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Function type to convert pair in an other coordinate system.</documentation></typedef></asyxml>*/
262 /*<asyxml><typedef type = "abs" return = "real" params = "pair"><code></asyxml>*/
263 typedef real abs(pair);/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Function type to calculate modulus of pair.</documentation></typedef></asyxml>*/
264 /*<asyxml><typedef type = "dot" return = "real" params = "pair, pair"><code></asyxml>*/
265 typedef real dot(pair, pair);/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Function type to calculate dot product.</documentation></typedef></asyxml>*/
266 /*<asyxml><typedef type = "polar" return = "pair" params = "real, real"><code></asyxml>*/
267 typedef pair polar(real, real);/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Function type to calculate the coordinates from the polar coordinates.</documentation></typedef></asyxml>*/
268 
269 /*<asyxml><struct signature="coordsys"><code></asyxml>*/
270 struct coordsys
271 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>This structure represents a coordinate system in the plane.</documentation></asyxml>*/
272  /*<asyxml><method type = "pair" signature="relativetodefault(pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
273  restricted convert relativetodefault = new pair(pair m){return m;};/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Convert a pair given relatively to this coordinate system to
274  the pair relatively to the default coordinate system.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
275  /*<asyxml><method type = "pair" signature="defaulttorelativet(pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
276  restricted convert defaulttorelative = new pair(pair m){return m;};/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Convert a pair given relatively to the default coordinate system to
277  the pair relatively to this coordinate system.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
278  /*<asyxml><method type = "real" signature="dot(pair,pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
279  restricted dot dot = new real(pair m, pair n){return dot(m, n);};/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the dot product of this coordinate system.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
280  /*<asyxml><method type = "real" signature="abs(pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
281  restricted abs abs = new real(pair m){return abs(m);};/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the modulus of a pair in this coordinate system.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
282  /*<asyxml><method type = "pair" signature="polar(real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
283  restricted polar polar = new pair(real r, real a){return (r * cos(a), r * sin(a));};/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Polar coordinates routine of this coordinate system.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
284  /*<asyxml><property type = "pair" signature="O,i,j"><code></asyxml>*/
285  restricted pair O = (0, 0), i = (1, 0), j = (0, 1);/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Origin and units vector.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
286  /*<asyxml><method type = "void" signature="init(convert,convert,polar,dot)"><code></asyxml>*/
287  void init(convert rtd, convert dtr,
288  polar polar, dot dot)
289  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The default constructor of the coordinate system.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
290  this.relativetodefault = rtd;
291  this.defaulttorelative = dtr;
292  this.polar = polar;
293  this.dot = dot;
294  this.abs = new real(pair m){return sqrt(dot(m, m));};;
295  this.O = rtd((0, 0));
296  this.i = rtd((1, 0)) - O;
297  this.j = rtd((0, 1)) - O;
298  }
299 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
300 
301 /*<asyxml><operator type = "bool" signature="==(coordsys,coordsys)"><code></asyxml>*/
302 bool operator ==(coordsys c1, coordsys c2)
303  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return true iff the coordinate system have the same origin and units vector.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
304  return c1.O == c2.O && c1.i == c2.i && c1.j == c2.j;
305  }
306 
307 /*<asyxml><function type="coordsys" signature="cartesiansystem(pair,pair,pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
308 coordsys cartesiansystem(pair O = (0, 0), pair i, pair j)
309 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the Cartesian coordinate system (O, i, j).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
310  coordsys R;
311  real[][] P = {{0, 0}, {0, 0}};
312  real[][] iP;
313  P[0][0] = i.x;
314  P[0][1] = j.x;
315  P[1][0] = i.y;
316  P[1][1] = j.y;
317  iP = inverse(P);
318  real ni = abs(i);
319  real nj = abs(j);
320  real ij = angle(j) - angle(i);
321 
322  pair rtd(pair m)
323  {
324  return O + (P[0][0] * m.x + P[0][1] * m.y, P[1][0] * m.x + P[1][1] * m.y);
325  }
326 
327  pair dtr(pair m)
328  {
329  m-=O;
330  return (iP[0][0] * m.x + iP[0][1] * m.y, iP[1][0] * m.x + iP[1][1] * m.y);
331  }
332 
333  pair polar(real r, real a)
334  {
335  real ca = sin(ij - a)/(ni * sin(ij));
336  real sa = sin(a)/(nj * sin(ij));
337  return r * (ca, sa);
338  }
339 
340  real tdot(pair m, pair n)
341  {
342  return m.x * n.x * ni^2 + m.y * n.y * nj^2 + (m.x * n.y + n.x * m.y) * dot(i, j);
343  }
344 
345  R.init(rtd, dtr, polar, tdot);
346  return R;
347 }
348 
349 
350 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="show(picture,Label,Label,Label,coordsys,pen,pen,pen,pen,pen)"><code></asyxml>*/
351 void show(picture pic = currentpicture, Label lo = "$O$",
352  Label li = "$\vec{\imath}$",
353  Label lj = "$\vec{\jmath}$",
354  coordsys R,
355  pen dotpen = currentpen, pen xpen = currentpen, pen ypen = xpen,
356  pen ipen = red,
357  pen jpen = ipen,
358  arrowbar arrow = Arrow)
359 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw the components (O, i, j, x - axis, y - axis) of 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
360  unravel R;
361  drawline(pic, O, O + i, xpen);
362  drawline(pic, O, O + j, ypen);
363  draw(pic, li, O--(O + i), ipen, arrow);
364  Label lj = lj.copy();
365  lj.align(lj.align, unit(I * j));
366  draw(pic, lj, O--(O + j), jpen, arrow);
367  draw(pic, lj, O--(O + j), jpen, arrow);
368  dot(pic, O, dotpen);
369  Label lo = lo.copy();
370  lo.align(lo.align, -2 * dir(O--O + i, O--O + j));
371  lo.p(dotpen);
372  label(pic, lo, O);
373 }
374 
375 /*<asyxml><operator type = "pair" signature="/(pair,coordsys)"><code></asyxml>*/
376 pair operator /(pair p, coordsys R)
377 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the xy - coordinates of 'p' relatively to
378  the coordinate system 'R'.
379  For example, if R = cartesiansystem((1, 2), (1, 0), (0, 1)), (0, 0)/R is (-1, -2).</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
380  return R.defaulttorelative(p);
381 }
382 
383 /*<asyxml><operator type = "pair" signature="*(coordsys,pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
384 pair operator *(coordsys R, pair p)
385 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the coordinates of 'p' given in the
386  xy - coordinates 'R'.
387  For example, if R = cartesiansystem((1, 2), (1, 0), (0, 1)), R * (0, 0) is (1, 2).</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
388  return R.relativetodefault(p);
389 }
390 
391 /*<asyxml><operator type = "path" signature="*(coordsys,path)"><code></asyxml>*/
392 path operator *(coordsys R, path g)
393 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the reconstructed path applying R * pair to each node, pre and post control point of 'g'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
394  guide og = R * point(g, 0);
395  real l = length(g);
396  for(int i = 1; i <= l; ++i)
397  {
398  pair P = R * point(g, i);
399  pair post = R * postcontrol(g, i - 1);
400  pair pre = R * precontrol(g, i);
401  if(i == l && (cyclic(g)))
402  og = og..controls post and pre..cycle;
403  else
404  og = og..controls post and pre..P;
405  }
406  return og;
407 }
408 
409 /*<asyxml><operator type = "coordsys" signature="*(transform,coordsys)"><code></asyxml>*/
410 coordsys operator *(transform t,coordsys R)
411 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide transform * coordsys.
412  Note that shiftless(t) is applied to R.i and R.j.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
413  coordsys oc;
414  oc = cartesiansystem(t * R.O, shiftless(t) * R.i, shiftless(t) * R.j);
415  return oc;
416 }
417 
418 /*<asyxml><constant type = "coordsys" signature="defaultcoordsys"><code></asyxml>*/
419 restricted coordsys defaultcoordsys = cartesiansystem(0, (1, 0), (0, 1));/*<asyxml></code><documentation>One can always refer to the default coordinate system using this constant.</documentation></constant></asyxml>*/
420 /*<asyxml><variable type="coordsys" signature="currentcoordsys"><code></asyxml>*/
421 coordsys currentcoordsys = defaultcoordsys;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The coordinate system used by default.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
422 
423 /*<asyxml><struct signature="point"><code></asyxml>*/
424 struct point
425 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>This structure replaces the pair to embed its coordinate system.
426  For example, if 'P = point(cartesiansystem((1, 2), i, j), (0, 0))',
427  P is equal to the pair (1, 2).</documentation></asyxml>*/
428  /*<asyxml><property type = "coordsys" signature="coordsys"><code></asyxml>*/
429  coordsys coordsys;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The coordinate system of this point.</documentation></property><property type = "pair" signature="coordinates"><code></asyxml>*/
430  restricted pair coordinates;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The coordinates of this point relatively to the coordinate system 'coordsys'.</documentation></property><property type = "real" signature="x, y"><code></asyxml>*/
431  restricted real x, y;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The xpart and the ypart of 'coordinates'.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
432  /*<asyxml><method type = "" signature="init(coordsys,pair)"><code><property type = "real" signature="m"><code></asyxml>*/
433  real m = 1;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Used to cast mass<->point.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
434  void init(coordsys R, pair coordinates, real mass)
435  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The constructor.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
436  this.coordsys = R;
437  this.coordinates = coordinates;
438  this.x = coordinates.x;
439  this.y = coordinates.y;
440  this.m = mass;
441  }
442 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
443 
444 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(coordsys,pair,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
445 point point(coordsys R, pair p, real m = 1)
446 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point which has the coodinates 'p' in the
447  coordinate system 'R' and the mass 'm'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
448  point op;
449  op.init(R, p, m);
450  return op;
451 }
452 
453 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(explicit pair,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
454 point point(explicit pair p, real m)
455 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point which has the coodinates 'p' in the current
456  coordinate system and the mass 'm'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
457  point op;
458  op.init(currentcoordsys, p, m);
459  return op;
460 }
461 
462 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(coordsys,explicit point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
463 point point(coordsys R, explicit point M, real m = M.m)
464 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'R' which has the coordinates of 'M' and the mass 'm'.
465  Do not confuse this routine with the further routine 'changecoordsys'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
466  point op;
467  op.init(R, M.coordinates, M.m);
468  return op;
469 }
470 
471 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="changecoordsys(coordsys,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
472 point changecoordsys(coordsys R, point M)
473 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point 'M' in the coordinate system 'coordsys'.
474  In other words, the returned point marks the same plot as 'M' does.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
475  point op;
476  coordsys mco = M.coordsys;
477  op.init(R, R.defaulttorelative(mco.relativetodefault(M.coordinates)), M.m);
478  return op;
479 }
480 
481 /*<asyxml><function type="pair" signature="pair coordinates(point)"><code></asyxml>*/
482 pair coordinates(point M)
483 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the coordinates of 'M' in its coordinate system.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
484  return M.coordinates;
485 }
486 
487 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="bool samecoordsys(bool...point[])"><code></asyxml>*/
488 bool samecoordsys(bool warn = true ... point[] M)
489 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return true iff all the points have the same coordinate system.
490  If 'warn' is true and the coordinate systems are different, a warning is sent.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
491  bool ret = true;
492  coordsys t = M[0].coordsys;
493  for (int i = 1; i < M.length; ++i) {
494  ret = (t == M[i].coordsys);
495  if(!ret) break;
496  t = M[i].coordsys;
497  }
498  if(warn && !ret)
499  warning("coodinatesystem",
500  "the coordinate system of two objects are not the same.
501 The operation will be done relative to the default coordinate system.");
502  return ret;
503 }
504 
505 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="standardizecoordsys(coordsys,bool...point[])"><code></asyxml>*/
506 point[] standardizecoordsys(coordsys R = currentcoordsys,
507  bool warn = true ... point[] M)
508 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the points with the same coordinate system 'R'.
509  If 'warn' is true and the coordinate systems are different, a warning is sent.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
510  point[] op = new point[];
511  op = M;
512  if(!samecoordsys(warn ... M))
513  for (int i = 1; i < M.length; ++i)
514  op[i] = changecoordsys(R, M[i]);
515  return op;
516 }
517 
518 /*<asyxml><operator type = "pair" signature="cast(point)"><code></asyxml>*/
519 pair operator cast(point P)
520 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast point to pair.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
521  return P.coordsys.relativetodefault(P.coordinates);
522 }
523 
524 /*<asyxml><operator type = "pair[]" signature="cast(point[])"><code></asyxml>*/
525 pair[] operator cast(point[] P)
526 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast point[] to pair[].</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
527  pair[] op;
528  for (int i = 0; i < P.length; ++i) {
529  op.push((pair)P[i]);
530  }
531  return op;
532 }
533 
534 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="cast(pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
535 point operator cast(pair p)
536 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast pair to point relatively to the current coordinate
537  system 'currentcoordsys'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
538  return point(currentcoordsys, p);
539 }
540 
541 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point[]" signature="cast(pair[])"><code></asyxml>*/
542 point[] operator cast(pair[] p)
543 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast pair[] to point[] relatively to the current coordinate
544  system 'currentcoordsys'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
545  pair[] op;
546  for (int i = 0; i < p.length; ++i) {
547  op.push((point)p[i]);
548  }
549  return op;
550 }
551 
552 /*<asyxml><function type="pair" signature="locate(point)"><code></asyxml>*/
553 pair locate(point P)
554 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the coordinates of 'P' in the default coordinate system.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
555  return P.coordsys * P.coordinates;
556 }
557 
558 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="locate(pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
559 point locate(pair p)
560 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point in the current coordinate system 'currentcoordsys'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
561  return p; //automatic casting 'pair to point'.
562 }
563 
564 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="*(real,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
565 point operator *(real x, explicit point P)
566 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Multiply the coordinates (not the mass) of 'P' by 'x'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
567  return point(P.coordsys, x * P.coordinates, P.m);
568 }
569 
570 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="/(explicit point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
571 point operator /(explicit point P, real x)
572 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Divide the coordinates (not the mass) of 'P' by 'x'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
573  return point(P.coordsys, P.coordinates/x, P.m);
574 }
575 
576 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="/(real,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
577 point operator /(real x, explicit point P)
578 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
579  return point(P.coordsys, x/P.coordinates, P.m);
580 }
581 
582 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="-(explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
583 point operator -(explicit point P)
584 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>-P. The mass is inchanged.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
585  return point(P.coordsys, -P.coordinates, P.m);
586 }
587 
588 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="+(explicit point,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
589 point operator +(explicit point P1, explicit point P2)
590 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide 'point + point'.
591  If the two points haven't the same coordinate system, a warning is sent and the
592  returned point has the default coordinate system 'defaultcoordsys'.
593  The masses are added.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
594  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(P1, P2);
595  coordsys R = P[0].coordsys;
596  return point(R, P[0].coordinates + P[1].coordinates, P1.m + P2.m);
597 }
598 
599 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="+(explicit point,explicit pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
600 point operator +(explicit point P1, explicit pair p2)
601 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide 'point + pair'.
602  The pair 'p2' is supposed to be coordinates relatively to the coordinates system of 'P1'.
603  The mass is not changed.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
604  coordsys R = currentcoordsys;
605  return point(R, P1.coordinates + point(R, p2).coordinates, P1.m);
606 }
607 point operator +(explicit pair p1, explicit point p2)
608 {
609  return p2 + p1;
610 }
611 
612 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="-(explicit point,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
613 point operator -(explicit point P1, explicit point P2)
614 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide 'point - point'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
615  return P1 + (-P2);
616 }
617 
618 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="-(explicit point,explicit pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
619 point operator -(explicit point P1, explicit pair p2)
620 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide 'point - pair'.
621  The pair 'p2' is supposed to be coordinates relatively to the coordinates system of 'P1'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
622  return P1 + (-p2);
623 }
624 point operator -(explicit pair p1, explicit point P2)
625 {
626  return p1 + (-P2);
627 }
628 
629 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="*(transform,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
630 point operator *(transform t, explicit point P)
631 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide 'transform * point'.
632  Note that the transforms scale, xscale, yscale and rotate are carried out relatively
633  the default coordinate system 'defaultcoordsys' which is not desired for point
634  defined in an other coordinate system.
635  On can use scale(real, point), xscale(real, point), yscale(real, point), rotate(real, point),
636  scaleO(real), xscaleO(real), yscaleO(real) and rotateO(real) (described further)
637  to change the coordinate system of reference.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
638  coordsys R = P.coordsys;
639  return point(R, (t * locate(P))/R, P.m);
640 }
641 
642 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="*(explicit point,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
643 point operator *(explicit point P1, explicit point P2)
644 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide 'point * point'.
645  The resulted mass is the mass of P2</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
646  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(P1, P2);
647  coordsys R = P[0].coordsys;
648  return point(R, P[0].coordinates * P[1].coordinates, P2.m);
649 }
650 
651 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="*(explicit point,explicit pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
652 point operator *(explicit point P1, explicit pair p2)
653 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide 'point * pair'.
654  The pair 'p2' is supposed to be the coordinates of
655  the point in the coordinates system of 'P1'.
656  'pair * point' is also defined.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
657  point P = point(P1.coordsys, p2, P1.m);
658  return P1 * P;
659 }
660 point operator *(explicit pair p1, explicit point p2)
661 {
662  return p2 * p1;
663 }
664 
665 /*<asyxml><operator type = "bool" signature="==(explicit point,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
666 bool operator ==(explicit point M, explicit point N)
667  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide the test 'M == N' wish returns true iff MN < EPS</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
668  return abs(locate(M) - locate(N)) < EPS;
669  }
670 
671 /*<asyxml><operator type = "bool" signature="!=(explicit point,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
672 bool operator !=(explicit point M, explicit point N)
673 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide the test 'M != N' wish return true iff MN >= EPS</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
674  return !(M == N);
675 }
676 
677 /*<asyxml><operator type = "guide" signature="cast(point)"><code></asyxml>*/
678 guide operator cast(point p)
679 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast point to guide.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
680  return locate(p);
681 }
682 
683 /*<asyxml><operator type = "path" signature="cast(point)"><code></asyxml>*/
684 path operator cast(point p)
685 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast point to path.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
686  return locate(p);
687 }
688 
689 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="dot(picture,Label,explicit point,align,string,pen)"><code></asyxml>*/
690 void dot(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L, explicit point Z,
691  align align = NoAlign,
692  string format = defaultformat, pen p = currentpen)
693 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
694  Label L = L.copy();
695  L.position(locate(Z));
696  if(L.s == "") {
697  if(format == "") format = defaultformat;
698  L.s = "("+format(format, Z.x)+", "+format(format, Z.y)+")";
699  }
700  L.align(align, E);
701  L.p(p);
702  dot(pic, locate(Z), p);
703  add(pic, L);
704 }
705 
706 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="abs(coordsys,pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
707 real abs(coordsys R, pair m)
708 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the modulus |m| in the coordinate system 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
709  return R.abs(m);
710 }
711 
712 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="abs(explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
713 real abs(explicit point M)
714 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the modulus |M| in its coordinate system.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
715  return M.coordsys.abs(M.coordinates);
716 }
717 
718 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="length(explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
719 real length(explicit point M)
720 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the modulus |M| in its coordinate system (same as 'abs').</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
721  return M.coordsys.abs(M.coordinates);
722 }
723 
724 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="conj(explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
725 point conj(explicit point M)
726 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Conjugate.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
727  return point(M.coordsys, conj(M.coordinates), M.m);
728 }
729 
730 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="degrees(explicit point,coordsys,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
731 real degrees(explicit point M, coordsys R = M.coordsys, bool warn = true)
732 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angle of M (in degrees) relatively to 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
733  return (degrees(locate(M) - R.O, warn) - degrees(R.i))%360;
734 }
735 
736 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="angle(explicit point,coordsys,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
737 real angle(explicit point M, coordsys R = M.coordsys, bool warn = true)
738 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angle of M (in radians) relatively to 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
739  return radians(degrees(M, R, warn));
740 }
741 
742 bool Finite(explicit point z)
743 {
744  return abs(z.x) < Infinity && abs(z.y) < Infinity;
745 }
746 
747 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="finite(explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
748 bool finite(explicit point p)
749 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Avoid to compute 'finite((pair)(infinite_point))'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
750  return finite(p.coordinates);
751 }
752 
753 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="dot(point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
754 real dot(point A, point B)
755 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the dot product in the coordinate system of 'A'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
756  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(A.coordsys, A, B);
757  return P[0].coordsys.dot(P[0].coordinates, P[1].coordinates);
758 }
759 
760 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="dot(point,explicit pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
761 real dot(point A, explicit pair B)
762 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the dot product in the default coordinate system.
763  dot(explicit pair, point) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
764  return dot(locate(A), B);
765 }
766 real dot(explicit pair A, point B)
767 {
768  return dot(A, locate(B));
769 }
770 
771 /*<asyxml><function type="transforms" signature="rotateO(real)"><code></asyxml>*/
772 transform rotateO(real a)
773 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Rotation around the origin of the current coordinate system.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
774  return rotate(a, currentcoordsys.O);
775 }
776 
777 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="projection(point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
778 transform projection(point A, point B)
779 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the orthogonal projection on the line (AB).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
780  pair dir = unit(locate(A) - locate(B));
781  pair a = locate(A);
782  real cof = dir.x * a.x + dir.y * a.y;
783  real tx = a.x - dir.x * cof;
784  real txx = dir.x^2;
785  real txy = dir.x * dir.y;
786  real ty = a.y - dir.y * cof;
787  real tyx = txy;
788  real tyy = dir.y^2;
789  transform t = (tx, ty, txx, txy, tyx, tyy);
790  return t;
791 }
792 
793 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="projection(point,point,point,point,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
794 transform projection(point A, point B, point C, point D, bool safe = false)
795 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the (CD) parallel projection on (AB).
796  If 'safe = true' and (AB)//(CD) return the identity.
797  If 'safe = false' and (AB)//(CD) return an infinity scaling.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
798  pair a = locate(A);
799  pair u = unit(locate(B) - locate(A));
800  pair v = unit(locate(D) - locate(C));
801  real c = u.x * a.y - u.y * a.x;
802  real d = (conj(u) * v).y;
803  if (abs(d) < epsgeo) {
804  return safe ? identity() : scale(infinity);
805  }
806  real tx = c * v.x/d;
807  real ty = c * v.y/d;
808  real txx = u.x * v.y/d;
809  real txy = -u.x * v.x/d;
810  real tyx = u.y * v.y/d;
811  real tyy = -u.y * v.x/d;
812  transform t = (tx, ty, txx, txy, tyx, tyy);
813  return t;
814 }
815 
816 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="scale(real,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
817 transform scale(real k, point M)
818 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Homothety.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
819  pair P = locate(M);
820  return shift(P) * scale(k) * shift(-P);
821 }
822 
823 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="xscale(real,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
824 transform xscale(real k, point M)
825 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>xscale from 'M' relatively to the x - axis of the coordinate system of 'M'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
826  pair P = locate(M);
827  real a = degrees(M.coordsys.i);
828  return (shift(P) * rotate(a)) * xscale(k) * (rotate(-a) * shift(-P));
829 }
830 
831 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="yscale(real,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
832 transform yscale(real k, point M)
833 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>yscale from 'M' relatively to the y - axis of the coordinate system of 'M'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
834  pair P = locate(M);
835  real a = degrees(M.coordsys.j) - 90;
836  return (shift(P) * rotate(a)) * yscale(k) * (rotate(-a) * shift(-P));
837 }
838 
839 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="scale(real,point,point,point,point,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
840 transform scale(real k, point A, point B, point C, point D, bool safe = false)
841 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Affinit%C3%A9_%28math%C3%A9matiques%29"/>
842  (help me for English translation...)
843  If 'safe = true' and (AB)//(CD) return the identity.
844  If 'safe = false' and (AB)//(CD) return a infinity scaling.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
845  pair a = locate(A);
846  pair u = unit(locate(B) - locate(A));
847  pair v = unit(locate(D) - locate(C));
848  real c = u.x * a.y - u.y * a.x;
849  real d = (conj(u) * v).y;
850  real d = (conj(u) * v).y;
851  if (abs(d) < epsgeo) {
852  return safe ? identity() : scale(infinity);
853  }
854  real tx = (1 - k) * c * v.x/d;
855  real ty = (1 - k) * c * v.y/d;
856  real txx = (1 - k) * u.x * v.y/d + k;
857  real txy = (k - 1) * u.x * v.x/d;
858  real tyx = (1 - k) * u.y * v.y/d;
859  real tyy = (k - 1) * u.y * v.x/d + k;
860  transform t = (tx, ty, txx, txy, tyx, tyy);
861  return t;
862 }
863 
864 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="scaleO(real)"><code></asyxml>*/
865 transform scaleO(real x)
866 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Homothety from the origin of the current coordinate system.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
867  return scale(x, (0, 0));
868 }
869 
870 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="xscaleO(real)"><code></asyxml>*/
871 transform xscaleO(real x)
872 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>xscale from the origin and relatively to the current coordinate system.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
873  return scale(x, (0, 0), (0, 1), (0, 0), (1, 0));
874 }
875 
876 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="yscaleO(real)"><code></asyxml>*/
877 transform yscaleO(real x)
878 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>yscale from the origin and relatively to the current coordinate system.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
879  return scale(x, (0, 0), (1, 0), (0, 0), (0, 1));
880 }
881 
882 /*<asyxml><struct signature="vector"><code></asyxml>*/
883 struct vector
884 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Like a point but casting to pair, adding etc does not take account
885  of the origin of the coordinate system.</documentation><property type = "point" signature="v"><code></asyxml>*/
886  point v;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Coordinates as a point (embed coordinate system and pair).</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
887 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
888 
889 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="cast(vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
890 point operator cast(vector v)
891 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast vector 'v' to point 'M' so that OM = v.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
892  return v.v;
893 }
894 
895 /*<asyxml><operator type = "vector" signature="cast(pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
896 vector operator cast(pair v)
897 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast pair to vector relatively to the current coordinate
898  system 'currentcoordsys'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
899  vector ov;
900  ov.v = point(currentcoordsys, v);
901  return ov;
902 }
903 
904 /*<asyxml><operator type = "vector" signature="cast(explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
905 vector operator cast(explicit point v)
906 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>A point can be interpreted like a vector using the code
907  '(vector)a_point'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
908  vector ov;
909  ov.v = v;
910  return ov;
911 }
912 
913 /*<asyxml><operator type = "pair" signature="cast(explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
914 pair operator cast(explicit vector v)
915 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast vector to pair (the coordinates of 'v' in the default coordinate system).</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
916  return locate(v.v) - v.v.coordsys.O;
917 }
918 
919 /*<asyxml><operator type = "align" signature="cast(vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
920 align operator cast(vector v)
921 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast vector to align.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
922  return (pair)v;
923 }
924 
925 /*<asyxml><function type="vector" signature="vector(coordsys, pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
926 vector vector(coordsys R = currentcoordsys, pair v)
927 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the vector of 'R' which has the coordinates 'v'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
928  vector ov;
929  ov.v = point(R, v);
930  return ov;
931 }
932 
933 /*<asyxml><function type="vector" signature="vector(point)"><code></asyxml>*/
934 vector vector(point M)
935 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the vector OM, where O is the origin of the coordinate system of 'M'.
936  Useful to write 'vector(P - M);' instead of '(vector)(P - M)'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
937  return M;
938 }
939 
940 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
941 point point(explicit vector u)
942 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point M so that OM = u, where O is the origin of the coordinate system of 'u'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
943  return u.v;
944 }
945 
946 /*<asyxml><function type="pair" signature="locate(explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
947 pair locate(explicit vector v)
948 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the coordinates of 'v' in the default coordinate system (like casting vector to pair).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
949  return (pair)v;
950 }
951 
952 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="show(Label,pen,arrowbar)"><code></asyxml>*/
953 void show(Label L, vector v, pen p = currentpen, arrowbar arrow = Arrow)
954 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw the vector v (from the origin of its coordinate system).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
955  coordsys R = v.v.coordsys;
956  draw(L, R.O--v.v, p, arrow);
957 }
958 
959 /*<asyxml><function type="vector" signature="changecoordsys(coordsys,vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
960 vector changecoordsys(coordsys R, vector v)
961 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the vector 'v' relatively to coordinate system 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
962  vector ov;
963  ov.v = point(R, (locate(v) + R.O)/R);
964  return ov;
965 }
966 
967 /*<asyxml><operator type = "vector" signature="*(real,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
968 vector operator *(real x, explicit vector v)
969 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide real * vector.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
970  return x * v.v;
971 }
972 
973 /*<asyxml><operator type = "vector" signature="/(explicit vector,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
974 vector operator /(explicit vector v, real x)
975 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide vector/real</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
976  return v.v/x;
977 }
978 
979 /*<asyxml><operator type = "vector" signature="*(transform t,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
980 vector operator *(transform t, explicit vector v)
981 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide transform * vector.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
982  return t * v.v;
983 }
984 
985 /*<asyxml><operator type = "vector" signature="*(explicit point,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
986 vector operator *(explicit point M, explicit vector v)
987 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide point * vector</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
988  return M * v.v;
989 }
990 
991 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="+(explicit point,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
992 point operator +(point M, explicit vector v)
993 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'M' shifted by 'v'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
994  return shift(locate(v)) * M;
995 }
996 
997 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="-(explicit point,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
998 point operator -(point M, explicit vector v)
999 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'M' shifted by '-v'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1000  return shift(-locate(v)) * M;
1001 }
1002 
1003 /*<asyxml><operator type = "vector" signature="-(explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1004 vector operator -(explicit vector v)
1005 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide -v.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1006  return -v.v;
1007 }
1008 
1009 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="+(explicit pair,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1010 point operator +(explicit pair m, explicit vector v)
1011 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The pair 'm' is supposed to be the coordinates of
1012  a point in the current coordinates system 'currentcoordsys'.
1013  Return this point shifted by the vector 'v'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1014  return locate(m) + v;
1015 }
1016 
1017 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="-(explicit pair,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1018 point operator -(explicit pair m, explicit vector v)
1019 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The pair 'm' is supposed to be the coordinates of
1020  a point in the current coordinates system 'currentcoordsys'.
1021  Return this point shifted by the vector '-v'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1022  return m + (-v);
1023 }
1024 
1025 /*<asyxml><operator type = "vector" signature="+(explicit vector,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1026 vector operator +(explicit vector v1, explicit vector v2)
1027 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide vector + vector.
1028  If the two vector haven't the same coordinate system, the returned
1029  vector is relative to the default coordinate system (without warning).</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1030  coordsys R = v1.v.coordsys;
1031  if(samecoordsys(false, v1, v2)){R = defaultcoordsys;}
1032  return vector(R, (locate(v1) + locate(v2))/R);
1033 }
1034 
1035 /*<asyxml><operator type = "vector" signature="-(explicit vector, explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1036 vector operator -(explicit vector v1, explicit vector v2)
1037 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide vector - vector.
1038  If the two vector haven't the same coordinate system, the returned
1039  vector is relative to the default coordinate system (without warning).</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1040  return v1 + (-v2);
1041 }
1042 
1043 /*<asyxml><operator type = "bool" signature="==(explicit vector,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1044 bool operator ==(explicit vector u, explicit vector v)
1045  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return true iff |u - v|<EPS.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1046  return abs(u - v) < EPS;
1047  }
1048 
1049 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="collinear(vector,vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1050 bool collinear(vector u, vector v)
1051 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'true' iff the vectors 'u' and 'v' are collinear.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1052  return abs(ypart((conj((pair)u) * (pair)v))) < EPS;
1053 }
1054 
1055 /*<asyxml><function type="vector" signature="unit(point)"><code></asyxml>*/
1056 vector unit(point M)
1057 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the unit vector according to the modulus of its coordinate system.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1058  return M/abs(M);
1059 }
1060 
1061 /*<asyxml><function type="vector" signature="unit(vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1062 vector unit(vector u)
1063 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the unit vector according to the modulus of its coordinate system.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1064  return u.v/abs(u.v);
1065 }
1066 
1067 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="degrees(vector,coordsys,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
1068 real degrees(vector v,
1069  coordsys R = v.v.coordsys,
1070  bool warn = true)
1071 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angle of 'v' (in degrees) relatively to 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1072  return (degrees(locate(v), warn) - degrees(R.i))%360;
1073 }
1074 
1075 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="angle(vector,coordsys,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
1076 real angle(explicit vector v,
1077  coordsys R = v.v.coordsys,
1078  bool warn = true)
1079 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angle of 'v' (in radians) relatively to 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1080  return radians(degrees(v, R, warn));
1081 }
1082 
1083 /*<asyxml><function type="vector" signature="conj(explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1084 vector conj(explicit vector u)
1085 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Conjugate.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1086  return conj(u.v);
1087 }
1088 
1089 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="rotate(explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1090 transform rotate(explicit vector dir)
1091 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>A rotation in the direction 'dir' limited to [-90, 90]
1092  This is useful for rotating text along a line in the direction dir.
1093  rotate(explicit point dir) is also defined.
1094  </documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1095  return rotate(locate(dir));
1096 }
1097 transform rotate(explicit point dir){return rotate(locate(vector(dir)));}
1098 // *......................COORDINATES......................*
1099 // *=======================================================*
1100 
1101 // *=======================================================*
1102 // *.........................BASES.........................*
1103 /*<asyxml><variable type="point" signature="origin"><code></asyxml>*/
1104 point origin = point(defaultcoordsys, (0, 0));/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The origin of the current coordinate system.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
1105 
1106 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="origin(coordsys)"><code></asyxml>*/
1107 point origin(coordsys R = currentcoordsys)
1108 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the origin of the coordinate system 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1109  return point(R, (0, 0)); //use automatic casting;
1110 }
1111 
1112 /*<asyxml><variable type="real" signature="linemargin"><code></asyxml>*/
1113 real linemargin = 0;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Margin used to draw lines.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
1114 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="linemargin()"><code></asyxml>*/
1115 real linemargin()
1116 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the margin used to draw lines.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1117  return linemargin;
1118 }
1119 
1120 /*<asyxml><variable type="pen" signature="addpenline"><code></asyxml>*/
1121 pen addpenline = squarecap;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Add this property to the drawing pen of "finish" lines.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
1122 pen addpenline(pen p) {
1123  return addpenline + p;
1124 }
1125 
1126 /*<asyxml><variable type="pen" signature="addpenarc"><code></asyxml>*/
1127 pen addpenarc = squarecap;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Add this property to the drawing pen of arcs.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
1128 pen addpenarc(pen p) {return addpenarc + p;}
1129 
1130 /*<asyxml><variable type="string" signature="defaultmassformat"><code></asyxml>*/
1131 string defaultmassformat = "$\left(%L;%.4g\right)$";/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Format used to construct the default label of masses.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
1132 
1133 /*<asyxml><function type="int" signature="sgnd(real)"><code></asyxml>*/
1134 int sgnd(real x)
1135 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the -1 if x < 0, 1 if x >= 0.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1136  return (x == 0) ? 1 : sgn(x);
1137 }
1138 int sgnd(int x)
1139 {
1140  return (x == 0) ? 1 : sgn(x);
1141 }
1142 
1143 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="defined(pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
1144 bool defined(point P)
1145 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return true iff the coordinates of 'P' are finite.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1146  return finite(P.coordinates);
1147 }
1148 
1149 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="onpath(picture,path,point,pen)"><code></asyxml>*/
1150 bool onpath(picture pic = currentpicture, path g, point M, pen p = currentpen)
1151 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return true iff 'M' is on the path drawn with the pen 'p' in 'pic'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1152  transform t = inverse(pic.calculateTransform());
1153  return intersect(g, shift(locate(M)) * scale(linewidth(p)/2) * t * unitcircle).length > 0;
1154 }
1155 
1156 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="sameside(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
1157 bool sameside(point M, point N, point O)
1158 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'true' iff 'M' and 'N' are same side of the point 'O'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1159  pair m = M, n = N, o = O;
1160  return dot(m - o, n - o) >= -epsgeo;
1161 }
1162 
1163 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="between(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
1164 bool between(point M, point O, point N)
1165 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'true' iff 'O' is between 'M' and 'N'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1166  return (!sameside(N, M, O) || M == O || N == O);
1167 }
1168 
1169 
1170 typedef path pathModifier(path);
1171 pathModifier NoModifier = new path(path g){return g;};
1172 
1173 private void Drawline(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L = "", pair P, bool dirP = true, pair Q, bool dirQ = true,
1174  align align = NoAlign, pen p = currentpen,
1175  arrowbar arrow = None,
1176  Label legend = "", marker marker = nomarker,
1177  pathModifier pathModifier = NoModifier)
1178 {/* Add the two parameters 'dirP' and 'dirQ' to the native routine
1179  'drawline' of the module 'math'.
1180  Segment [PQ] will be prolonged in direction of P if 'dirP = true', in
1181  direction of Q if 'dirQ = true'.
1182  If 'dirP = dirQ = true', the behavior is that of the native 'drawline'.
1183  Add all the other parameters of 'Draw'.*/
1184  pic.add(new void (frame f, transform t, transform T, pair m, pair M) {
1185  picture opic;
1186  // Reduce the bounds by the size of the pen.
1187  m -= min(p) - (linemargin(), linemargin()); M -= max(p) + (linemargin(), linemargin());
1188 
1189  // Calculate the points and direction vector in the transformed space.
1190  t = t * T;
1191  pair z = t * P;
1192  pair q = t * Q;
1193  pair v = q - z;
1194  // path g;
1195  pair ptp, ptq;
1196  real cp = dirP ? 1:0;
1197  real cq = dirQ ? 1:0;
1198  // Handle horizontal and vertical lines.
1199  if(v.x == 0) {
1200  if(m.x <= z.x && z.x <= M.x)
1201  if (dot(v, m - z) < 0) {
1202  ptp = (z.x, z.y + cp * (m.y - z.y));
1203  ptq = (z.x, q.y + cq * (M.y - q.y));
1204  } else {
1205  ptq = (z.x, q.y + cq * (m.y - q.y));
1206  ptp = (z.x, z.y + cp * (M.y - z.y));
1207  }
1208  } else if(v.y == 0) {
1209  if (dot(v, m - z) < 0) {
1210  ptp = (z.x + cp * (m.x - z.x), z.y);
1211  ptq = (q.x + cq * (M.x - q.x), z.y);
1212  } else {
1213  ptq = (q.x + cq * (m.x - q.x), z.y);
1214  ptp = (z.x + cp * (M.x - z.x), z.y);
1215  }
1216  } else {
1217  // Calculate the maximum and minimum t values allowed for the
1218  // parametric equation z + t * v
1219  real mx = (m.x - z.x)/v.x, Mx = (M.x - z.x)/v.x;
1220  real my = (m.y - z.y)/v.y, My = (M.y - z.y)/v.y;
1221  real tmin = max(v.x > 0 ? mx : Mx, v.y > 0 ? my : My);
1222  real tmax = min(v.x > 0 ? Mx : mx, v.y > 0 ? My : my);
1223  pair pmin = z + tmin * v;
1224  pair pmax = z + tmax * v;
1225  if(tmin <= tmax) {
1226  ptp = z + cp * tmin * v;
1227  ptq = z + (cq == 0 ? v:tmax * v);
1228  }
1229  }
1230  path g = ptp--ptq;
1231  if (length(g)>0)
1232  {
1233  if(L.s != "") {
1234  Label lL = L.copy();
1235  if(L.defaultposition) lL.position(Relative(.9));
1236  lL.p(p);
1237  lL.out(opic, g);
1238  }
1239  g = pathModifier(g);
1240  if(linetype(p).length == 0){
1241  pair m = midpoint(g);
1242  pen tp;
1243  tp = dirP ? p : addpenline(p);
1244  draw(opic, pathModifier(m--ptp), tp);
1245  tp = dirQ ? p : addpenline(p);
1246  draw(opic, pathModifier(m--ptq), tp);
1247  } else {
1248  draw(opic, g, p);
1249  }
1250  marker.markroutine(opic, marker.f, g);
1251  arrow(opic, g, p, NoMargin);
1252  add(f, opic.fit());
1253  }
1254  });
1255 }
1256 
1257 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="clipdraw(picture,Label,path,align,pen,arrowbar,arrowbar,real,real,Label,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
1258 void clipdraw(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L = "", path g,
1259  align align = NoAlign, pen p = currentpen,
1260  arrowbar arrow = None, arrowbar bar = None,
1261  real xmargin = 0, real ymargin = xmargin,
1262  Label legend = "", marker marker = nomarker)
1263 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw the path 'g' on 'pic' clipped to the bounding box of 'pic'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1264  if(L.s != "") {
1265  picture tmp;
1266  label(tmp, L, g, p);
1267  add(pic, tmp);
1268  }
1269  pic.add(new void (frame f, transform t, transform T, pair m, pair M) {
1270  // Reduce the bounds by the size of the pen and the margins.
1271  m += min(p) + (xmargin, ymargin); M -= max(p) + (xmargin, ymargin);
1272  path bound = box(m, M);
1273  picture tmp;
1274  draw(tmp, "", t * T * g, align, p, arrow, bar, NoMargin, legend, marker);
1275  clip(tmp, bound);
1276  add(f, tmp.fit());
1277  });
1278 }
1279 
1280 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="distance(picture pic,Label,point,point,bool,real,pen,pen,arrow)"><code></asyxml>*/
1281 void distance(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L = "", point A, point B,
1282  bool rotated = true, real offset = 3mm,
1283  pen p = currentpen, pen joinpen = invisible,
1284  arrowbar arrow = Arrows(NoFill))
1285 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw arrow between A and B (from FAQ).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1286  pair A = A, B = B;
1287  path g = A--B;
1288  transform Tp = shift(-offset * unit(B - A) * I);
1289  pic.add(new void(frame f, transform t) {
1290  picture opic;
1291  path G = Tp * t * g;
1292  transform id = identity();
1293  transform T = rotated ? rotate(B - A) : id;
1294  Label L = L.copy();
1295  L.align(L.align, Center);
1296  if(abs(ypart((conj(A - B) * L.align.dir))) < epsgeo && L.filltype == NoFill)
1297  L.filltype = UnFill(1);
1298  draw(opic, T * L, G, p, arrow, Bars, PenMargins);
1299  pair Ap = t * A, Bp = t * B;
1300  draw(opic, (Ap--Tp * Ap)^^(Bp--Tp * Bp), joinpen);
1301  add(f, opic.fit());
1302  }, true);
1303  pic.addBox(min(g), max(g), Tp * min(p), Tp * max(p));
1304 }
1305 
1306 /*<asyxml><variable type="real" signature="perpfactor"><code></asyxml>*/
1307 real perpfactor = 1;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Factor for drawing perpendicular symbol.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
1308 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="perpendicularmark(picture,point,explicit pair,explicit pair,real,pen,margin,filltype)"><code></asyxml>*/
1309 void perpendicularmark(picture pic = currentpicture, point z,
1310  explicit pair align,
1311  explicit pair dir = E, real size = 0,
1312  pen p = currentpen,
1313  margin margin = NoMargin,
1314  filltype filltype = NoFill)
1315 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw a perpendicular symbol at z aligned in the direction align
1316  relative to the path z--z + dir.
1317  dir(45 + n * 90), where n in N*, are common values for 'align'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1318  p = squarecap + miterjoin + p;
1319  if(size == 0) size = perpfactor * 3mm + linewidth(p) / 2;
1320  frame apic;
1321  pair d1 = size * align * unit(dir) * dir(-45);
1322  pair d2 = I * d1;
1323  path g = d1--d1 + d2--d2;
1324  g = margin(g, p).g;
1325  draw(apic, g, p);
1326  if(filltype != NoFill) filltype.fill(apic, (relpoint(g, 0) - relpoint(g, 0.5)+
1327  relpoint(g, 1))--g--cycle, p + solid);
1328  add(pic, apic, locate(z));
1329 }
1330 
1331 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="perpendicularmark(picture,point,vector,vector,real,pen,margin,filltype)"><code></asyxml>*/
1332 void perpendicularmark(picture pic = currentpicture, point z,
1333  vector align,
1334  vector dir = E, real size = 0,
1335  pen p = currentpen,
1336  margin margin = NoMargin,
1337  filltype filltype = NoFill)
1338 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw a perpendicular symbol at z aligned in the direction align
1339  relative to the path z--z + dir.
1340  dir(45 + n * 90), where n in N, are common values for 'align'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1341  perpendicularmark(pic, z, (pair)align, (pair)dir, size,
1342  p, margin, filltype);
1343 }
1344 
1345 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="perpendicularmark(picture,point,explicit pair,path,real,pen,margin,filltype)"><code></asyxml>*/
1346 void perpendicularmark(picture pic = currentpicture, point z, explicit pair align, path g,
1347  real size = 0, pen p = currentpen,
1348  margin margin = NoMargin,
1349  filltype filltype = NoFill)
1350 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw a perpendicular symbol at z aligned in the direction align
1351  relative to the path z--z + dir(g, 0).
1352  dir(45 + n * 90), where n in N, are common values for 'align'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1353  perpendicularmark(pic, z, align, dir(g, 0), size, p, margin, filltype);
1354 }
1355 
1356 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="perpendicularmark(picture,point,vector,path,real,pen,margin,filltype)"><code></asyxml>*/
1357 void perpendicularmark(picture pic = currentpicture, point z, vector align, path g,
1358  real size = 0, pen p = currentpen,
1359  margin margin = NoMargin,
1360  filltype filltype = NoFill)
1361 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw a perpendicular symbol at z aligned in the direction align
1362  relative to the path z--z + dir(g, 0).
1363  dir(45 + n * 90), where n in N, are common values for 'align'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1364  perpendicularmark(pic, z, (pair)align, dir(g, 0), size, p, margin, filltype);
1365 }
1366 
1367 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="markrightangle(picture,point,point,point,real,pen,margin,filltype)"><code></asyxml>*/
1368 void markrightangle(picture pic = currentpicture, point A, point O,
1369  point B, real size = 0, pen p = currentpen,
1370  margin margin = NoMargin,
1371  filltype filltype = NoFill)
1372 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Mark the angle AOB with a perpendicular symbol.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1373  pair Ap = A, Bp = B, Op = O;
1374  pair dir = Ap - Op;
1375  real a1 = degrees(dir);
1376  pair align = rotate(-a1) * dir(Op--Ap, Op--Bp);
1377  perpendicularmark(pic = pic, z = O, align = align,
1378  dir = dir, size = size, p = p,
1379  margin = margin, filltype = filltype);
1380 }
1381 
1382 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="simeq(point,point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
1383 bool simeq(point A, point B, real fuzz = epsgeo)
1384 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return true iff abs(A - B) < fuzz.
1385  This routine is used internally to know if two points are equal, in particular by the operator == in 'point == point'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1386  return (abs(A - B) < fuzz);
1387 }
1388 bool simeq(point a, real b, real fuzz = epsgeo)
1389 {
1390  coordsys R = a.coordsys;
1391  return (abs(a - point(R, ((pair)b)/R)) < fuzz);
1392 }
1393 
1394 /*<asyxml><function type="pair" signature="attract(pair,path,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
1395 pair attract(pair m, path g, real fuzz = 0)
1396 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the nearest point (A PAIR) of 'm' which is on the path g.
1397  'fuzz' is the argument 'fuzz' of 'intersect'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1398  if(intersect(m, g, fuzz).length > 0) return m;
1399  pair p;
1400  real step = 1, r = 0;
1401  real[] t;
1402  static real eps = sqrt(realEpsilon);
1403  do {// Find a radius for intersection
1404  r += step;
1405  t = intersect(shift(m) * scale(r) * unitcircle, g);
1406  } while(t.length <= 0);
1407  p = point(g, t[1]);
1408  real rm = 0, rM = r;
1409  while(rM - rm > eps) {
1410  r = (rm + rM)/2;
1411  t = intersect(shift(m) * scale(r) * unitcircle, g, fuzz);
1412  if(t.length <= 0) {
1413  rm = r;
1414  } else {
1415  rM = r;
1416  p = point(g, t[1]);
1417  }
1418  }
1419  return p;
1420 }
1421 
1422 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="attract(point,path,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
1423 point attract(point M, path g, real fuzz = 0)
1424 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the nearest point (A POINT) of 'M' which is on the path g.
1425  'fuzz' is the argument 'fuzz' of 'intersect'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1426  return point(M.coordsys, attract(locate(M), g)/M.coordsys);
1427 }
1428 
1429 /*<asyxml><function type="real[]" signature="intersect(path,explicit pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
1430 real[] intersect(path g, explicit pair p, real fuzz = 0)
1431 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1432  fuzz = fuzz <= 0 ? sqrt(realEpsilon) : fuzz;
1433  real[] or;
1434  real r = realEpsilon;
1435  do{
1436  or = intersect(g, shift(p) * scale(r) * unitcircle, fuzz);
1437  r *= 2;
1438  } while(or.length == 0);
1439  return or;
1440 }
1441 
1442 /*<asyxml><function type="real[]" signature="intersect(path,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
1443 real[] intersect(path g, explicit point P, real fuzz = epsgeo)
1444 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1445  return intersect(g, locate(P), fuzz);
1446 }
1447 // *.........................BASES.........................*
1448 // *=======================================================*
1449 
1450 // *=======================================================*
1451 // *.........................LINES.........................*
1452 /*<asyxml><struct signature="line"><code></asyxml>*/
1453 struct line
1454 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>This structure provides the objects line, semi - line and segment oriented from A to B.
1455  All the calculus with this structure will be as exact as Asymptote can do.
1456  For a full precision, you must not cast 'line' to 'path' excepted for drawing routines.</documentation></asyxml>*/
1457  /*<asyxml><property type = "point" signature="A,B"><code></asyxml>*/
1458  restricted point A,B;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Two line's points with same coordinate system.</documentation></property><property type = "bool" signature="extendA,extendB"><code></asyxml>*/
1459  bool extendA,extendB;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>If true,extend 'l' in direction of A (resp. B).</documentation></property><property type = "vector" signature="u,v"><code></asyxml>*/
1460  restricted vector u,v;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>u = unit(AB) = direction vector,v = normal vector.</documentation></property><property type = "real" signature="a,b,c"><code></asyxml>*/
1461  restricted real a,b,c;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Coefficients of the equation ax + by + c = 0 in the coordinate system of 'A'.</documentation></property><property type = "real" signature="slope,origin"><code></asyxml>*/
1462  restricted real slope, origin;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Slope and ordinate at the origin.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
1463  /*<asyxml><method type = "line" signature="copy()"><code></asyxml>*/
1464  line copy()
1465  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Copy a line in a new instance.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
1466  line l = new line;
1467  l.A = A;
1468  l.B = B;
1469  l.a = a;
1470  l.b = b;
1471  l.c = c;
1472  l.slope = slope;
1473  l.origin = origin;
1474  l.u = u;
1475  l.v = v;
1476  l.extendA = extendA;
1477  l.extendB = extendB;
1478  return l;
1479  }
1480 
1481  /*<asyxml><method type = "void" signature="init(point,bool,point,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
1482  void init(point A, bool extendA = true, point B, bool extendB = true)
1483  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Initialize line.
1484  If 'extendA' is true, the "line" is infinite in the direction of A.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
1485  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(A, B);
1486  this.A = P[0];
1487  this.B = P[1];
1488  this.a = B.y - A.y;
1489  this.b = A.x - B.x;
1490  this.c = A.y * B.x - A.x * B.y;
1491  this.slope= (this.b == 0) ? infinity : -this.a/this.b;
1492  this.origin = (this.b == 0) ? (this.c == 0) ? 0:infinity : -this.c/this.b;
1493  this.u = unit(P[1]-P[0]);
1494  // int tmp = sgnd(this.slope);
1495  // this.u = (dot((pair)this.u, N) >= 0) ? tmp * this.u : -tmp * this.u;
1496  this.v = rotate(90, point(P[0].coordsys, (0, 0))) * this.u;
1497  this.extendA = extendA;
1498  this.extendB = extendB;
1499  }
1500 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
1501 
1502 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="line(point,bool,point,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
1503 line line(point A, bool extendA = true, point B, bool extendB = true)
1504 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the line passing through 'A' and 'B'.
1505  If 'extendA' is true, the "line" is infinite in the direction of A.
1506  A "line" can be half-line or segment.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1507  if (A == B) abort("line: the points must be distinct.");
1508  line l;
1509  l.init(A, extendA, B, extendB);
1510  return l;
1511 }
1512 
1513 /*<asyxml><struct signature="segment"><code></asyxml>*/
1514 struct segment
1515 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><look href = "struct line"/>.</documentation></asyxml>*/
1516  restricted point A, B;// Extremity.
1517  restricted vector u, v;// u = direction vector, v = normal vector.
1518  restricted real a, b, c;// Coefficients of the equation ax + by + c = 0
1519  restricted real slope, origin;
1520  segment copy()
1521  {
1522  segment s = new segment;
1523  s.A = A;
1524  s.B = B;
1525  s.a = a;
1526  s.b = b;
1527  s.c = c;
1528  s.slope = slope;
1529  s.origin = origin;
1530  s.u = u;
1531  s.v = v;
1532  return s;
1533  }
1534 
1535  void init(point A, point B)
1536  {
1537  line l;
1538  l.init(A, B);
1539  this.A = l.A; this.B = l.B;
1540  this.a = l.a; this.b = l.b; this.c = l.c;
1541  this.slope = l.slope; this.origin = l.origin;
1542  this.u = l.u; this.v = l.v;
1543  }
1544 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
1545 
1546 /*<asyxml><function type="segment" signature="segment(point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
1547 segment segment(point A, point B)
1548 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the segment whose the extremities are A and B.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1549  segment s;
1550  s.init(A, B);
1551  return s;
1552 }
1553 
1554 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="length(segment)"><code></asyxml>*/
1555 real length(segment s)
1556 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the length of 's'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1557  return abs(s.A - s.B);
1558 }
1559 
1560 /*<asyxml><operator type = "line" signature="cast(segment)"><code></asyxml>*/
1561 line operator cast(segment s)
1562 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>A segment is casted to a "finite line".</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1563  return line(s.A, false, s.B, false);
1564 }
1565 
1566 /*<asyxml><operator type = "segment" signature="cast(line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1567 segment operator cast(line l)
1568 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast line 'l' to segment [l.A l.B].</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1569  return segment(l.A, l.B);
1570 }
1571 
1572 path operator ecast(segment s)
1573 {
1574  return s.A -- s.B;
1575 }
1576 
1577 /*<asyxml><operator type = "line" signature="*(transform,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1578 line operator *(transform t, line l)
1579 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide transform * line</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1580  return line(t * l.A, l.extendA, t * l.B, l.extendB);
1581 }
1582 /*<asyxml><operator type = "line" signature="/(line,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
1583 line operator /(line l, real x)
1584 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide l/x.
1585  Return the line passing through l.A/x and l.B/x.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1586  return line(l.A/x, l.extendA, l.B/x, l.extendB);
1587 }
1588 line operator /(line l, int x){return line(l.A/x, l.B/x);}
1589 /*<asyxml><operator type = "line" signature="*(real,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1590 line operator *(real x, line l)
1591 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide x * l.
1592  Return the line passing through x * l.A and x * l.B.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1593  return line(x * l.A, l.extendA, x * l.B, l.extendB);
1594 }
1595 line operator *(int x, line l){return line(x * l.A, l.extendA, x * l.B, l.extendB);}
1596 
1597 /*<asyxml><operator type = "line" signature="*(point,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1598 line operator *(point M, line l)
1599 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide point * line.
1600  Return the line passing through unit(M) * l.A and unit(M) * l.B.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1601  return line(unit(M) * l.A, l.extendA, unit(M) * l.B, l.extendB);
1602 }
1603 /*<asyxml><operator type = "line" signature="+(line,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
1604 line operator +(line l, vector u)
1605 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide line + vector (and so line + point).
1606  Return the line 'l' shifted by 'u'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1607  return line(l.A + u, l.extendA, l.B + u, l.extendB);
1608 }
1609 /*<asyxml><operator type = "line" signature="-(line,vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1610 line operator -(line l, vector u)
1611 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide line - vector (and so line - point).
1612  Return the line 'l' shifted by '-u'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1613  return line(l.A - u, l.extendA, l.B - u, l.extendB);
1614 }
1615 
1616 /*<asyxml><operator type = "line[]" signature="^^(line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1617 line[] operator ^^(line l1, line l2)
1618 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide line^^line.
1619  Return the line array {l1, l2}.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1620  line[] ol;
1621  ol.push(l1); ol.push(l2);
1622  return ol;
1623 }
1624 
1625 /*<asyxml><operator type = "line[]" signature="^^(line,line[])"><code></asyxml>*/
1626 line[] operator ^^(line l1, line[] l2)
1627 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide line^^line[].
1628  Return the line array {l1, l2[0], l2[1]...}.
1629  line[]^^line is also defined.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1630  line[] ol;
1631  ol.push(l1);
1632  for (int i = 0; i < l2.length; ++i) {
1633  ol.push(l2[i]);
1634  }
1635  return ol;
1636 }
1637 line[] operator ^^(line[] l2, line l1)
1638 {
1639  line[] ol = l2;
1640  ol.push(l1);
1641  return ol;
1642 }
1643 
1644 /*<asyxml><operator type = "line[]" signature="^^(line,line[])"><code></asyxml>*/
1645 line[] operator ^^(line l1[], line[] l2)
1646 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide line[]^^line[].
1647  Return the line array {l1[0], l1[1], ..., l2[0], l2[1], ...}.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1648  line[] ol = l1;
1649  for (int i = 0; i < l2.length; ++i) {
1650  ol.push(l2[i]);
1651  }
1652  return ol;
1653 }
1654 
1655 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="sameside(point,point,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1656 bool sameside(point M, point P, line l)
1657 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'true' iff 'M' and 'N' are same side of the line (or on the line) 'l'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1658  pair A = l.A, B = l.B, m = M, p = P;
1659  pair mil = (A + B)/2;
1660  pair mA = rotate(90, mil) * A;
1661  pair mB = rotate(-90, mil) * A;
1662  return (abs(m - mA) <= abs(m - mB)) == (abs(p - mA) <= abs(p - mB));
1663  // transform proj = projection(l.A, l.B);
1664  // point Mp = proj * M;
1665  // point Pp = proj * P;
1666  // dot(Mp);dot(Pp);
1667  // return dot(locate(Mp - M), locate(Pp - P)) >= 0;
1668 }
1669 
1670 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="line(segment)"><code></asyxml>*/
1671 line line(segment s)
1672 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the line passing through 's.A'
1673  and 's.B'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1674  return line(s.A, s.B);
1675 }
1676 /*<asyxml><function type="segment" signature="segment(line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1677 segment segment(line l)
1678 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the segment whose extremities
1679  are 'l.A' and 'l.B'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1680  return segment(l.A, l.B);
1681 }
1682 
1683 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="midpoint(segment)"><code></asyxml>*/
1684 point midpoint(segment s)
1685 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the midpoint of 's'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1686  return 0.5 * (s.A + s.B);
1687 }
1688 
1689 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="write(line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1690 void write(explicit line l)
1691 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Write some informations about 'l'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1692  write("A = "+(string)((pair)l.A));
1693  write("Extend A = "+(l.extendA ? "true" : "false"));
1694  write("B = "+(string)((pair)l.B));
1695  write("Extend B = "+(l.extendB ? "true" : "false"));
1696  write("u = "+(string)((pair)l.u));
1697  write("v = "+(string)((pair)l.v));
1698  write("a = "+(string) l.a);
1699  write("b = "+(string) l.b);
1700  write("c = "+(string) l.c);
1701  write("slope = "+(string) l.slope);
1702  write("origin = "+(string) l.origin);
1703 }
1704 
1705 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="write(explicit segment)"><code></asyxml>*/
1706 void write(explicit segment s)
1707 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Write some informations about 's'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1708  write("A = "+(string)((pair)s.A));
1709  write("B = "+(string)((pair)s.B));
1710  write("u = "+(string)((pair)s.u));
1711  write("v = "+(string)((pair)s.v));
1712  write("a = "+(string) s.a);
1713  write("b = "+(string) s.b);
1714  write("c = "+(string) s.c);
1715  write("slope = "+(string) s.slope);
1716  write("origin = "+(string) s.origin);
1717 }
1718 
1719 /*<asyxml><operator type = "bool" signature="==(line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1720 bool operator ==(line l1, line l2)
1721  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide the test 'line == line'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1722  return (collinear(l1.u, l2.u) &&
1723  abs(ypart((locate(l1.A) - locate(l1.B))/(locate(l1.A) - locate(l2.B)))) < epsgeo &&
1724  l1.extendA == l2.extendA && l1.extendB == l2.extendB);
1725  }
1726 
1727 /*<asyxml><operator type = "bool" signature="!=(line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1728 bool operator !=(line l1, line l2)
1729 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide the test 'line != line'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1730  return !(l1 == l2);
1731 }
1732 
1733 /*<asyxml><operator type = "bool" signature="@(point,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1734 bool operator @(point m, line l)
1735 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide the test 'point @ line'.
1736  Return true iff 'm' is on the 'l'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
1737  point M = changecoordsys(l.A.coordsys, m);
1738  if (abs(l.a * M.x + l.b * M.y + l.c) >= epsgeo) return false;
1739  if (l.extendA && l.extendB) return true;
1740  if (!l.extendA && !l.extendB) return between(l.A, M, l.B);
1741  if (l.extendA) return sameside(M, l.A, l.B);
1742  return sameside(M, l.B, l.A);
1743 }
1744 
1745 /*<asyxml><function type="coordsys" signature="coordsys(line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1746 coordsys coordsys(line l)
1747 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the coordinate system in which 'l' is defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1748  return l.A.coordsys;
1749 }
1750 
1751 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="reverse(line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1752 line reverse(line l)
1753 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Permute the points 'A' and 'B' of 'l' and so its orientation.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1754  return line(l.B, l.extendB, l.A, l.extendA);
1755 }
1756 
1757 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="extend(line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1758 line extend(line l)
1759 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the infinite line passing through 'l.A' and 'l.B'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1760  line ol = l.copy();
1761  ol.extendA = true;
1762  ol.extendB = true;
1763  return ol;
1764 }
1765 
1766 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="complementary(explicit line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1767 line complementary(explicit line l)
1768 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the complementary of a half-line with respect of
