1769  the full line 'l'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1770  if (l.extendA && l.extendB)
1771  abort("complementary: the parameter is not a half-line.");
1772  point origin = l.extendA ? l.B : l.A;
1773  point ptdir = l.extendA ?
1774  rotate(180, l.B) * l.A : rotate(180, l.A) * l.B;
1775  return line(origin, false, ptdir);
1776 }
1777 
1778 /*<asyxml><function type="line[]" signature="complementary(explicit segment)"><code></asyxml>*/
1779 line[] complementary(explicit segment s)
1780 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the two half-lines of origin 's.A' and 's.B' respectively.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1781  line[] ol = new line[2];
1782  ol[0] = complementary(line(s.A, false, s.B));
1783  ol[1] = complementary(line(s.A, s.B, false));
1784  return ol;
1785 }
1786 
1787 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="Ox(coordsys)"><code></asyxml>*/
1788 line Ox(coordsys R = currentcoordsys)
1789 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the x-axis of 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1790  return line(point(R, (0, 0)), point(R, E));
1791 }
1792 /*<asyxml><constant type = "line" signature="Ox"><code></asyxml>*/
1793 restricted line Ox = Ox();/*<asyxml></code><documentation>the x-axis of
1794  the default coordinate system.</documentation></constant></asyxml>*/
1795 
1796 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="Oy(coordsys)"><code></asyxml>*/
1797 line Oy(coordsys R = currentcoordsys)
1798 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the y-axis of 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1799  return line(point(R, (0, 0)), point(R, N));
1800 }
1801 /*<asyxml><constant type = "line" signature="Oy"><code></asyxml>*/
1802 restricted line Oy = Oy();/*<asyxml></code><documentation>the y-axis of
1803  the default coordinate system.</documentation></constant></asyxml>*/
1804 
1805 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="line(real,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
1806 line line(real a, point A = point(currentcoordsys, (0, 0)))
1807 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the line passing through 'A' with an
1808  angle (in the coordinate system of A) 'a' in degrees.
1809  line(point, real) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1810  return line(A, A + point(A.coordsys, A.coordsys.polar(1, radians(a))));
1811 }
1812 line line(point A = point(currentcoordsys, (0, 0)), real a)
1813 {
1814  return line(a, A);
1815 }
1816 line line(int a, point A = point(currentcoordsys, (0, 0)))
1817 {
1818  return line((real)a, A);
1819 }
1820 
1821 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="line(coordsys,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
1822 line line(coordsys R = currentcoordsys, real slope, real origin)
1823 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the line defined by slope and y-intercept relative to 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1824  if (slope == infinity || slope == -infinity)
1825  abort("The slope is infinite. Please, use the routine 'vline'.");
1826  return line(point(R, (0, origin)), point(R, (1, origin + slope)));
1827 }
1828 
1829 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="line(coordsys,real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
1830 line line(coordsys R = currentcoordsys, real a, real b, real c)
1831 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Retrun the line defined by equation relative to 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1832  if (a == 0 && b == 0) abort("line: inconsistent equation...");
1833  pair M;
1834  M = (a == 0) ? (0, -c/b) : (-c/a, 0);
1835  return line(point(R, M), point(R, M + (-b, a)));
1836 }
1837 
1838 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="vline(coordsys)"><code></asyxml>*/
1839 line vline(coordsys R = currentcoordsys)
1840 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return a vertical line in 'R' passing through the origin of 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1841  point P = point(R, (0, 0));
1842  point PP = point(R, (R.O + N)/R);
1843  return line(P, PP);
1844 }
1845 /*<asyxml><constant type = "line" signature="vline"><code></asyxml>*/
1846 restricted line vline = vline();/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The vertical line in the current coordinate system passing
1847  through the origin of this system.</documentation></constant></asyxml>*/
1848 
1849 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="hline(coordsys)"><code></asyxml>*/
1850 line hline(coordsys R = currentcoordsys)
1851 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return a horizontal line in 'R' passing through the origin of 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1852  point P = point(R, (0, 0));
1853  point PP = point(R, (R.O + E)/R);
1854  return line(P, PP);
1855 }
1856 /*<asyxml><constant type = "line" signature="hline"><code></asyxml>*/
1857 line hline = hline();/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The horizontal line in the current coordinate system passing
1858  through the origin of this system.</documentation></constant></asyxml>*/
1859 
1860 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="changecoordsys(coordsys,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1861 line changecoordsys(coordsys R, line l)
1862 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the line 'l' in the coordinate system 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1863  point A = changecoordsys(R, l.A);
1864  point B = changecoordsys(R, l.B);
1865  return line(A, B);
1866 }
1867 
1868 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="scale(real,line,line,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
1869 transform scale(real k, line l1, line l2, bool safe = false)
1870 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the dilatation with respect to
1871  'l1' in the direction of 'l2'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1872  return scale(k, l1.A, l1.B, l2.A, l2.B, safe);
1873 }
1874 
1875 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="reflect(line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1876 transform reflect(line l)
1877 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the reflect about the line 'l'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1878  return reflect((pair)l.A, (pair)l.B);
1879 }
1880 
1881 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="reflect(line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1882 transform reflect(line l1, line l2, bool safe = false)
1883 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the reflect about the line
1884  'l1' in the direction of 'l2'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1885  return scale(-1.0, l1, l2, safe);
1886 }
1887 
1888 
1889 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(line,path)"><code></asyxml>*/
1890 point[] intersectionpoints(line l, path g)
1891 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return all points of intersection of the line 'l' with the path 'g'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1892  // TODO utiliser la version 1.44 de intersections(path g, pair p, pair q)
1893  // real [] t = intersections(g, l.A, l.B);
1894  // coordsys R = coordsys(l);
1895  // return sequence(new point(int n){return point(R, point(g, t[n])/R);}, t.length);
1896  real [] t;
1897  pair[] op;
1898  pair A = l.A;
1899  pair B = l.B;
1900  real dy = B.y - A.y,
1901  dx = A.x - B.x,
1902  lg = length(g);
1903 
1904  for (int i = 0; i < lg; ++i)
1905  {
1906  pair z0 = point(g, i),
1907  z1 = point(g, i + 1),
1908  c0 = postcontrol(g, i),
1909  c1 = precontrol(g, i + 1),
1910  t3 = z1 - z0 - 3 * c1 + 3 * c0,
1911  t2 = 3 * z0 + 3 * c1 - 6 * c0,
1912  t1 = 3 * c0 - 3z0;
1913  real a = dy * t3.x + dx * t3.y,
1914  b = dy * t2.x + dx * t2.y,
1915  c = dy * t1.x + dx * t1.y,
1916  d = dy * z0.x + dx * z0.y + A.y * B.x - A.x * B.y;
1917 
1918  t = cubicroots(a, b, c, d);
1919  for (int j = 0; j < t.length; ++j)
1920  if (
1921  t[j]>=0
1922  && (
1923  t[j]<1
1924  || (
1925  t[j] == 1
1926  && (i == lg - 1)
1927  && !cyclic(g)
1928  )
1929  )
1930  ) {
1931  op.push(point(g, i + t[j]));
1932  }
1933  }
1934 
1935  point[] opp;
1936  for (int i = 0; i < op.length; ++i)
1937  opp.push(point(coordsys(l), op[i]/coordsys(l)));
1938  return opp;
1939 }
1940 
1941 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="intersectionpoint(line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1942 point intersectionpoint(line l1, line l2)
1943 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of intersection of line 'l1' with 'l2'.
1944  If 'l1' and 'l2' have an infinity or none point of intersection,
1945  this routine return (infinity, infinity).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1946  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(l1.A, l1.B, l2.A, l2.B);
1947  coordsys R = P[0].coordsys;
1948  pair p = extension(P[0], P[1], P[2], P[3]);
1949  if(finite(p)){
1950  point p = point(R, p/R);
1951  if (p @ l1 && p @ l2) return p;
1952  }
1953  return point(R, (infinity, infinity));
1954 }
1955 
1956 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="parallel(point,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1957 line parallel(point M, line l)
1958 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the line parallel to 'l' passing through 'M'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1959  point A, B;
1960  if (M.coordsys != coordsys(l))
1961  {
1962  A = changecoordsys(M.coordsys, l.A);
1963  B = changecoordsys(M.coordsys, l.B);
1964  } else {A = l.A;B = l.B;}
1965  return line(M, M - A + B);
1966 }
1967 
1968 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="parallel(point,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
1969 line parallel(point M, explicit vector dir)
1970 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the line of direction 'dir' and passing through 'M'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1971  return line(M, M + locate(dir));
1972 }
1973 
1974 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="parallel(point,explicit pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
1975 line parallel(point M, explicit pair dir)
1976 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the line of direction 'dir' and passing through 'M'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1977  return line(M, M + vector(currentcoordsys, dir));
1978 }
1979 
1980 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="parallel(line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
1981 bool parallel(line l1, line l2, bool strictly = false)
1982 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'true' if 'l1' and 'l2' are (strictly ?) parallel.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1983  bool coll = collinear(l1.u, l2.u);
1984  return strictly ? coll && (l1 != l2) : coll;
1985 }
1986 
1987 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="concurrent(...line[])"><code></asyxml>*/
1988 bool concurrent(... line[] l)
1989 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Returns true if all the lines 'l' are concurrent.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
1990  if (l.length < 3) abort("'concurrent' needs at least for three lines ...");
1991  pair point = intersectionpoint(l[0], l[1]);
1992  bool conc;
1993  for (int i = 2; i < l.length; ++i) {
1994  pair pt = intersectionpoint(l[i - 1], l[i]);
1995  conc = simeq(pt, point);
1996  if (!conc) break;
1997  }
1998  return conc;
1999 }
2000 
2001 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="projection(line)"><code></asyxml>*/
2002 transform projection(line l)
2003 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the orthogonal projection on 'l'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2004  return projection(l.A, l.B);
2005 }
2006 
2007 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="projection(line,line,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
2008 transform projection(line l1, line l2, bool safe = false)
2009 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the projection on (AB) in parallel of (CD).
2010  If 'safe = true' and (l1)//(l2) return the identity.
2011  If 'safe = false' and (l1)//(l2) return a infinity scaling.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2012  return projection(l1.A, l1.B, l2.A, l2.B, safe);
2013 }
2014 
2015 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="vprojection(line,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
2016 transform vprojection(line l, bool safe = false)
2017 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the projection on 'l' in parallel of N--S.
2018  If 'safe' is 'true' the projected point keeps the same place if 'l'
2019  is vertical.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2020  coordsys R = defaultcoordsys;
2021  return projection(l, line(point(R, N), point(R, S)), safe);
2022 }
2023 
2024 /*<asyxml><function type="transform" signature="hprojection(line,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
2025 transform hprojection(line l, bool safe = false)
2026 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the projection on 'l' in parallel of E--W.
2027  If 'safe' is 'true' the projected point keeps the same place if 'l'
2028  is horizontal.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2029  coordsys R = defaultcoordsys;
2030  return projection(l, line(point(R, E), point(R, W)), safe);
2031 }
2032 
2033 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="perpendicular(point,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
2034 line perpendicular(point M, line l)
2035 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the perpendicular line of 'l' passing through 'M'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2036  point Mp = projection(l) * M;
2037  point A = Mp == l.A ? l.B : l.A;
2038  return line(Mp, rotate(90, Mp) * A);
2039 }
2040 
2041 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="perpendicular(point,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
2042 line perpendicular(point M, explicit vector normal)
2043 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the line passing through 'M'
2044  whose normal is \param{normal}.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2045  return perpendicular(M, line(M, M + locate(normal)));
2046 }
2047 
2048 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="perpendicular(point,explicit pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
2049 line perpendicular(point M, explicit pair normal)
2050 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the line passing through 'M'
2051  whose normal is \param{normal} (given in the currentcoordsys).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2052  return perpendicular(M, line(M, M + vector(currentcoordsys, normal)));
2053 }
2054 
2055 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="perpendicular(line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
2056 bool perpendicular(line l1, line l2)
2057 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'true' if 'l1' and 'l2' are perpendicular.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2058  return abs(dot(locate(l1.u), locate(l2.u))) < epsgeo ;
2059 }
2060 
2061 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="angle(line,coordsys)"><code></asyxml>*/
2062 real angle(line l, coordsys R = coordsys(l))
2063 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angle of the oriented line 'l',
2064  in radian, in the interval ]-pi, pi] and relatively to 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2065  return angle(l.u, R, false);
2066 }
2067 
2068 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="degrees(line,coordsys,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
2069 real degrees(line l, coordsys R = coordsys(l))
2070 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Returns the angle of the oriented line 'l' in degrees,
2071  in the interval [0, 360[ and relatively to 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2072  return degrees(angle(l, R));
2073 }
2074 
2075 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="sharpangle(line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
2076 real sharpangle(line l1, line l2)
2077 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the measure in radians of the sharp angle formed by 'l1' and 'l2'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2078  vector u1 = l1.u;
2079  vector u2 = (dot(l1.u, l2.u) < 0) ? -l2.u : l2.u;
2080  real a12 = angle(locate(u2)) - angle(locate(u1));
2081  a12 = a12%(sgnd(a12) * pi);
2082  if (a12 <= -pi/2) {
2083  a12 += pi;
2084  } else if (a12 > pi/2) {
2085  a12 -= pi;
2086  }
2087  return a12;
2088 }
2089 
2090 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="angle(line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
2091 real angle(line l1, line l2)
2092 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the measure in radians of oriented angle (l1.u, l2.u).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2093  return angle(locate(l2.u)) - angle(locate(l1.u));
2094 }
2095 
2096 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="degrees(line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
2097 real degrees(line l1, line l2)
2098 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the measure in degrees of the
2099  angle formed by the oriented lines 'l1' and 'l2'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2100  return degrees(angle(l1, l2));
2101 }
2102 
2103 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="sharpdegrees(line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
2104 real sharpdegrees(line l1, line l2)
2105 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the measure in degrees of the sharp angle formed by 'l1' and 'l2'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2106  return degrees(sharpangle(l1, l2));
2107 }
2108 
2109 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="bisector(line,line,real,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
2110 line bisector(line l1, line l2, real angle = 0, bool sharp = true)
2111 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the bisector of the angle formed by 'l1' and 'l2'
2112  rotated by the angle 'angle' (in degrees) around intersection point of 'l1' with 'l2'.
2113  If 'sharp' is true (the default), this routine returns the bisector of the sharp angle.
2114  Note that the returned line inherit of coordinate system of 'l1'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2115  line ol;
2116  if (l1 == l2) return l1;
2117  point A = intersectionpoint(l1, l2);
2118  if (finite(A)) {
2119  if(sharp) ol = rotate(sharpdegrees(l1, l2)/2 + angle, A) * l1;
2120  else {
2121  coordsys R = coordsys(l1);
2122  pair a = A, b = A + l1.u, c = A + l2.u;
2123  pair pp = extension(a, a + dir(a--b, a--c), b, b + dir(b--a, b--c));
2124  return rotate(angle, A) * line(A, point(R, pp/R));
2125  }
2126  } else {
2127  ol = l1;
2128  }
2129  return ol;
2130 }
2131 
2132 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="sector(int,int,line,line,real,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
2133 line sector(int n = 2, int p = 1, line l1, line l2, real angle = 0, bool sharp = true)
2134 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the p-th nth-sector of the angle
2135  formed by the oriented line 'l1' and 'l2'
2136  rotated by the angle 'angle' (in degrees) around the intersection point of 'l1' with 'l2'.
2137  If 'sharp' is true (the default), this routine returns the bisector of the sharp angle.
2138  Note that the returned line inherit of coordinate system of 'l1'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2139  line ol;
2140  if (l1 == l2) return l1;
2141  point A = intersectionpoint(l1, l2);
2142  if (finite(A)) {
2143  if(sharp) ol = rotate(p * sharpdegrees(l1, l2)/n + angle, A) * l1;
2144  else {
2145  ol = rotate(p * degrees(l1, l2)/n + angle, A) * l1;
2146  }
2147  } else {
2148  ol = l1;
2149  }
2150  return ol;
2151 }
2152 
2153 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="bisector(point,point,point,point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2154 line bisector(point A, point B, point C, point D, real angle = 0, bool sharp = true)
2155 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the bisector of the angle formed by the lines (AB) and (CD).
2156  <look href = "#bisector(line, line, real, bool)"/>.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2157  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(A, B, C, D);
2158  return bisector(line(P[0], P[1]), line(P[2], P[3]), angle, sharp);
2159 }
2160 
2161 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="bisector(segment,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2162 line bisector(segment s, real angle = 0)
2163 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the bisector of the segment line 's' rotated by 'angle' (in degrees) around the
2164  midpoint of 's'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2165  coordsys R = coordsys(s);
2166  point m = midpoint(s);
2167  vector dir = rotateO(90) * unit(s.A - m);
2168  return rotate(angle, m) * line(m + dir, m - dir);
2169 }
2170 
2171 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="bisector(point,point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2172 line bisector(point A, point B, real angle = 0)
2173 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the bisector of the segment line [AB] rotated by 'angle' (in degrees) around the
2174  midpoint of [AB].</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2175  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(A, B);
2176  return bisector(segment(P[0], P[1]), angle);
2177 }
2178 
2179 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="distance(point,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
2180 real distance(point M, line l)
2181 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the distance from 'M' to 'l'.
2182  distance(line, point) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2183  point A = changecoordsys(defaultcoordsys, l.A);
2184  point B = changecoordsys(defaultcoordsys, l.B);
2185  line ll = line(A, B);
2186  pair m = locate(M);
2187  return abs(ll.a * m.x + ll.b * m.y + ll.c)/sqrt(ll.a^2 + ll.b^2);
2188 }
2189 
2190 real distance(line l, point M)
2191 {
2192  return distance(M, l);
2193 }
2194 
2195 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="draw(picture,Label,line,bool,bool,align,pen,arrowbar,Label,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
2196 void draw(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L = "",
2197  line l, bool dirA = l.extendA, bool dirB = l.extendB,
2198  align align = NoAlign, pen p = currentpen,
2199  arrowbar arrow = None,
2200  Label legend = "", marker marker = nomarker,
2201  pathModifier pathModifier = NoModifier)
2202 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw the line 'l' without altering the size of picture pic.
2203  The boolean parameters control the infinite section.
2204  The global variable 'linemargin' (default value is 0) allows to modify
2205  the bounding box in which the line must be drawn.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2206  if(!(dirA || dirB)) draw(l.A--l.B, invisible);// l is a segment.
2207  Drawline(pic, L, l.A, dirP = dirA, l.B, dirQ = dirB,
2208  align, p, arrow,
2209  legend, marker, pathModifier);
2210 }
2211 
2212 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="draw(picture,Label[], line[], align,pen[], arrowbar,Label,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
2213 void draw(picture pic = currentpicture, Label[] L = new Label[], line[] l,
2214  align align = NoAlign, pen[] p = new pen[],
2215  arrowbar arrow = None,
2216  Label[] legend = new Label[], marker marker = nomarker,
2217  pathModifier pathModifier = NoModifier)
2218 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw each lines with the corresponding pen.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2219  for (int i = 0; i < l.length; ++i) {
2220  draw(pic, L.length>0 ? L[i] : "", l[i],
2221  align, p = p.length>0 ? p[i] : currentpen,
2222  arrow, legend.length>0 ? legend[i] : "", marker,
2223  pathModifier);
2224  }
2225 }
2226 
2227 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="draw(picture,Label[], line[], align,pen,arrowbar,Label,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
2228 void draw(picture pic = currentpicture, Label[] L = new Label[], line[] l,
2229  align align = NoAlign, pen p,
2230  arrowbar arrow = None,
2231  Label[] legend = new Label[], marker marker = nomarker,
2232  pathModifier pathModifier = NoModifier)
2233 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw each lines with the same pen 'p'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2234  pen[] tp = sequence(new pen(int i){return p;}, l.length);
2235  draw(pic, L, l, align, tp, arrow, legend, marker, pathModifier);
2236 }
2237 
2238 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="show(picture,line,pen)"><code></asyxml>*/
2239 void show(picture pic = currentpicture, line l, pen p = red)
2240 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw some informations of 'l'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2241  dot("$A$", (pair)l.A, align = -locate(l.v), p);
2242  dot("$B$", (pair)l.B, align = -locate(l.v), p);
2243  draw(l, dotted);
2244  draw("$\vec{u}$", locate(l.A)--locate(l.A + l.u), p, Arrow);
2245  draw("$\vec{v}$", locate(l.A)--locate(l.A + l.v), p, Arrow);
2246 }
2247 
2248 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="sameside(point,line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
2249 point[] sameside(point M, line l1, line l2)
2250 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return two points on 'l1' and 'l2' respectively.
2251  The first point is from the same side of M relatively to 'l2',
2252  the second point is from the same side of M relatively to 'l1'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2253  point[] op;
2254  coordsys R1 = coordsys(l1);
2255  coordsys R2 = coordsys(l2);
2256  if (parallel(l1, l2)) {
2257  op.push(projection(l1) * M);
2258  op.push(projection(l2) * M);
2259  } else {
2260  point O = intersectionpoint(l1, l2);
2261  if (M @ l2) op.push((sameside(M, O + l1.u, l2)) ? O + l1.u : rotate(180, O) * (O + l1.u));
2262  else op.push(projection(l1, l2) * M);
2263  if (M @ l1) op.push((sameside(M, O + l2.u, l1)) ? O + l2.u : rotate(180, O) * (O + l2.u));
2264  else {op.push(projection(l2, l1) * M);}
2265  }
2266  return op;
2267 }
2268 
2269 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="markangle(picture,Label,int,real,real,explicit line,explicit line,explicit pair,arrowbar,pen,filltype,margin,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
2270 void markangle(picture pic = currentpicture,
2271  Label L = "", int n = 1, real radius = 0, real space = 0,
2272  explicit line l1, explicit line l2, explicit pair align = dir(1),
2273  arrowbar arrow = None, pen p = currentpen,
2274  filltype filltype = NoFill,
2275  margin margin = NoMargin, marker marker = nomarker)
2276 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Mark the angle (l1, l2) aligned in the direction 'align' relative to 'l1'.
2277  Commune values for 'align' are dir(real).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2278  if (parallel(l1, l2, true)) return;
2279  real al = degrees(l1, defaultcoordsys);
2280  pair O, A, B;
2281  if (radius == 0) radius = markangleradius(p);
2282  real d = degrees(locate(l1.u));
2283  align = rotate(d) * align;
2284  if (l1 == l2) {
2285  O = midpoint(segment(l1.A, l1.B));
2286  A = l1.A;B = l1.B;
2287  if (sameside(rotate(sgn(angle(B-A)) * 45, O) * A, O + align, l1)) {radius = -radius;}
2288  } else {
2289  O = intersectionpoint(extend(l1), extend(l2));
2290  pair R = O + align;
2291  point [] ss = sameside(point(coordsys(l1), R/coordsys(l1)), l1, l2);
2292  A = ss[0];
2293  B = ss[1];
2294  }
2295  markangle(pic = pic, L = L, n = n, radius = radius, space = space,
2296  O = O, A = A, B = B,
2297  arrow = arrow, p = p, filltype = filltype,
2298  margin = margin, marker = marker);
2299 }
2300 
2301 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="markangle(picture,Label,int,real,real,explicit line,explicit line,explicit vector,arrowbar,pen,filltype,margin,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
2302 void markangle(picture pic = currentpicture,
2303  Label L = "", int n = 1, real radius = 0, real space = 0,
2304  explicit line l1, explicit line l2, explicit vector align,
2305  arrowbar arrow = None, pen p = currentpen,
2306  filltype filltype = NoFill,
2307  margin margin = NoMargin, marker marker = nomarker)
2308 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Mark the angle (l1, l2) in the direction 'dir' given relatively to 'l1'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2309  markangle(pic, L, n, radius, space, l1, l2, (pair)align, arrow,
2310  p, filltype, margin, marker);
2311 }
2312 
2313 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="markangle(picture,Label,int,real,real,line,line,arrowbar,pen,filltype,margin,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
2314 // void markangle(picture pic = currentpicture,
2315 // Label L = "", int n = 1, real radius = 0, real space = 0,
2316 // explicit line l1, explicit line l2,
2317 // arrowbar arrow = None, pen p = currentpen,
2318 // filltype filltype = NoFill,
2319 // margin margin = NoMargin, marker marker = nomarker)
2320 // {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Mark the oriented angle (l1, l2).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2321 // if (parallel(l1, l2, true)) return;
2322 // real al = degrees(l1, defaultcoordsys);
2323 // pair O, A, B;
2324 // if (radius == 0) radius = markangleradius(p);
2325 // real d = degrees(locate(l1.u));
2326 // if (l1 == l2) {
2327 // O = midpoint(segment(l1.A, l1.B));
2328 // } else {
2329 // O = intersectionpoint(extend(l1), extend(l2));
2330 // }
2331 // A = O + locate(l1.u);
2332 // B = O + locate(l2.u);

2334 // O = O, A = A, B = B,

2337 // }
2338 
2339 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="perpendicularmark(picture,line,line,real,pen,int,margin,filltype)"><code></asyxml>*/
2340 void perpendicularmark(picture pic = currentpicture, line l1, line l2,
2341  real size = 0, pen p = currentpen, int quarter = 1,
2342  margin margin = NoMargin, filltype filltype = NoFill)
2343 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw a right angle at the intersection point of lines and
2344  aligned in the 'quarter' nth quarter of circle formed by 'l1.u' and
2345  'l2.u'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2346  point P = intersectionpoint(l1, l2);
2347  pair align = rotate(90 * (quarter - 1)) * dir(45);
2348  perpendicularmark(P, align, locate(l1.u), size, p, margin, filltype);
2349 }
2350 // *.........................LINES.........................*
2351 // *=======================================================*
2352 
2353 // *=======================================================*
2354 // *........................CONICS.........................*
2355 /*<asyxml><struct signature="bqe"><code></asyxml>*/
2356 struct bqe
2357 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Bivariate Quadratic Equation.</documentation></asyxml>*/
2358  /*<asyxml><property type = "real[]" signature="a"><code></asyxml>*/
2359  real[] a;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>a[0] * x^2 + a[1] * x * y + a[2] * y^2 + a[3] * x + a[4] * y + a[5] = 0</documentation></property><property type = "coordsys" signature="coordsys"><code></asyxml>*/
2360  coordsys coordsys;/*<asyxml></code></property></asyxml>*/
2361 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
2362 
2363 /*<asyxml><function type="bqe" signature="bqe(coordsys,real,real,real,real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2364 bqe bqe(coordsys R = currentcoordsys,
2365  real a, real b, real c, real d, real e, real f)
2366 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the bivariate quadratic equation
2367  a[0] * x^2 + a[1] * x * y + a[2] * y^2 + a[3] * x + a[4] * y + a[5] = 0
2368  relatively to the coordinate system R.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2369  bqe obqe;
2370  obqe.coordsys = R;
2371  obqe.a = new real[] {a, b, c, d, e, f};
2372  return obqe;
2373 }
2374 
2375 /*<asyxml><function type="bqe" signature="changecoordsys(coordsys,bqe)"><code></asyxml>*/
2376 bqe changecoordsys(coordsys R, bqe bqe)
2377 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Returns the bivariate quadratic equation relatively to 'R'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2378  pair i = coordinates(changecoordsys(R, vector(defaultcoordsys,
2379  bqe.coordsys.i)));
2380  pair j = coordinates(changecoordsys(R, vector(defaultcoordsys,
2381  bqe.coordsys.j)));
2382  pair O = coordinates(changecoordsys(R, point(defaultcoordsys,
2383  bqe.coordsys.O)));
2384  real a = bqe.a[0], b = bqe.a[1], c = bqe.a[2], d = bqe.a[3], f = bqe.a[4], g = bqe.a[5];
2385  real ux = i.x, uy = i.y;
2386  real vx = j.x, vy = j.y;
2387  real ox = O.x, oy = O.y;
2388  real D = ux * vy - uy * vx;
2389  real ap = (a * vy^2 - b * uy * vy + c * uy^2)/D^2;
2390  real bpp = (-2 * a * vx * vy + b * ux * vy + b * uy * vx - 2 * c * ux * uy)/D^2;
2391  real cp = (a * vx^2 - b * ux * vx + c * ux^2)/D^2;
2392  real dp = (-2a * ox * vy^2 + 2a * oy * vx * vy + 2b * ox * uy * vy-
2393  b * oy * ux * vy - b * oy * uy * vx - 2c * ox * uy^2 + 2c * oy * uy * ux)/D^2+
2394  (d * vy - f * uy)/D;
2395  real fp = (2a * ox * vx * vy - b * ox * ux * vy - 2a * oy * vx^2-
2396  b * ox * uy * vx + 2 * b * oy * ux * vx + 2c * ox * ux * uy - 2c * oy * ux^2)/D^2+
2397  (f * ux - d * vx)/D;
2398  g = (a * ox^2 * vy^2 - 2a * ox * oy * vx * vy - b * ox^2 * uy * vy + b * ox * oy * ux * vy+
2399  a * oy^2 * vx^2 + b * ox * oy * uy * vx - b * oy^2 * ux * vx + c * ox^2 * uy^2-
2400  2 * c * ox * oy * ux * uy + c * oy^2 * ux^2)/D^2+
2401  (d * oy * vx + f * ox * uy - d * ox * vy - f * oy * ux)/D + g;
2402  bqe obqe;
2403  obqe.a = approximate(new real[] {ap, bpp, cp, dp, fp, g});
2404  obqe.coordsys = R;
2405  return obqe;
2406 }
2407 
2408 /*<asyxml><function type="bqe" signature="bqe(point,point,point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
2409 bqe bqe(point M1, point M2, point M3, point M4, point M5)
2410 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the bqe of conic passing through the five points (if possible).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2411  coordsys R;
2412  pair[] pts;
2413  if (samecoordsys(M1, M2, M3, M4, M5)) {
2414  R = M1.coordsys;
2415  pts= new pair[] {M1.coordinates, M2.coordinates, M3.coordinates, M4.coordinates, M5.coordinates};
2416  } else {
2417  R = defaultcoordsys;
2418  pts= new pair[] {M1, M2, M3, M4, M5};
2419  }
2420  real[][] M;
2421  real[] x;
2422  bqe bqe;
2423  bqe.coordsys = R;
2424  for (int i = 0; i < 5; ++i) {// Try a = -1
2425  M[i] = new real[] {pts[i].x * pts[i].y, pts[i].y^2, pts[i].x, pts[i].y, 1};
2426  x[i] = pts[i].x^2;
2427  }
2428  if(abs(determinant(M)) < 1e-5) {// Try c = -1
2429  for (int i = 0; i < 5; ++i) {
2430  M[i] = new real[] {pts[i].x^2, pts[i].x * pts[i].y, pts[i].x, pts[i].y, 1};
2431  x[i] = pts[i].y^2;
2432  }
2433  real[] coef = solve(M, x);
2434  bqe.a = new real[] {coef[0], coef[1], -1, coef[2], coef[3], coef[4]};
2435  } else {
2436  real[] coef = solve(M, x);
2437  bqe.a = new real[] {-1, coef[0], coef[1], coef[2], coef[3], coef[4]};
2438  }
2439  bqe.a = approximate(bqe.a);
2440  return bqe;
2441 }
2442 
2443 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="samecoordsys(bool...bqe[])"><code></asyxml>*/
2444 bool samecoordsys(bool warn = true ... bqe[] bqes)
2445 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return true if all the bivariate quadratic equations have the same coordinate system.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2446  bool ret = true;
2447  coordsys t = bqes[0].coordsys;
2448  for (int i = 1; i < bqes.length; ++i) {
2449  ret = (t == bqes[i].coordsys);
2450  if(!ret) break;
2451  t = bqes[i].coordsys;
2452  }
2453  if(warn && !ret)
2454  warning("coodinatesystem",
2455  "the coordinate system of two bivariate quadratic equations are not
2456 the same. The operation will be done relatively to the default coordinate
2457 system.");
2458  return ret;
2459 }
2460 
2461 /*<asyxml><function type="real[]" signature="realquarticroots(real,real,real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2462 real[] realquarticroots(real a, real b, real c, real d, real e)
2463 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the real roots of the quartic equation ax^4 + b^x3 + cx^2 + dx = 0.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2464  static real Fuzz = sqrt(realEpsilon);
2465  pair[] zroots = quarticroots(a, b, c, d, e);
2466  real[] roots;
2467  real p(real x){return a * x^4 + b * x^3 + c * x^2 + d * x + e;}
2468  real prime(real x){return 4 * a * x^3 + 3 * b * x^2 + 2 * c * x + d;}
2469  real x;
2470  bool search = true;
2471  int n;
2472  void addroot(real x)
2473  {
2474  bool exist = false;
2475  for (int i = 0; i < roots.length; ++i) {
2476  if(abs(roots[i]-x) < 1e-5) {exist = true; break;}
2477  }
2478  if(!exist) roots.push(x);
2479  }
2480  for(int i = 0; i < zroots.length; ++i) {
2481  if(zroots[i].y == 0 || abs(p(zroots[i].x)) < Fuzz) addroot(zroots[i].x);
2482  else {
2483  if(abs(zroots[i].y) < 1e-3) {
2484  x = zroots[i].x;
2485  search = true;
2486  n = 200;
2487  while(search) {
2488  real tx = abs(p(x)) < Fuzz ? x : newton(iterations = n, p, prime, x);
2489  if(tx < realMax) {
2490  if(abs(p(tx)) < Fuzz) {
2491  addroot(tx);
2492  search = false;
2493  } else if(n < 200) n *=2;
2494  else {
2495  search = false;
2496  }
2497  } else search = false; //It's not a real root.
2498  }
2499  }
2500  }
2501  }
2502  return roots;
2503 }
2504 
2505 /*<asyxml><struct signature="conic"><code></asyxml>*/
2506 struct conic
2507 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation><property type = "real" signature="e,p,h"><code></asyxml>*/
2508  real e, p, h;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>BE CAREFUL: h = distance(F, D) and p = h * e (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ellipse)
2509  While http://mathworld.wolfram.com/ takes p = distance(F,D).</documentation></property><property type = "point" signature="F"><code></asyxml>*/
2510  point F;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Focus.</documentation></property><property type = "line" signature="D"><code></asyxml>*/
2511  line D;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Directrix.</documentation></property><property type = "line" signature="l"><code></asyxml>*/
2512  line[] l;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Case of degenerated conic (not yet implemented !).</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
2513 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
2514 
2515 bool degenerate(conic c)
2516 {
2517  return !finite(c.p) || !finite(c.h);
2518 }
2519 
2520 /*ANCconic conic(point, line, real)ANC*/
2521 conic conic(point F, line l, real e)
2522 {/*DOC
2523  The conic section define by the eccentricity 'e', the focus 'F'
2524  and the directrix 'l'.
2525  Note that an eccentricity equal to 0 defines a circle centered at F,
2526  with a radius equal at the distance from 'F' to 'l'.
2527  If the coordinate system of 'F' and 'l' are not identical, the conic is
2528  attached to 'defaultcoordsys'.
2529  DOC*/
2530  if(e < 0) abort("conic: 'e' can't be negative.");
2531  conic oc;
2532  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(F, l.A, l.B);
2533  line ll;
2534  ll = line(P[1], P[2]);
2535  oc.e = e < epsgeo ? 0 : e; // Handle case of circle.
2536  oc.F = P[0];
2537  oc.D = ll;
2538  oc.h = distance(P[0], ll);
2539  oc.p = abs(e) < epsgeo ? oc.h : e * oc.h;
2540  return oc;
2541 }
2542 
2543 /*<asyxml><struct signature="circle"><code></asyxml>*/
2544 struct circle
2545 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>All the calculus with this structure will be as exact as Asymptote can do.
2546  For a full precision, you must not cast 'circle' to 'path' excepted for drawing routines.</documentation></asyxml>*/
2547  /*<asyxml><property type = "point" signature="C"><code></asyxml>*/
2548  point C;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Center</documentation></property><property><code></asyxml>*/
2549  real r;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Radius</documentation></property><property><code></asyxml>*/
2550  line l;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>If the radius is infinite, this line is used instead of circle.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
2551 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
2552 
2553 bool degenerate(circle c)
2554 {
2555  return !finite(c.r);
2556 }
2557 
2558 line line(circle c){
2559  if(finite(c.r)) abort("Circle can not be casted to line here.");
2560  return c.l;
2561 }
2562 
2563 /*<asyxml><struct signature="ellipse"><code></asyxml>*/
2564 struct ellipse
2565 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Look at <html><a href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Ellipse.html">http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Ellipse.html</a></html></documentation></asyxml>*/
2566  /*<asyxml><property type = "point" signature="F1,F2,C"><code></asyxml>*/
2567  restricted point F1,F2,C;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Foci and center.</documentation></property><property type = "real" signature="a,b,c,e,p"><code></asyxml>*/
2568  restricted real a,b,c,e,p;/*<asyxml></code></property><property type = "real" signature="angle"><code></asyxml>*/
2569  restricted real angle;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Value is degrees(F2 - F1).</documentation></property><property type = "line" signature="D1,D2"><code></asyxml>*/
2570  restricted line D1,D2;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Directrices.</documentation></property><property type = "line" signature="l"><code></asyxml>*/
2571  line l;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>If one axis is infinite, this line is used instead of ellipse.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
2572 
2573  /*<asyxml><method type = "void" signature="init(point,point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2574  void init(point f1, point f2, real a)
2575  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Ellipse given by foci and semimajor axis.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
2576  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(f1, f2);
2577  this.F1 = P[0];
2578  this.F2 = P[1];
2579  this.C = (P[0] + P[1])/2;
2580  this.angle = degrees(F2 - F1, warn=false);
2581  this.a = a;
2582  if(!finite(a)) {
2583  this.l = line(P[0], P[1]);
2584  this.b = infinity;
2585  this.e = 0;
2586  this.c = 0;
2587  } else {
2588  this.c = abs(C - P[0]);
2589  this.b = this.c < epsgeo ? a : sqrt(a^2 - c^2); // Handle case of circle.
2590  this.e = this.c < epsgeo ? 0 : this.c/a; // Handle case of circle.
2591  if(this.e >= 1) abort("ellipse.init: wrong parameter: e >= 1.");
2592  this.p = a * (1 - this.e^2);
2593  if (this.c != 0) {// directrix is not set for a circle.
2594  point A = this.C + (a^2/this.c) * unit(P[0]-this.C);
2595  this.D1 = line(A, A + rotateO(90) * unit(A - this.C));
2596  this.D2 = reverse(rotate(180, C) * D1);
2597  }
2598  }
2599  }
2600 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
2601 
2602 bool degenerate(ellipse el)
2603 {
2604  return !finite(el.a) || !finite(el.b);
2605 }
2606 
2607 /*<asyxml><struct signature="parabola"><code></asyxml>*/
2608 struct parabola
2609 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Look at <html><a href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Parabola.html">http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Parabola.html</a></html></documentation><property type = "point" signature="F,V"><code></asyxml>*/
2610  restricted point F,V;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Focus and vertex</documentation></property><property type = "real" signature="a,p,e = 1"><code></asyxml>*/
2611  restricted real a,p,e = 1;/*<asyxml></code></property><property type = "real" signature="angle"><code></asyxml>*/
2612  restricted real angle;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Value is degrees(F - V).</documentation></property><property type = "line" signature="D"><code></asyxml>*/
2613  restricted line D;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Directrix</documentation></property><property type = "pair" signature="bmin,bmax"><code></asyxml>*/
2614  pair bmin, bmax;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The (left, bottom) and (right, top) coordinates of region bounding box for drawing the parabola.
2615  If unset the current picture bounding box is used instead.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
2616 
2617  /*<asyxml><method type = "void" signature="init(point,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
2618  void init(point F, line directrix)
2619  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Parabola given by focus and directrix.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
2620  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(F, directrix.A, directrix.B);
2621  this.F = P[0];
2622  line l = line(P[1], P[2]);
2623  this.D = l;
2624  this.a = distance(P[0], l)/2;
2625  this.p = 2 * a;
2626  this.V = 0.5 * (F + projection(D) * P[0]);
2627  this.angle = degrees(F - V, warn=false);
2628  }
2629 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
2630 
2631 /*<asyxml><struct signature="hyperbola"><code></asyxml>*/
2632 struct hyperbola
2633 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><html>Look at <a href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Hyperbola.html">http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Hyperbola.html</a></html></documentation><property type = "point" signature="F1,F2"><code></asyxml>*/
2634  restricted point F1,F2;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Foci.</documentation></property><property type = "point" signature="C,V1,V2"><code></asyxml>*/
2635  restricted point C,V1,V2;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Center and vertices.</documentation></property><property type = "real" signature="a,b,c,e,p"><code></asyxml>*/
2636  restricted real a,b,c,e,p;/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></property><property type = "real" signature="angle"><code></asyxml>*/
2637  restricted real angle;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Value is degrees(F2 - F1).</documentation></property><property type = "line" signature="D1,D2,A1,A2"><code></asyxml>*/
2638  restricted line D1,D2,A1,A2;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Directrices and asymptotes.</documentation></property><property type = "pair" signature="bmin,bmax"><code></asyxml>*/
2639  pair bmin, bmax; /*<asyxml></code><documentation>The (left, bottom) and (right, top) coordinates of region bounding box for drawing the hyperbola.
2640  If unset the current picture bounding box is used instead.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
2641 
2642  /*<asyxml><method type = "void" signature="init(point,point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2643  void init(point f1, point f2, real a)
2644  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Hyperbola given by foci and semimajor axis.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
2645  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(f1, f2);
2646  this.F1 = P[0];
2647  this.F2 = P[1];
2648  this.C = (P[0] + P[1])/2;
2649  this.angle = degrees(F2 - F1, warn=false);
2650  this.a = a;
2651  this.c = abs(C - P[0]);
2652  this.e = this.c/a;
2653  if(this.e <= 1) abort("hyperbola.init: wrong parameter: e <= 1.");
2654  this.b = a * sqrt(this.e^2 - 1);
2655  this.p = a * (this.e^2 - 1);
2656  point A = this.C + (a^2/this.c) * unit(P[0]-this.C);
2657  this.D1 = line(A, A + rotate(90,this.C.coordsys.O) * unit(A - this.C));
2658  this.D2 = reverse(rotate(180, C) * D1);
2659  this.V1 = C + a * unit(F1 - C);
2660  this.V2 = C + a * unit(F2 - C);
2661  this.A1 = line(C, V1 + b * unit(rotateO(-90) * (C - V1)));
2662  this.A2 = line(C, V1 + b * unit(rotateO(90) * (C - V1)));
2663  }
2664 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
2665 
2666 /*<asyxml><variable type="int" signature="conicnodesfactor"><code></asyxml>*/
2667 int conicnodesfactor = 1;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Factor for the node number of all conics.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
2668 
2669 /*<asyxml><variable type="int" signature="circlenodesnumberfactor"><code></asyxml>*/
2670 int circlenodesnumberfactor = 100;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Factor for the node number of circles.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
2671 /*<asyxml><function type="int" signature="circlenodesnumber(real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2672 int circlenodesnumber(real r)
2673 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the number of nodes for drawing a circle of radius 'r'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2674  if (circlenodesnumberfactor < 100)
2675  warning("circlenodesnumberfactor",
2676  "variable 'circlenodesnumberfactor' may be too small.");
2677  int oi = ceil(circlenodesnumberfactor * abs(r)^0.1);
2678  oi = 45 * floor(oi/45);
2679  return oi == 0 ? 4 : conicnodesfactor * oi;
2680 }
2681 
2682 /*<asyxml><function type="int" signature="circlenodesnumber(real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2683 int circlenodesnumber(real r, real angle1, real angle2)
2684 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the number of nodes to draw a circle arc.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2685  return (r > 0) ?
2686  ceil(circlenodesnumber(r) * abs(angle1 - angle2)/360) :
2687  ceil(circlenodesnumber(r) * abs((1 - abs(angle1 - angle2)/360)));
2688 }
2689 
2690 /*<asyxml><variable type="int" signature="ellispenodesnumberfactor"><code></asyxml>*/
2691 int ellipsenodesnumberfactor = 250;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Factor for the node number of ellispe (non-circle).</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
2692 /*<asyxml><function type="int" signature="ellipsenodesnumber(real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2693 int ellipsenodesnumber(real a, real b)
2694 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the number of nodes to draw a ellipse of axis 'a' and 'b'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2695  if (ellipsenodesnumberfactor < 250)
2696  write("ellipsenodesnumberfactor",
2697  "variable 'ellipsenodesnumberfactor' maybe too small.");
2698  int tmp = circlenodesnumberfactor;
2699  circlenodesnumberfactor = ellipsenodesnumberfactor;
2700  int oi = circlenodesnumber(max(abs(a), abs(b))/min(abs(a), abs(b)));
2701  circlenodesnumberfactor = tmp;
2702  return conicnodesfactor * oi;
2703 }
2704 
2705 /*<asyxml><function type="int" signature="ellipsenodesnumber(real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2706 int ellipsenodesnumber(real a, real b, real angle1, real angle2, bool dir)
2707 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the number of nodes to draw an ellipse arc.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2708  real d;
2709  real da = angle2 - angle1;
2710  if(dir) {
2711  d = angle1 < angle2 ? da : 360 + da;
2712  } else {
2713  d = angle1 < angle2 ? -360 + da : da;
2714  }
2715  int n = floor(ellipsenodesnumber(a, b) * abs(d)/360);
2716  return n < 5 ? 5 : n;
2717 }
2718 
2719 /*<asyxml><variable type="int" signature="parabolanodesnumberfactor"><code></asyxml>*/
2720 int parabolanodesnumberfactor = 100;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Factor for the number of nodes of parabolas.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
2721 /*<asyxml><function type="int" signature="parabolanodesnumber(parabola,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2722 int parabolanodesnumber(parabola p, real angle1, real angle2)
2723 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the number of nodes for drawing a parabola.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2724  return conicnodesfactor * floor(0.01 * parabolanodesnumberfactor * abs(angle1 - angle2));
2725 }
2726 
2727 /*<asyxml><variable type="int" signature="hyperbolanodesnumberfactor"><code></asyxml>*/
2728 int hyperbolanodesnumberfactor = 100;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Factor for the number of nodes of hyperbolas.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
2729 /*<asyxml><function type="int" signature="hyperbolanodesnumber(hyperbola,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2730 int hyperbolanodesnumber(hyperbola h, real angle1, real angle2)
2731 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the number of nodes for drawing an hyperbola.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2732  return conicnodesfactor * floor(0.01 * hyperbolanodesnumberfactor * abs(angle1 - angle2)/h.e);
2733 }
2734 
2735 /*<asyxml><operator type = "conic" signature="+(conic,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
2736 conic operator +(conic c, explicit point M)
2737 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
2738  return conic(c.F + M, c.D + M, c.e);
2739 }
2740 /*<asyxml><operator type = "conic" signature="-(conic,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
2741 conic operator -(conic c, explicit point M)
2742 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
2743  return conic(c.F - M, c.D - M, c.e);
2744 }
2745 /*<asyxml><operator type = "conic" signature="+(conic,explicit pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
2746 conic operator +(conic c, explicit pair m)
2747 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
2748  point M = point(c.F.coordsys, m);
2749  return conic(c.F + M, c.D + M, c.e);
2750 }
2751 /*<asyxml><operator type = "conic" signature="-(conic,explicit pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
2752 conic operator -(conic c, explicit pair m)
2753 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
2754  point M = point(c.F.coordsys, m);
2755  return conic(c.F - M, c.D - M, c.e);
2756 }
2757 /*<asyxml><operator type = "conic" signature="+(conic,vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
2758 conic operator +(conic c, vector v)
2759 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
2760  return conic(c.F + v, c.D + v, c.e);
2761 }
2762 /*<asyxml><operator type = "conic" signature="-(conic,vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
2763 conic operator -(conic c, vector v)
2764 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
2765  return conic(c.F - v, c.D - v, c.e);
2766 }
2767 
2768 /*<asyxml><function type="coordsys" signature="coordsys(conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
2769 coordsys coordsys(conic co)
2770 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the coordinate system of 'co'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2771  return co.F.coordsys;
2772 }
2773 
2774 /*<asyxml><function type="conic" signature="changecoordsys(coordsys,conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
2775 conic changecoordsys(coordsys R, conic co)
2776 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Change the coordinate system of 'co' to 'R'</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2777  line l = changecoordsys(R, co.D);
2778  point F = changecoordsys(R, co.F);
2779  return conic(F, l, co.e);
2780 }
2781 
2782 /*<asyxml><typedef type = "polarconicroutine" return = "path" params = "conic, real, real, int, bool"><code></asyxml>*/
2783 typedef path polarconicroutine(conic co, real angle1, real angle2, int n, bool direction);/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Routine type used to draw conics from 'angle1' to 'angle2'</documentation></typedef></asyxml>*/
2784 
2785 /*<asyxml><function type="path" signature="arcfromfocus(conic,real,real,int,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
2786 path arcfromfocus(conic co, real angle1, real angle2, int n = 400, bool direction = CCW)
2787 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the path of the conic section 'co' from angle1 to angle2 in degrees,
2788  drawing in the given direction, with n nodes.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2789  guide op;
2790  if (n < 1) return op;
2791  if (angle1 > angle2) {
2792  path g = arcfromfocus(co, angle2, angle1, n, !direction);
2793  return g == nullpath ? g : reverse(g);
2794  }
2795  point O = projection(co.D) * co.F;
2796  pair i = unit(locate(co.F) - locate(O));
2797  pair j = rotate(90) * i;
2798  coordsys Rp = cartesiansystem(co.F, i, j);
2799  real a1 = direction ? radians(angle1) : radians(angle2);
2800  real a2 = direction ? radians(angle2) : radians(angle1) + 2 * pi;
2801  real step = n == 1 ? 0 : (a2 - a1)/(n - 1);
2802  real a, r;
2803  for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
2804  a = a1 + i * step;
2805  if(co.e >= 1) {
2806  r = 1 - co.e * cos(a);
2807  if(r > epsgeo) {
2808  r = co.p/r;
2809  op = op--Rp * Rp.polar(r, a);
2810  }
2811  } else {
2812  r = co.p/(1 - co.e * cos(a));
2813  op = op..Rp * Rp.polar(r, a);
2814  }
2815  }
2816  if(co.e < 1 && abs(abs(a2 - a1) - 2 * pi) < epsgeo) op = (path)op..cycle;
2817 
2818  return (direction ? op : op == nullpath ? op :reverse(op));
2819 }
2820 
2821 /*<asyxml><variable type="polarconicroutine" signature="currentpolarconicroutine"><code></asyxml>*/
2822 polarconicroutine currentpolarconicroutine = arcfromfocus;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Default routine used to cast conic section to path.</documentation></variable></asyxml>*/
2823 
2824 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="angpoint(conic,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2825 point angpoint(conic co, real angle)
2826 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'co' whose the angular (in degrees)
2827  coordinate is 'angle' (mesured from the focus of 'co', relatively
2828  to its 'natural coordinate system').</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2829  coordsys R = coordsys(co);
2830  return point(R, point(arcfromfocus(co, angle, angle, 1, CCW), 0)/R);
2831 }
2832 
2833 /*<asyxml><operator type = "bool" signature="@(point,conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
2834 bool operator @(point M, conic co)
2835 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return true iff 'M' on 'co'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
2836  if(co.e == 0) return abs(abs(co.F - M) - co.p) < 10 * epsgeo;
2837  return abs(co.e * distance(M, co.D) - abs(co.F - M)) < 10 * epsgeo;
2838 }
2839 
2840 /*<asyxml><function type="coordsys" signature="coordsys(ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
2841 coordsys coordsys(ellipse el)
2842 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the coordinate system of 'el'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2843  return el.F1.coordsys;
2844 }
2845 
2846 /*<asyxml><function type="coordsys" signature="canonicalcartesiansystem(ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
2847 coordsys canonicalcartesiansystem(ellipse el)
2848 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the canonical cartesian system of the ellipse 'el'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2849  if(degenerate(el)) return cartesiansystem(el.l.A, el.l.u, el.l.v);
2850  pair O = locate(el.C);
2851  pair i = el.e == 0 ? el.C.coordsys.i : unit(locate(el.F1) - O);
2852  pair j = rotate(90) * i;
2853  return cartesiansystem(O, i, j);
2854 }
2855 
2856 /*<asyxml><function type="coordsys" signature="canonicalcartesiansystem(parabola)"><code></asyxml>*/
2857 coordsys canonicalcartesiansystem(parabola p)
2858 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the canonical cartesian system of a parabola,
2859  so that Origin = vertex of 'p' and directrix: x = -a.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2860  point A = projection(p.D) * p.F;
2861  pair O = locate((A + p.F)/2);
2862  pair i = unit(locate(p.F) - O);
2863  pair j = rotate(90) * i;
2864  return cartesiansystem(O, i, j);
2865 }
2866 
2867 /*<asyxml><function type="coordsys" signature="canonicalcartesiansystem(hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
2868 coordsys canonicalcartesiansystem(hyperbola h)
2869 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the canonical cartesian system of an hyperbola.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2870  pair O = locate(h.C);
2871  pair i = unit(locate(h.F2) - O);
2872  pair j = rotate(90) * i;
2873  return cartesiansystem(O, i, j);
2874 }
2875 
2876 /*<asyxml><function type="ellipse" signature="ellipse(point,point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2877 ellipse ellipse(point F1, point F2, real a)
2878 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the ellipse whose the foci are 'F1' and 'F2'
2879  and the semimajor axis is 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2880  ellipse oe;
2881  oe.init(F1, F2, a);
2882  return oe;
2883 }
2884 
2885 /*<asyxml><constant type = "bool" signature="byfoci,byvertices"><code></asyxml>*/
2886 restricted bool byfoci = true, byvertices = false;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Constants useful for the routine 'hyperbola(point P1, point P2, real ae, bool byfoci = byfoci)'</documentation></constant></asyxml>*/
2887 
2888 /*<asyxml><function type="hyperbola" signature="hyperbola(point,point,real,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
2889 hyperbola hyperbola(point P1, point P2, real ae, bool byfoci = byfoci)
2890 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>if 'byfoci = true':
2891  return the hyperbola whose the foci are 'P1' and 'P2'
2892  and the semimajor axis is 'ae'.
2893  else return the hyperbola whose vertexes are 'P1' and 'P2' with eccentricity 'ae'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2894  hyperbola oh;
2895  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(P1, P2);
2896  if(byfoci) {
2897  oh.init(P[0], P[1], ae);
2898  } else {
2899  real a = abs(P[0]-P[1])/2;
2900  vector V = unit(P[0]-P[1]);
2901  point F1 = P[0] + a * (ae - 1) * V;
2902  point F2 = P[1]-a * (ae - 1) * V;
2903  oh.init(F1, F2, a);
2904  }
2905  return oh;
2906 }
2907 
2908 /*<asyxml><function type="ellipse" signature="ellipse(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
2909 ellipse ellipse(point F1, point F2, point M)
2910 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the ellipse passing through 'M' whose the foci are 'F1' and 'F2'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2911  real a = abs(F1 - M) + abs(F2 - M);
2912  return ellipse(F1, F2, finite(a) ? a/2 : a);
2913 }
2914 
2915 /*<asyxml><function type="ellipse" signature="ellipse(point,real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
2916 ellipse ellipse(point C, real a, real b, real angle = 0)
2917 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the ellipse centered at 'C' with semimajor axis 'a' along C--C + dir(angle),
2918  semiminor axis 'b' along the perpendicular.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2919  ellipse oe;
2920  coordsys R = C.coordsys;
2921  angle += degrees(R.i);
2922  if(a < b) {angle += 90; real tmp = a; a = b; b = tmp;}
2923  if(finite(a) && finite(b)) {
2924  real c = sqrt(abs(a^2 - b^2));
2925  point f1, f2;
2926  if(abs(a - b) < epsgeo) {
2927  f1 = C; f2 = C;
2928  } else {
2929  f1 = point(R, (locate(C) + rotate(angle) * (-c, 0))/R);
2930  f2 = point(R, (locate(C) + rotate(angle) * (c, 0))/R);
2931  }
2932  oe.init(f1, f2, a);
2933  } else {
2934  if(finite(b) || !finite(a)) oe.init(C, C + R.polar(1, angle), infinity);
2935  else oe.init(C, C + R.polar(1, 90 + angle), infinity);
2936  }
2937  return oe;
2938 }
2939 
2940 /*<asyxml><function type="ellipse" signature="ellipse(bqe)"><code></asyxml>*/
2941 ellipse ellipse(bqe bqe)
2942 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the ellipse a[0] * x^2 + a[1] * xy + a[2] * y^2 + a[3] * x + a[4] * y + a[5] = 0
2943  given in the coordinate system of 'bqe' with a[i] = bque.a[i].
2944  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/QuadraticCurve.html"/>
2945  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Ellipse.html"/>.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2946  bqe lbqe = changecoordsys(defaultcoordsys, bqe);
2947  real a = lbqe.a[0], b = lbqe.a[1]/2, c = lbqe.a[2], d = lbqe.a[3]/2, f = lbqe.a[4]/2, g = lbqe.a[5];
2948  coordsys R = bqe.coordsys;
2949  string message = "ellipse: the given equation is not an equation of an ellipse.";
2950  real u = b^2 * g + d^2 * c + f^2 * a;
2951  real delta = a * c * g + b * f * d + d * b * f - u;
2952  if(abs(delta) < epsgeo) abort(message);
2953  real j = b^2 - a * c;
2954  real i = a + c;
2955  real dd = j * (sgnd(c - a) * sqrt((a - c)^2 + 4 * (b^2)) - c-a);
2956  real ddd = j * (-sgnd(c - a) * sqrt((a - c)^2 + 4 * (b^2)) - c-a);
2957 
2958  if(abs(ddd) < epsgeo || abs(dd) < epsgeo ||
2959  j >= -epsgeo || delta/sgnd(i) > 0) abort(message);
2960 
2961  real x = (c * d - b * f)/j, y = (a * f - b * d)/j;
2962  // real dir = abs(b) < epsgeo ? 0 : pi/2-0.5 * acot(0.5 * (c-a)/b);
2963  real dir = abs(b) < epsgeo ? 0 : 0.5 * acot(0.5 * (c - a)/b);
2964  if(dir * (c - a) * b < 0) dir = dir < 0 ? dir + pi/2 : dir - pi/2;
2965  real cd = cos(dir), sd = sin(dir);
2966  real t = a * cd^2 - 2 * b * cd * sd + c * sd^2;
2967  real tt = a * sd^2 + 2 * b * cd * sd + c * cd^2;
2968  real gg = -g + ((d * cd - f * sd)^2)/t + ((d * sd + f * cd)^2)/tt;
2969  t = t/gg; tt = tt/gg;
2970  // The equation of the ellipse is t * (x - center.x)^2 + tt * (y - center.y)^2 = 1;
2971  real aa, bb;
2972  aa = sqrt(2 * (u - 2 * b * d * f - a * c * g)/dd);
2973  bb = sqrt(2 * (u - 2 * b * d * f - a * c * g)/ddd);
2974  a = t > tt ? max(aa, bb) : min(aa, bb);
2975  b = t > tt ? min(aa, bb) : max(aa, bb);
2976  return ellipse(point(R, (x, y)/R),
2977  a, b, degrees(pi/2 - dir - angle(R.i)));
2978 }
2979 
2980 /*<asyxml><function type="ellipse" signature="ellipse(point,point,point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
2981 ellipse ellipse(point M1, point M2, point M3, point M4, point M5)
2982 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the ellipse passing through the five points (if possible)</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2983  return ellipse(bqe(M1, M2, M3, M4, M5));
2984 }
2985 
2986 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="inside(ellipse,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
2987 bool inside(ellipse el, point M)
2988 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'true' iff 'M' is inside 'el'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2989  return abs(el.F1 - M) + abs(el.F2 - M) - 2 * el.a < -epsgeo;
2990 }
2991 
2992 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="inside(parabola,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
2993 bool inside(parabola p, point M)
2994 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'true' if 'M' is inside 'p'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
2995  return distance(p.D, M) - abs(p.F - M) > epsgeo;
2996 }
2997 
2998 /*<asyxml><function type="parabola" signature="parabola(point,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
2999 parabola parabola(point F, line l)
3000 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the parabola whose focus is 'F' and directrix is 'l'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3001  parabola op;
3002  op.init(F, l);
3003  return op;
3004 }
3005 
3006 /*<asyxml><function type="parabola" signature="parabola(point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
3007 parabola parabola(point F, point vertex)
3008 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the parabola whose focus is 'F' and vertex is 'vertex'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3009  parabola op;
3010  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(F, vertex);
3011  point A = rotate(180, P[1]) * P[0];
3012  point B = A + rotateO(90) * unit(P[1]-A);
3013  op.init(P[0], line(A, B));
3014  return op;
3015 }
3016 
3017 /*<asyxml><function type="parabola" signature="parabola(point,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
3018 parabola parabola(point F, real a, real angle)
3019 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the parabola whose focus is F, latus rectum is 4a and
3020  the angle of the axis of symmetry (in the coordinate system of F) is 'angle'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3021  parabola op;
3022  coordsys R = F.coordsys;
3023  point A = F - point(R, R.polar(2a, radians(angle)));
3024  point B = A + point(R, R.polar(1, radians(90 + angle)));
3025  op.init(F, line(A, B));
3026  return op;
3027 }
3028 
3029 /*<asyxml><function type="bool" signature="isparabola(bqe)"><code></asyxml>*/
3030 bool isparabola(bqe bqe)
3031 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return true iff 'bqe' is the equation of a parabola.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3032  bqe lbqe = changecoordsys(defaultcoordsys, bqe);
3033  real a = lbqe.a[0], b = lbqe.a[1]/2, c = lbqe.a[2], d = lbqe.a[3]/2, f = lbqe.a[4]/2, g = lbqe.a[5];
3034  real delta = a * c * g + b * f * d + d * b * f - (b^2 * g + d^2 * c + f^2 * a);
3035  return (abs(delta) > epsgeo && abs(b^2 - a * c) < epsgeo);
3036 }
3037 
3038 /*<asyxml><function type="parabola" signature="parabola(bqe)"><code></asyxml>*/
3039 parabola parabola(bqe bqe)
3040 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the parabola a[0]x^2 + a[1]xy + a[2]y^2 + a[3]x + a[4]y + a[5]] = 0 (a[n] means bqe.a[n]).
3041  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/QuadraticCurve.html"/>
3042  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Parabola.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3043  bqe lbqe = changecoordsys(defaultcoordsys, bqe);
3044  real a = lbqe.a[0], b = lbqe.a[1]/2, c = lbqe.a[2], d = lbqe.a[3]/2, f = lbqe.a[4]/2, g = lbqe.a[5];
3045  string message = "parabola: the given equation is not an equation of a parabola.";
3046  real delta = a * c * g + b * f * d + d * b * f - (b^2 * g + d^2 * c + f^2 * a);
3047  if(abs(delta) < 10 * epsgeo || abs(b^2 - a * c) > 10 * epsgeo) abort(message);
3048  real dir = abs(b) < epsgeo ? 0 : 0.5 * acot(0.5 * (c - a)/b);
3049  if(dir * (c - a) * b < 0) dir = dir < 0 ? dir + pi/2 : dir - pi/2;
3050  real cd = cos(dir), sd = sin(dir);
3051  real ap = a * cd^2 - 2 * b * cd * sd + c * sd^2;
3052  real cp = a * sd^2 + 2 * b * cd * sd + c * cd^2;
3053  real dp = d * cd - f * sd;
3054  real fp = d * sd + f * cd;
3055  real gp = g;
3056  parabola op;
3057  coordsys R = bqe.coordsys;
3058  // The equation of the parabola is ap * x'^2 + cp * y'^2 + 2dp * x'+2fp * y'+gp = 0
3059  if (abs(ap) < epsgeo) {/* directrix parallel to the rotated(dir) y-axis
3060  equation: (y-vertex.y)^2 = 4 * a * (x-vertex)
3061  */
3062  pair pvertex = rotate(degrees(-dir)) * (0.5(-gp + fp^2/cp)/dp, -fp/cp);
3063  real a = -0.5 * dp/cp;
3064  point vertex = point(R, pvertex/R);
3065  point focus = point(R, (pvertex + a * expi(-dir))/R);
3066  op = parabola(focus, vertex);
3067 
3068  } else {/* directrix parallel to the rotated(dir) x-axis
3069  equation: (x-vertex)^2 = 4 * a * (y-vertex.y)
3070  */
3071  pair pvertex = rotate(degrees(-dir)) * (-dp/ap, 0.5 * (-gp + dp^2/ap)/fp);
3072  real a = -0.5 * fp/ap;
3073  point vertex = point(R, pvertex/R);
3074  point focus = point(R, (pvertex + a * expi(pi/2 - dir))/R);
3075  op = parabola(focus, vertex);
3076  }
3077  return op;
3078 }
3079 
3080 /*<asyxml><function type="parabola" signature="parabola(point,point,point,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
3081 parabola parabola(point M1, point M2, point M3, line l)
3082 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the parabola passing through the three points with its directix
3083  parallel to the line 'l'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3084  coordsys R;
3085  pair[] pts;
3086  if (samecoordsys(M1, M2, M3)) {
3087  R = M1.coordsys;
3088  } else {
3089  R = defaultcoordsys;
3090  }
3091  real gle = degrees(l);
3092  coordsys Rp = cartesiansystem(R.O, rotate(gle) * R.i, rotate(gle) * R.j);
3093  pts = new pair[] {coordinates(changecoordsys(Rp, M1)),
3094  coordinates(changecoordsys(Rp, M2)),
3095  coordinates(changecoordsys(Rp, M3))};
3096  real[][] M;
3097  real[] x;
3098  for (int i = 0; i < 3; ++i) {
3099  M[i] = new real[] {pts[i].x, pts[i].y, 1};
3100  x[i] = -pts[i].x^2;
3101  }
3102  real[] coef = solve(M, x);
3103  return parabola(changecoordsys(R, bqe(Rp, 1, 0, 0, coef[0], coef[1], coef[2])));
3104 }
3105 
3106 /*<asyxml><function type="parabola" signature="parabola(point,point,point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
3107 parabola parabola(point M1, point M2, point M3, point M4, point M5)
3108 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the parabola passing through the five points.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3109  return parabola(bqe(M1, M2, M3, M4, M5));
3110 }
3111 
3112 /*<asyxml><function type="hyperbola" signature="hyperbola(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
3113 hyperbola hyperbola(point F1, point F2, point M)
3114 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the hyperbola passing through 'M' whose the foci are 'F1' and 'F2'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3115  real a = abs(abs(F1 - M) - abs(F2 - M));
3116  return hyperbola(F1, F2, finite(a) ? a/2 : a);
3117 }
3118 
3119 /*<asyxml><function type="hyperbola" signature="hyperbola(point,real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
3120 hyperbola hyperbola(point C, real a, real b, real angle = 0)
3121 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the hyperbola centered at 'C' with semimajor axis 'a' along C--C + dir(angle),
3122  semiminor axis 'b' along the perpendicular.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3123  hyperbola oh;
3124  coordsys R = C.coordsys;
3125  angle += degrees(R.i);
3126  real c = sqrt(a^2 + b^2);
3127  point f1 = point(R, (locate(C) + rotate(angle) * (-c, 0))/R);
3128  point f2 = point(R, (locate(C) + rotate(angle) * (c, 0))/R);
3129  oh.init(f1, f2, a);
3130  return oh;
3131 }
3132 
3133 /*<asyxml><function type="hyperbola" signature="hyperbola(bqe)"><code></asyxml>*/
3134 hyperbola hyperbola(bqe bqe)
3135 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the hyperbola a[0]x^2 + a[1]xy + a[2]y^2 + a[3]x + a[4]y + a[5]] = 0 (a[n] means bqe.a[n]).
3136  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/QuadraticCurve.html"/>
3137  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Hyperbola.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3138  bqe lbqe = changecoordsys(defaultcoordsys, bqe);
3139  real a = lbqe.a[0], b = lbqe.a[1]/2, c = lbqe.a[2], d = lbqe.a[3]/2, f = lbqe.a[4]/2, g = lbqe.a[5];
3140  string message = "hyperbola: the given equation is not an equation of a hyperbola.";
3141  real delta = a * c * g + b * f * d + d * b * f - (b^2 * g + d^2 * c + f^2 * a);
3142  if(abs(delta) < 10 * epsgeo || abs(b^2 - a * c) < 0) abort(message);
3143  real dir = abs(b) < epsgeo ? 0 : 0.5 * acot(0.5 * (c - a)/b);
3144  real cd = cos(dir), sd = sin(dir);
3145  real ap = a * cd^2 - 2 * b * cd * sd + c * sd^2;
3146  real cp = a * sd^2 + 2 * b * cd * sd + c * cd^2;
3147  real dp = d * cd - f * sd;
3148  real fp = d * sd + f * cd;
3149  real gp = -g + dp^2/ap + fp^2/cp;
3150  hyperbola op;
3151  coordsys R = bqe.coordsys;
3152  real j = b^2 - a * c;
3153  point C = point(R, ((c * d - b * f)/j, (a * f - b * d)/j)/R);
3154  real aa = gp/ap, bb = gp/cp;
3155  real a = sqrt(abs(aa)), b = sqrt(abs(bb));
3156  if(aa < 0) {dir -= pi/2; aa = a; a = b; b = aa;}
3157  return hyperbola(C, a, b, degrees(-dir - angle(R.i)));
3158 }
3159 
3160 /*<asyxml><function type="hyperbola" signature="hyperbola(point,point,point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
3161 hyperbola hyperbola(point M1, point M2, point M3, point M4, point M5)
3162 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the hyperbola passing through the five points (if possible).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3163  return hyperbola(bqe(M1, M2, M3, M4, M5));
3164 }
3165 
3166 /*<asyxml><function type="hyperbola" signature="conj(hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3167 hyperbola conj(hyperbola h)
3168 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Conjugate.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3169  return hyperbola(h.C, h.b, h.a, 90 + h.angle);
3170 }
3171 
3172 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="circle(explicit point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
3173 circle circle(explicit point C, real r)
3174 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Circle given by center and radius.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3175  circle oc = new circle;
3176  oc.C = C;
3177  oc.r = r;
3178  if(!finite(r)) oc.l = line(C, C + vector(C.coordsys, (1, 0)));
3179  return oc;
3180 }
3181 
3182 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="circle(point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
3183 circle circle(point A, point B)
3184 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the circle of diameter AB.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3185  real r;
3186  circle oc;
3187  real a = abs(A), b = abs(B);
3188  if(finite(a) && finite(b)) {
3189  oc = circle((A + B)/2, abs(A - B)/2);
3190  } else {
3191  oc.r = infinity;
3192  if(finite(abs(A))) oc.l = line(A, A + unit(B));
3193  else {
3194  if(finite(abs(B))) oc.l = line(B, B + unit(A));
3195  else if(finite(abs(A - B)/2)) oc = circle((A + B)/2, abs(A - B)/2); else
3196  oc.l = line(A, B);
3197  }
3198  }
3199  return oc;
3200 }
3201 
3202 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="circle(segment)"><code></asyxml>*/
3203 circle circle(segment s)
3204 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the circle of diameter 's'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3205  return circle(s.A, s.B);
3206 }
3207 
3208 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="circumcenter(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
3209 point circumcenter(point A, point B, point C)
3210 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the circumcenter of triangle ABC.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3211  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(A, B, C);
3212  coordsys R = P[0].coordsys;
3213  pair a = A, b = B, c = C;
3214  pair mAB = (a + b)/2;
3215  pair mAC = (a + c)/2;
3216  pair pp = extension(mAB, rotate(90, mAB) * a, mAC, rotate(90, mAC) * c);
3217  return point(R, pp/R);
3218 }
3219 
3220 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="circle(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
3221 circle circle(point A, point B, point C)
3222 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the circumcircle of the triangle ABC.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3223  if(collinear(A - B, A - C)) {
3224  circle oc;
3225  oc.r = infinity;
3226  oc.C = (A + B + C)/3;
3227  oc.l = line(oc.C, oc.C == A ? B : A);
3228  return oc;
3229  }
3230  point c = circumcenter(A, B, C);
3231  return circle(c, abs(c - A));
3232 }
3233 
3234 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="circumcircle(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
3235 circle circumcircle(point A, point B, point C)
3236 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the circumcircle of the triangle ABC.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3237  return circle(A, B, C);
3238 }
3239 
3240 /*<asyxml><operator type = "circle" signature="*(real,explicit circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
3241 circle operator *(real x, explicit circle c)
3242 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Multiply the radius of 'c'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3243  return finite(c.r) ? circle(c.C, x * c.r) : c;
3244 }
3245 circle operator *(int x, explicit circle c)
3246 {
3247  return finite(c.r) ? circle(c.C, x * c.r) : c;
3248 }
3249 /*<asyxml><operator type = "circle" signature="/(explicit circle,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
3250 circle operator /(explicit circle c, real x)
3251 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Divide the radius of 'c'</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3252  return finite(c.r) ? circle(c.C, c.r/x) : c;
3253 }
3254 circle operator /(explicit circle c, int x)
3255 {
3256  return finite(c.r) ? circle(c.C, c.r/x) : c;
3257 }
3258 /*<asyxml><operator type = "circle" signature="+(explicit circle,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
3259 circle operator +(explicit circle c, explicit point M)
3260 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Translation of 'c'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3261  return circle(c.C + M, c.r);
3262 }
3263 /*<asyxml><operator type = "circle" signature="-(explicit circle,explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
3264 circle operator -(explicit circle c, explicit point M)
3265 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Translation of 'c'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3266  return circle(c.C - M, c.r);
3267 }
3268 /*<asyxml><operator type = "circle" signature="+(explicit circle,pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
3269 circle operator +(explicit circle c, pair m)
3270 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Translation of 'c'.
3271  'm' represent coordinates in the coordinate system where 'c' is defined.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3272  return circle(c.C + m, c.r);
3273 }
3274 /*<asyxml><operator type = "circle" signature="-(explicit circle,pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
3275 circle operator -(explicit circle c, pair m)
3276 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Translation of 'c'.
3277  'm' represent coordinates in the coordinate system where 'c' is defined.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3278  return circle(c.C - m, c.r);
3279 }
3280 /*<asyxml><operator type = "circle" signature="+(explicit circle,vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
3281 circle operator +(explicit circle c, vector m)
3282 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Translation of 'c'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3283  return circle(c.C + m, c.r);
3284 }
3285 /*<asyxml><operator type = "circle" signature="-(explicit circle,vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
3286 circle operator -(explicit circle c, vector m)
3287 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Translation of 'c'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3288  return circle(c.C - m, c.r);
3289 }
3290 /*<asyxml><operator type = "real" signature="^(point,explicit circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
3291 real operator ^(point M, explicit circle c)
3292 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The power of 'M' with respect to the circle 'c'</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3293  return xpart((abs(locate(M) - locate(c.C)), c.r)^2);
3294 }
3295 /*<asyxml><operator type = "bool" signature="@(point,explicit circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
3296 bool operator @(point M, explicit circle c)
3297 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return true iff 'M' is on the circle 'c'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3298  return finite(c.r) ?
3299  abs(abs(locate(M) - locate(c.C)) - abs(c.r)) <= 10 * epsgeo :
3300  M @ c.l;
3301 }
3302 
3303 /*<asyxml><operator type = "ellipse" signature="cast(circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
3304 ellipse operator cast(circle c)
3305 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3306  return finite(c.r) ? ellipse(c.C, c.r, c.r, 0) : ellipse(c.l.A, c.l.B, infinity);
3307 }
3308 
3309 /*<asyxml><operator type = "circle" signature="cast(ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
3310 circle operator ecast(ellipse el)
3311 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3312  circle oc;
3313  bool infb = (!finite(el.a) || !finite(el.b));
3314  if(!infb && abs(el.a - el.b) > epsgeo)
3315  abort("Can not cast ellipse with different axis values to circle");
3316  oc = circle(el.C, infb ? infinity : el.a);
3317  oc.l = el.l.copy();
3318  return oc;
3319 }
3320 
3321 /*<asyxml><operator type = "ellipse" signature="cast(conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
3322 ellipse operator ecast(conic co)
3323 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast a conic to an ellipse (can be a circle).</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3324  if(degenerate(co) && co.e < 1) return ellipse(co.l[0].A, co.l[0].B, infinity);
3325  ellipse oe;
3326  if(co.e < 1) {
3327  real a = co.p/(1 - co.e^2);
3328  real c = co.e * a;
3329  vector v = co.D.v;
3330  if(!sameside(co.D.A + v, co.F, co.D)) v = -v;
3331  point f2 = co.F + 2 * c * v;
3332  f2 = changecoordsys(co.F.coordsys, f2);
3333  oe = a == 0 ? ellipse(co.F, co.p, co.p, 0) : ellipse(co.F, f2, a);
3334  } else
3335  abort("casting: The conic section is not an ellipse.");
3336  return oe;
3337 }
3338 
3339 /*<asyxml><operator type = "parabola" signature="cast(conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
3340 parabola operator ecast(conic co)
3341 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast a conic to a parabola.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3342  parabola op;
3343  if(abs(co.e - 1) > epsgeo) abort("casting: The conic section is not a parabola.");
3344  op.init(co.F, co.D);
3345  return op;
3346 }
3347 
3348 /*<asyxml><operator type = "conic" signature="cast(parabola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3349 conic operator cast(parabola p)
3350 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast a parabola to a conic section.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3351  return conic(p.F, p.D, 1);
3352 }
3353 
3354 /*<asyxml><operator type = "hyperbola" signature="cast(conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
3355 hyperbola operator ecast(conic co)
3356 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast a conic section to an hyperbola.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3357  hyperbola oh;
3358  if(co.e > 1) {
3359  real a = co.p/(co.e^2 - 1);
3360  real c = co.e * a;
3361  vector v = co.D.v;
3362  if(sameside(co.D.A + v, co.F, co.D)) v = -v;
3363  point f2 = co.F + 2 * c * v;
