3364  f2 = changecoordsys(co.F.coordsys, f2);
3365  oh = hyperbola(co.F, f2, a);
3366  } else
3367  abort("casting: The conic section is not an hyperbola.");
3368  return oh;
3369 }
3370 
3371 /*<asyxml><operator type = "conic" signature="cast(hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3372 conic operator cast(hyperbola h)
3373 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Hyperbola to conic section.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3374  return conic(h.F1, h.D1, h.e);
3375 }
3376 
3377 /*<asyxml><operator type = "conic" signature="cast(ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
3378 conic operator cast(ellipse el)
3379 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Ellipse to conic section.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3380  conic oc;
3381  if(abs(el.c) > epsgeo) {
3382  real x = el.a^2/el.c;
3383  point O = (el.F1 + el.F2)/2;
3384  point A = O + x * unit(el.F1 - el.F2);
3385  oc = conic(el.F1, perpendicular(A, line(el.F1, el.F2)), el.e);
3386  } else {//The ellipse is a circle
3387  coordsys R = coordsys(el);
3388  point M = el.F1 + point(R, R.polar(el.a, 0));
3389  line l = line(rotate(90, M) * el.F1, M);
3390  oc = conic(el.F1, l, 0);
3391  }
3392  if(degenerate(el)) {
3393  oc.p = infinity;
3394  oc.h = infinity;
3395  oc.l = new line[]{el.l};
3396  }
3397  return oc;
3398 }
3399 
3400 /*<asyxml><operator type = "conic" signature="cast(circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
3401 conic operator cast(circle c)
3402 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Circle to conic section.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3403  return (conic)((ellipse)c);
3404 }
3405 
3406 /*<asyxml><operator type = "circle" signature="cast(conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
3407 circle operator ecast(conic c)
3408 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Conic section to circle.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3409  ellipse el = (ellipse)c;
3410  circle oc;
3411  if(abs(el.a - el.b) < epsgeo) {
3412  oc = circle(el.C, el.a);
3413  if(degenerate(c)) oc.l = c.l[0];
3414  }
3415  else abort("Can not cast this conic to a circle");
3416  return oc;
3417 }
3418 
3419 /*<asyxml><operator type = "ellipse" signature="*(transform,ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
3420 ellipse operator *(transform t, ellipse el)
3421 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide transform * ellipse.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3422  if(!degenerate(el)) {
3423  point[] ep;
3424  for (int i = 0; i < 360; i += 72) {
3425  ep.push(t * angpoint(el, i));
3426  }
3427  ellipse oe = ellipse(ep[0], ep[1], ep[2], ep[3], ep[4]);
3428  if(angpoint(oe, 0) != ep[0]) return ellipse(oe.F2, oe.F1, oe.a);
3429  return oe;
3430  }
3431  return ellipse(t * el.l.A, t * el.l.B, infinity);
3432 }
3433 
3434 /*<asyxml><operator type = "parabola" signature="*(transform,parabola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3435 parabola operator *(transform t, parabola p)
3436 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide transform * parabola.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3437  point[] P;
3438  P.push(t * angpoint(p, 45));
3439  P.push(t * angpoint(p, -45));
3440  P.push(t * angpoint(p, 180));
3441  parabola op = parabola(P[0], P[1], P[2], t * p.D);
3442  op.bmin = p.bmin;
3443  op.bmax = p.bmax;
3444 
3445  return op;
3446 }
3447 
3448 /*<asyxml><operator type = "ellipse" signature="*(transform,circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
3449 ellipse operator *(transform t, circle c)
3450 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide transform * circle.
3451  For example, 'circle C = scale(2) * circle' and 'ellipse E = xscale(2) * circle' are valid
3452  but 'circle C = xscale(2) * circle' is invalid.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3453  return t * ((ellipse)c);
3454 }
3455 
3456 /*<asyxml><operator type = "hyperbola" signature="*(transform,hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3457 hyperbola operator *(transform t, hyperbola h)
3458 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide transform * hyperbola.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3459  if (t == identity()) {
3460  return h;
3461  }
3462 
3463  point[] ep;
3464  for (int i = 90; i <= 270; i += 45) {
3465  ep.push(t * angpoint(h, i));
3466  }
3467 
3468  hyperbola oe = hyperbola(ep[0], ep[1], ep[2], ep[3], ep[4]);
3469  if(angpoint(oe, 90) != ep[0]) {
3470  oe = hyperbola(oe.F2, oe.F1, oe.a);
3471  }
3472 
3473  oe.bmin = h.bmin;
3474  oe.bmax = h.bmax;
3475 
3476  return oe;
3477 }
3478 
3479 /*<asyxml><operator type = "conic" signature="*(transform,conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
3480 conic operator *(transform t, conic co)
3481 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide transform * conic.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3482  if(co.e < 1) return (t * ((ellipse)co));
3483  if(co.e == 1) return (t * ((parabola)co));
3484  return (t * ((hyperbola)co));
3485 }
3486 
3487 /*<asyxml><operator type = "ellipse" signature="*(real,ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
3488 ellipse operator *(real x, ellipse el)
3489 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Identical but more efficient (rapid) than 'scale(x, el.C) * el'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3490  return degenerate(el) ? el : ellipse(el.C, x * el.a, x * el.b, el.angle);
3491 }
3492 
3493 /*<asyxml><operator type = "ellipse" signature="/(ellipse,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
3494 ellipse operator /(ellipse el, real x)
3495 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Identical but more efficient (rapid) than 'scale(1/x, el.C) * el'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3496  return degenerate(el) ? el : ellipse(el.C, el.a/x, el.b/x, el.angle);
3497 }
3498 
3499 /*<asyxml><function type="path" signature="arcfromcenter(ellipse,real,real,int,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
3500 path arcfromcenter(ellipse el, real angle1, real angle2,
3501  bool direction=CCW,
3502  int n=ellipsenodesnumber(el.a,el.b,angle1,angle2,direction))
3503 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the path of the ellipse 'el' from angle1 to angle2 in degrees,
3504  drawing in the given direction, with n nodes.
3505  The angles are mesured relatively to the axis (C,x-axis) where C is
3506  the center of the ellipse.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3507  if(degenerate(el)) abort("arcfromcenter: can not convert degenerated ellipse to path.");
3508  if (angle1 > angle2)
3509  return reverse(arcfromcenter(el, angle2, angle1, !direction, n));
3510 
3511  guide op;
3512  coordsys Rp=coordsys(el);
3513  if (n < 1) return op;
3514 
3515  interpolate join = operator ..;
3516  real stretch = max(el.a/el.b, el.b/el.a);
3517 
3518  if (stretch > 10) {
3519  n *= floor(stretch/5);
3520  join = operator --;
3521  }
3522 
3523  real a1 = direction ? radians(angle1) : radians(angle2);
3524  real a2 = direction ? radians(angle2) : radians(angle1) + 2 * pi;
3525  real step=(a2 - a1)/(n != 1 ? n-1 : 1);
3526  real a, r;
3527  real da = radians(el.angle);
3528 
3529  for (int i=0; i < n; ++i) {
3530  a = a1 + i * step;
3531  r = el.b/sqrt(1 - (el.e * cos(a))^2);
3532  op = join(op, Rp*Rp.polar(r, da + a));
3533  }
3534 
3535  return shift(el.C.x*Rp.i + el.C.y*Rp.j) * (direction ? op : reverse(op));
3536 }
3537 
3538 /*<asyxml><function type="path" signature="arcfromcenter(hyperbola,real,real,int,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
3539 path arcfromcenter(hyperbola h, real angle1, real angle2,
3540  int n = hyperbolanodesnumber(h, angle1, angle2),
3541  bool direction = CCW)
3542 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the path of the hyperbola 'h' from angle1 to angle2 in degrees,
3543  drawing in the given direction, with n nodes.
3544  The angles are mesured relatively to the axis (C, x-axis) where C is
3545  the center of the hyperbola.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3546  guide op;
3547  coordsys Rp = coordsys(h);
3548  if (n < 1) return op;
3549  if (angle1 > angle2) {
3550  path g = reverse(arcfromcenter(h, angle2, angle1, n, !direction));
3551  return g == nullpath ? g : reverse(g);
3552  }
3553  real a1 = direction ? radians(angle1) : radians(angle2);
3554  real a2 = direction ? radians(angle2) : radians(angle1) + 2 * pi;
3555  real step = (a2 - a1)/(n != 1 ? n - 1 : 1);
3556  real a, r;
3557  typedef guide interpolate(... guide[]);
3558  interpolate join = operator ..;
3559  real da = radians(h.angle);
3560  for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
3561  a = a1 + i * step;
3562  r = (h.b * cos(a))^2 - (h.a * sin(a))^2;
3563  if(r > epsgeo) {
3564  r = sqrt(h.a^2 * h.b^2/r);
3565  op = join(op, Rp * Rp.polar(r, a + da));
3566  join = operator ..;
3567  } else join = operator --;
3568  }
3569  return shift(h.C.x * Rp.i + h.C.y * Rp.j)*
3570  (direction ? op : op == nullpath ? op : reverse(op));
3571 }
3572 
3573 /*<asyxml><function type="path" signature="arcfromcenter(explicit conic,real,real,int,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
3574 path arcfromcenter(explicit conic co, real angle1, real angle2,
3575  int n, bool direction = CCW)
3576 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Use arcfromcenter(ellipse, ...) or arcfromcenter(hyperbola, ...) depending of
3577  the eccentricity of 'co'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3578  path g;
3579  if(co.e < 1)
3580  g = arcfromcenter((ellipse)co, angle1,
3581  angle2, direction, n);
3582  else if(co.e > 1)
3583  g = arcfromcenter((hyperbola)co, angle1,
3584  angle2, n, direction);
3585  else abort("arcfromcenter: does not exist for a parabola.");
3586  return g;
3587 }
3588 
3589 /*<asyxml><constant type = "polarconicroutine" signature="fromCenter"><code></asyxml>*/
3590 restricted polarconicroutine fromCenter = arcfromcenter;/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></constant></asyxml>*/
3591 /*<asyxml><constant type = "polarconicroutine" signature="fromFocus"><code></asyxml>*/
3592 restricted polarconicroutine fromFocus = arcfromfocus;/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></constant></asyxml>*/
3593 
3594 /*<asyxml><function type="bqe" signature="equation(ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
3595 bqe equation(ellipse el)
3596 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the coefficients of the equation of the ellipse in its coordinate system:
3597  bqe.a[0] * x^2 + bqe.a[1] * x * y + bqe.a[2] * y^2 + bqe.a[3] * x + bqe.a[4] * y + bqe.a[5] = 0.
3598  One can change the coordinate system of 'bqe' using the routine 'changecoordsys'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3599  pair[] pts;
3600  for (int i = 0; i < 360; i += 72)
3601  pts.push(locate(angpoint(el, i)));
3602 
3603  real[][] M;
3604  real[] x;
3605  for (int i = 0; i < 5; ++i) {
3606  M[i] = new real[] {pts[i].x * pts[i].y, pts[i].y^2, pts[i].x, pts[i].y, 1};
3607  x[i] = -pts[i].x^2;
3608  }
3609  real[] coef = solve(M, x);
3610  bqe bqe = changecoordsys(coordsys(el),
3611  bqe(defaultcoordsys,
3612  1, coef[0], coef[1], coef[2], coef[3], coef[4]));
3613  bqe.a = approximate(bqe.a);
3614  return bqe;
3615 }
3616 
3617 /*<asyxml><function type="bqe" signature="equation(parabola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3618 bqe equation(parabola p)
3619 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the coefficients of the equation of the parabola in its coordinate system.
3620  bqe.a[0] * x^2 + bqe.a[1] * x * y + bqe.a[2] * y^2 + bqe.a[3] * x + bqe.a[4] * y + bqe.a[5] = 0
3621  One can change the coordinate system of 'bqe' using the routine 'changecoordsys'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3622  coordsys R = canonicalcartesiansystem(p);
3623  parabola tp = (parabola) changecoordsys(R, p);
3624  point A = projection(tp.D) * point(R, (0, 0));
3625  real a = abs(A);
3626  return changecoordsys(coordsys(p),
3627  bqe(R, 0, 0, 1, -4 * a, 0, 0));
3628 }
3629 
3630 /*<asyxml><function type="bqe" signature="equation(hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3631 bqe equation(hyperbola h)
3632 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the coefficients of the equation of the hyperbola in its coordinate system.
3633  bqe.a[0] * x^2 + bqe.a[1] * x * y + bqe.a[2] * y^2 + bqe.a[3] * x + bqe.a[4] * y + bqe.a[5] = 0
3634  One can change the coordinate system of 'bqe' using the routine 'changecoordsys'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3635  coordsys R = canonicalcartesiansystem(h);
3636  return changecoordsys(coordsys(h),
3637  bqe(R, 1/h.a^2, 0, -1/h.b^2, 0, 0, -1));
3638 }
3639 
3640 /*<asyxml><operator type = "path" signature="cast(ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
3641 path operator cast(ellipse el)
3642 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast ellipse to path.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3643  if(degenerate(el))
3644  abort("Casting degenerated ellipse to path is not possible.");
3645  int n = el.e == 0 ? circlenodesnumber(el.a) : ellipsenodesnumber(el.a, el.b);
3646  return arcfromcenter(el, 0.0, 360, CCW, n)&cycle;
3647 }
3648 
3649 /*<asyxml><operator type = "path" signature="cast(circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
3650 path operator cast(circle c)
3651 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast circle to path.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3652  return (path)((ellipse)c);
3653 }
3654 
3655 /*<asyxml><function type="real[]" signature="bangles(picture,parabola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3656 real[] bangles(picture pic = currentpicture, parabola p)
3657 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the array {ma, Ma} where 'ma' and 'Ma' are respectively
3658  the smaller and the larger angles for which the parabola 'p' is included
3659  in the bounding box of the picture 'pic'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3660  pair bmin, bmax;
3661  pair[] b;
3662  if (p.bmin == p.bmax) {
3663  bmin = pic.userMin();
3664  bmax = pic.userMax();
3665  } else {
3666  bmin = p.bmin;bmax = p.bmax;
3667  }
3668  if(bmin.x == bmax.x || bmin.y == bmax.y || !finite(abs(bmin)) || !finite(abs(bmax)))
3669  return new real[] {0, 0};
3670  b[0] = bmin;
3671  b[1] = (bmax.x, bmin.y);
3672  b[2] = bmax;
3673  b[3] = (bmin.x, bmax.y);
3674  real[] eq = changecoordsys(defaultcoordsys, equation(p)).a;
3675  pair[] inter;
3676  for (int i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
3677  pair[] tmp = intersectionpoints(b[i], b[(i + 1)%4], eq);
3678  for (int j = 0; j < tmp.length; ++j) {
3679  if(dot(b[i]-tmp[j], b[(i + 1)%4]-tmp[j]) <= epsgeo)
3680  inter.push(tmp[j]);
3681  }
3682  }
3683  pair F = p.F, V = p.V;
3684  real d = degrees(F - V);
3685  real[] a = sequence(new real(int n){
3686  return (360 - d + degrees(inter[n]-F))%360;
3687  }, inter.length);
3688  real ma = a.length != 0 ? min(a) : 0, Ma= a.length != 0 ? max(a) : 0;
3689  return new real[] {ma, Ma};
3690 }
3691 
3692 /*<asyxml><function type="real[][]" signature="bangles(picture,hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3693 real[][] bangles(picture pic = currentpicture, hyperbola h)
3694 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the array {{ma1, Ma1}, {ma2, Ma2}} where 'maX' and 'MaX' are respectively
3695  the smaller and the bigger angles (from h.FX) for which the hyperbola 'h' is included
3696  in the bounding box of the picture 'pic'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3697  pair bmin, bmax;
3698  pair[] b;
3699  if (h.bmin == h.bmax) {
3700  bmin = pic.userMin();
3701  bmax = pic.userMax();
3702  } else {
3703  bmin = h.bmin;bmax = h.bmax;
3704  }
3705  if(bmin.x == bmax.x || bmin.y == bmax.y || !finite(abs(bmin)) || !finite(abs(bmax)))
3706  return new real[][] {{0, 0}, {0, 0}};
3707  b[0] = bmin;
3708  b[1] = (bmax.x, bmin.y);
3709  b[2] = bmax;
3710  b[3] = (bmin.x, bmax.y);
3711  real[] eq = changecoordsys(defaultcoordsys, equation(h)).a;
3712  pair[] inter0, inter1;
3713  pair C = locate(h.C);
3714  pair F1 = h.F1;
3715  for (int i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
3716  pair[] tmp = intersectionpoints(b[i], b[(i + 1)%4], eq);
3717  for (int j = 0; j < tmp.length; ++j) {
3718  if(dot(b[i]-tmp[j], b[(i + 1)%4]-tmp[j]) <= epsgeo) {
3719  if(dot(F1 - C, tmp[j]-C) > 0) inter0.push(tmp[j]);
3720  else inter1.push(tmp[j]);
3721  }
3722  }
3723  }
3724  real d = degrees(F1 - C);
3725  real[] ma, Ma;
3726  pair[][] inter = new pair[][] {inter0, inter1};
3727  for (int i = 0; i < 2; ++i) {
3728  real[] a = sequence(new real(int n){
3729  return (360 - d + degrees(inter[i][n]-F1))%360;
3730  }, inter[i].length);
3731  ma[i] = a.length != 0 ? min(a) : 0;
3732  Ma[i] = a.length != 0 ? max(a) : 0;
3733  }
3734  return new real[][] {{ma[0], Ma[0]}, {ma[1], Ma[1]}};
3735 }
3736 
3737 /*<asyxml><operator type = "path" signature="cast(parabola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3738 path operator cast(parabola p)
3739 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast parabola to path.
3740  If possible, the returned path is restricted to the actual bounding box
3741  of the current picture if the variables 'p.bmin' and 'p.bmax' are not set else
3742  the bounding box of box(p.bmin, p.bmax) is used instead.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3743  real[] bangles = bangles(p);
3744  int n = parabolanodesnumber(p, bangles[0], bangles[1]);
3745  return arcfromfocus(p, bangles[0], bangles[1], n, CCW);
3746 }
3747 
3748 
3749 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="draw(picture,Label,circle,align,pen,arrowbar,arrowbar,margin,Label,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
3750 void draw(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L = "", circle c,
3751  align align = NoAlign, pen p = currentpen,
3752  arrowbar arrow = None, arrowbar bar = None,
3753  margin margin = NoMargin, Label legend = "", marker marker = nomarker)
3754 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3755  if(degenerate(c)) draw(pic, L, c.l, align, p, arrow, legend, marker);
3756  else draw(pic, L, (path)c, align, p, arrow, bar, margin, legend, marker);
3757 }
3758 
3759 void fill(picture pic = currentpicture, circle c, pen p = currentpen)
3760 {
3761  if (!degenerate(c)) fill(pic, (path)c, p);
3762 }
3763 
3764 void filldraw(picture pic = currentpicture, circle c, pen fillpen = currentpen, pen drawpen = currentpen)
3765 {
3766  fill(pic, c, fillpen);
3767  draw(pic, c, drawpen);
3768 }
3769 
3770 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="draw(picture,Label,ellipse,align,pen,arrowbar,arrowbar,margin,Label,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
3771 void draw(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L = "", ellipse el,
3772  align align = NoAlign, pen p = currentpen,
3773  arrowbar arrow = None, arrowbar bar = None,
3774  margin margin = NoMargin, Label legend = "", marker marker = nomarker)
3775 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation>Draw the ellipse 'el' if it is not degenerated else draw 'el.l'.</function></asyxml>*/
3776  if(degenerate(el)) draw(pic, L, el.l, align, p, arrow, legend, marker);
3777  else draw(pic, L, (path)el, align, p, arrow, bar, margin, legend, marker);
3778 }
3779 
3780 void fill(picture pic = currentpicture, ellipse el, pen p = currentpen)
3781 {
3782  if (!degenerate(el)) fill(pic, (path)el, p);
3783 }
3784 
3785 void filldraw(picture pic = currentpicture, ellipse el, pen fillpen = currentpen, pen drawpen = currentpen)
3786 {
3787  fill(pic, el, fillpen);
3788  draw(pic, el, drawpen);
3789 }
3790 
3791 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="draw(picture,Label,parabola,align,pen,arrowbar,arrowbar,margin,Label,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
3792 void draw(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L = "", parabola parabola,
3793  align align = NoAlign, pen p = currentpen,
3794  arrowbar arrow = None, arrowbar bar = None,
3795  margin margin = NoMargin, Label legend = "", marker marker = nomarker)
3796 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw the parabola 'p' on 'pic' without (if possible) altering the
3797  size of picture pic.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3798  pic.add(new void (frame f, transform t, transform T, pair m, pair M) {
3799  // Reduce the bounds by the size of the pen and the margins.
3800  m -= min(p); M -= max(p);
3801  parabola.bmin = inverse(t) * m;
3802  parabola.bmax = inverse(t) * M;
3803  picture tmp;
3804  path pp = t * ((path) (T * parabola));
3805 
3806  if (pp != nullpath) {
3807  draw(tmp, L, pp, align, p, arrow, bar, NoMargin, legend, marker);
3808  add(f, tmp.fit());
3809  }
3810  }, true);
3811 
3812  pair m = pic.userMin(), M = pic.userMax();
3813  if(m != M) {
3814  pic.addBox(truepoint(SW), truepoint(NE));
3815  }
3816 }
3817 
3818 /*<asyxml><operator type = "path" signature="cast(hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3819 path operator cast(hyperbola h)
3820 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast hyperbola to path.
3821  If possible, the returned path is restricted to the actual bounding box
3822  of the current picture unless the variables 'h.bmin' and 'h.bmax'
3823  are set; in this case the bounding box of box(h.bmin, h.bmax) is used instead.
3824  Only the branch on the side of 'h.F1' is considered.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3825  real[][] bangles = bangles(h);
3826  int n = hyperbolanodesnumber(h, bangles[0][0], bangles[0][1]);
3827  return arcfromfocus(h, bangles[0][0], bangles[0][1], n, CCW);
3828 }
3829 
3830 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="draw(picture,Label,hyperbola,align,pen,arrowbar,arrowbar,margin,Label,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
3831 void draw(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L = "", hyperbola h,
3832  align align = NoAlign, pen p = currentpen,
3833  arrowbar arrow = None, arrowbar bar = None,
3834  margin margin = NoMargin, Label legend = "", marker marker = nomarker)
3835 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw the hyperbola 'h' on 'pic' without (if possible) altering the
3836  size of the picture pic.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3837  pic.add(new void (frame f, transform t, transform T, pair m, pair M) {
3838  // Reduce the bounds by the size of the pen and the margins.
3839  m -= min(p); M -= max(p);
3840  h.bmin = inverse(t) * m;
3841  h.bmax = inverse(t) * M;
3842  path hp;
3843 
3844  picture tmp;
3845  hp = t * ((path) (T * h));
3846  if (hp != nullpath) {
3847  draw(tmp, L, hp, align, p, arrow, bar, NoMargin, legend, marker);
3848  }
3849 
3850  hyperbola ht = hyperbola(h.F2, h.F1, h.a);
3851  ht.bmin = h.bmin;
3852  ht.bmax = h.bmax;
3853 
3854  hp = t * ((path) (T * ht));
3855  if (hp != nullpath) {
3856  draw(tmp, "", hp, align, p, arrow, bar, NoMargin, marker);
3857  }
3858 
3859  add(f, tmp.fit());
3860  }, true);
3861 
3862  pair m = pic.userMin(), M = pic.userMax();
3863  if(m != M)
3864  pic.addBox(truepoint(SW), truepoint(NE));
3865 }
3866 
3867 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="draw(picture,Label,explicit conic,align,pen,arrowbar,arrowbar,margin,Label,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
3868 void draw(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L = "", explicit conic co,
3869  align align = NoAlign, pen p = currentpen,
3870  arrowbar arrow = None, arrowbar bar = None,
3871  margin margin = NoMargin, Label legend = "", marker marker = nomarker)
3872 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Use one of the routine 'draw(ellipse, ...)',
3873  'draw(parabola, ...)' or 'draw(hyperbola, ...)' depending of the value of eccentricity of 'co'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3874  if(co.e == 0)
3875  draw(pic, L, (circle)co, align, p, arrow, bar, margin, legend, marker);
3876  else
3877  if(co.e < 1) draw(pic, L, (ellipse)co, align, p, arrow, bar, margin, legend, marker);
3878  else
3879  if(co.e == 1) draw(pic, L, (parabola)co, align, p, arrow, bar, margin, legend, marker);
3880  else
3881  if(co.e > 1) draw(pic, L, (hyperbola)co, align, p, arrow, bar, margin, legend, marker);
3882  else abort("draw: unknown conic.");
3883 }
3884 
3885 /*<asyxml><function type="int" signature="conicnodesnumber(conic,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
3886 int conicnodesnumber(conic co, real angle1, real angle2, bool dir = CCW)
3887 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the number of node to draw a conic arc.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3888  int oi;
3889  if(co.e == 0) {
3890  circle c = (circle)co;
3891  oi = circlenodesnumber(c.r, angle1, angle2);
3892  } else if(co.e < 1) {
3893  ellipse el = (ellipse)co;
3894  oi = ellipsenodesnumber(el.a, el.b, angle1, angle2, dir);
3895  } else if(co.e == 1) {
3896  parabola p = (parabola)co;
3897  oi = parabolanodesnumber(p, angle1, angle2);
3898  } else {
3899  hyperbola h = (hyperbola)co;
3900  oi = hyperbolanodesnumber(h, angle1, angle2);
3901  }
3902  return oi;
3903 }
3904 
3905 /*<asyxml><operator type = "path" signature="cast(conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
3906 path operator cast(conic co)
3907 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast conic section to path.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
3908  if(co.e < 1) return (path)((ellipse)co);
3909  if(co.e == 1) return (path)((parabola)co);
3910  return (path)((hyperbola)co);
3911 }
3912 
3913 /*<asyxml><function type="bqe" signature="equation(explicit conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
3914 bqe equation(explicit conic co)
3915 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the coefficients of the equation of conic section in its coordinate system:
3916  bqe.a[0] * x^2 + bqe.a[1] * x * y + bqe.a[2] * y^2 + bqe.a[3] * x + bqe.a[4] * y + bqe.a[5] = 0.
3917  One can change the coordinate system of 'bqe' using the routine 'changecoordsys'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3918  bqe obqe;
3919  if(co.e == 0)
3920  obqe = equation((circle)co);
3921  else
3922  if(co.e < 1) obqe = equation((ellipse)co);
3923  else
3924  if(co.e == 1) obqe = equation((parabola)co);
3925  else
3926  if(co.e > 1) obqe = equation((hyperbola)co);
3927  else abort("draw: unknown conic.");
3928  return obqe;
3929 }
3930 
3931 /*<asyxml><function type="string" signature="conictype(bqe)"><code></asyxml>*/
3932 string conictype(bqe bqe)
3933 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Returned values are "ellipse" or "parabola" or "hyperbola"
3934  depending of the conic section represented by 'bqe'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3935  bqe lbqe = changecoordsys(defaultcoordsys, bqe);
3936  string os = "degenerated";
3937  real a = lbqe.a[0], b = lbqe.a[1]/2, c = lbqe.a[2], d = lbqe.a[3]/2, f = lbqe.a[4]/2, g = lbqe.a[5];
3938  real delta = a * c * g + b * f * d + d * b * f - (b^2 * g + d^2 * c + f^2 * a);
3939  if(abs(delta) < 10 * epsgeo) return os;
3940  real J = a * c - b^2;
3941  real I = a + c;
3942  if(J > epsgeo) {
3943  if(delta/I < -epsgeo);
3944  os = "ellipse";
3945  } else {
3946  if(abs(J) < epsgeo) os = "parabola"; else os = "hyperbola";
3947  }
3948  return os;
3949 }
3950 
3951 /*<asyxml><function type="conic" signature="conic(point,point,point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
3952 conic conic(point M1, point M2, point M3, point M4, point M5)
3953 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the conic passing through 'M1', 'M2', 'M3', 'M4' and 'M5' if the conic is not degenerated.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3954  bqe bqe = bqe(M1, M2, M3, M4, M5);
3955  string ct = conictype(bqe);
3956  if(ct == "degenerated") abort("conic: degenerated conic passing through five points.");
3957  if(ct == "ellipse") return ellipse(bqe);
3958  if(ct == "parabola") return parabola(bqe);
3959  return hyperbola(bqe);
3960 }
3961 
3962 /*<asyxml><function type="coordsys" signature="canonicalcartesiansystem(hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
3963 coordsys canonicalcartesiansystem(explicit conic co)
3964 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the canonical cartesian system of the conic 'co'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3965  if(co.e < 1) return canonicalcartesiansystem((ellipse)co);
3966  else if(co.e == 1) return canonicalcartesiansystem((parabola)co);
3967  return canonicalcartesiansystem((hyperbola)co);
3968 }
3969 
3970 /*<asyxml><function type="bqe" signature="canonical(bqe)"><code></asyxml>*/
3971 bqe canonical(bqe bqe)
3972 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the bivariate quadratic equation relative to the
3973  canonical coordinate system of the conic section represented by 'bqe'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3974  string type = conictype(bqe);
3975  if(type == "") abort("canonical: the equation can not be performed.");
3976  bqe obqe;
3977  if(type == "ellipse") {
3978  ellipse el = ellipse(bqe);
3979  obqe = changecoordsys(canonicalcartesiansystem(el), equation(el));
3980  } else {
3981  if(type == "parabola") {
3982  parabola p = parabola(bqe);
3983  obqe = changecoordsys(canonicalcartesiansystem(p), equation(p));
3984  } else {
3985  hyperbola h = hyperbola(bqe);
3986  obqe = changecoordsys(canonicalcartesiansystem(h), equation(h));
3987  }
3988  }
3989  return obqe;
3990 }
3991 
3992 /*<asyxml><function type="conic" signature="conic(bqe)"><code></asyxml>*/
3993 conic conic(bqe bqe)
3994 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the conic section represented by the bivariate quartic equation 'bqe'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
3995  string type = conictype(bqe);
3996  if(type == "") abort("canonical: the equation can not be performed.");
3997  conic oc;
3998  if(type == "ellipse") {
3999  oc = ellipse(bqe);
4000  } else {
4001  if(type == "parabola") oc = parabola(bqe); else oc = hyperbola(bqe);
4002  }
4003  return oc;
4004 }
4005 
4006 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="arclength(circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
4007 real arclength(circle c)
4008 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4009  return c.r * 2 * pi;
4010 }
4011 
4012 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="focusToCenter(ellipse,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4013 real focusToCenter(ellipse el, real a)
4014 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angle relatively to the center of 'el' for the angle 'a'
4015  given relatively to the focus of 'el'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4016  pair p = point(fromFocus(el, a, a, 1, CCW), 0);
4017  pair c = locate(el.C);
4018  real d = degrees(p - c) - el.angle;
4019  d = abs(d) < epsgeo ? 0 : d; // Avoid -1e-15
4020  return d%(sgnd(a) * 360);
4021 }
4022 
4023 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="centerToFocus(ellipse,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4024 real centerToFocus(ellipse el, real a)
4025 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angle relatively to the focus of 'el' for the angle 'a'
4026  given relatively to the center of 'el'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4027  pair P = point(fromCenter(el, a, a, 1, CCW), 0);
4028  pair F1 = locate(el.F1);
4029  pair F2 = locate(el.F2);
4030  real d = degrees(P - F1) - degrees(F2 - F1);
4031  d = abs(d) < epsgeo ? 0 : d; // Avoid -1e-15
4032  return d%(sgnd(a) * 360);
4033 }
4034 
4035 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="arclength(ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
4036 real arclength(ellipse el)
4037 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4038  return degenerate(el) ? infinity : 4 * el.a * elle(pi/2, el.e);
4039 }
4040 
4041 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="arclength(ellipse,real,real,bool,polarconicroutine)"><code></asyxml>*/
4042 real arclength(ellipse el, real angle1, real angle2,
4043  bool direction = CCW,
4044  polarconicroutine polarconicroutine = currentpolarconicroutine)
4045 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the length of the arc of the ellipse between 'angle1'
4046  and 'angle2'.
4047  'angle1' and 'angle2' must be in the interval ]-360;+oo[ if polarconicroutine = fromFocus,
4048  ]-oo;+oo[ if polarconicroutine = fromCenter.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4049  if(degenerate(el)) return infinity;
4050  if(angle1 > angle2) return arclength(el, angle2, angle1, !direction, polarconicroutine);
4051  // path g;int n = 1000;
4052  // if(el.e == 0) g = arcfromcenter(el, angle1, angle2, n, direction);
4053  // if(el.e != 1) g = polarconicroutine(el, angle1, angle2, n, direction);
4054  // write("with path = ", arclength(g));
4055  if(polarconicroutine == fromFocus) {
4056  // dot(point(fromFocus(el, angle1, angle1, 1, CCW), 0), 2mm + blue);
4057  // dot(point(fromFocus(el, angle2, angle2, 1, CCW), 0), 2mm + blue);
4058  // write("fromfocus1 = ", angle1);
4059  // write("fromfocus2 = ", angle2);
4060  real gle1 = focusToCenter(el, angle1);
4061  real gle2 = focusToCenter(el, angle2);
4062  if((gle1 - gle2) * (angle1 - angle2) > 0) {
4063  angle1 = gle1; angle2 = gle2;
4064  } else {
4065  angle1 = gle2; angle2 = gle1;
4066  }
4067  // dot(point(fromCenter(el, angle1, angle1, 1, CCW), 0), 1mm + red);
4068  // dot(point(fromCenter(el, angle2, angle2, 1, CCW), 0), 1mm + red);
4069  // write("fromcenter1 = ", angle1);
4070  // write("fromcenter2 = ", angle2);
4071  }
4072  if(angle1 < 0 || angle2 < 0) return arclength(el, 180 + angle1, 180 + angle2, direction, fromCenter);
4073  real a1 = direction ? angle1 : angle2;
4074  real a2 = direction ? angle2 : angle1 + 360;
4075  real elleq = el.a * elle(pi/2, el.e);
4076  real S(real a)
4077  {//Return the arclength from 0 to the angle 'a' (in degrees)
4078  // given form the center of the ellipse.
4079  real gle = atan(el.a * tan(radians(a))/el.b)+
4080  pi * (((a%90 == 0 && a != 0) ? floor(a/90) - 1 : floor(a/90)) -
4081  ((a%180 == 0) ? 0 : floor(a/180)) -
4082  (a%360 == 0 ? floor(a/(360)) : 0));
4083  /* // Uncomment to visualize the used branches
4084  unitsize(2cm, 1cm);
4085  import graph;
4086 
4087  real xmin = 0, xmax = 3pi;
4088 
4089  xlimits( xmin, xmax);
4090  ylimits( 0, 10);
4091  yaxis( "y" , LeftRight(), RightTicks(pTick=.8red, ptick = lightgrey, extend = true));
4092  xaxis( "x - value", BottomTop(), Ticks(Label("$%.2f$", red), Step = pi/2, step = pi/4, pTick=.8red, ptick = lightgrey, extend = true));
4093 
4094  real p2 = pi/2;
4095  real f(real t)
4096  {
4097  return atan(0.6 * tan(t))+
4098  pi * ((t%p2 == 0 && t != 0) ? floor(t/p2) - 1 : floor(t/p2)) -
4099  ((t%pi == 0) ? 0 : pi * floor(t/pi)) - (t%(2pi) == 0 ? pi * floor(t/(2 * pi)) : 0);
4100  }
4101 
4102  draw(graph(f, xmin, xmax, 100));
4103  write(degrees(f(pi/2)));
4104  write(degrees(f(pi)));
4105  write(degrees(f(3pi/2)));
4106  write(degrees(f(2pi)));
4107  draw(graph(new real(real t){return t;}, xmin, xmax, 3));
4108  */
4109  return elleq - el.a * elle(pi/2 - gle, el.e);
4110  }
4111  return S(a2) - S(a1);
4112 }
4113 
4114 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="arclength(parabola,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4115 real arclength(parabola p, real angle)
4116 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the arclength from 180 to 'angle' given from focus in the
4117  canonical coordinate system of 'p'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4118  real a = p.a; /* In canonicalcartesiansystem(p) the equation of p
4119  is x = y^2/(4a) */
4120  // integrate(sqrt(1 + (x/(2 * a))^2), x);
4121  real S(real t){return 0.5 * t * sqrt(1 + t^2/(4 * a^2)) + a * asinh(t/(2 * a));}
4122  real R(real gle){return 2 * a/(1 - Cos(gle));}
4123  real t = Sin(angle) * R(angle);
4124  return S(t);
4125 }
4126 
4127 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="arclength(parabola,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4128 real arclength(parabola p, real angle1, real angle2)
4129 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the arclength from 'angle1' to 'angle2' given from
4130  focus in the canonical coordinate system of 'p'</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4131  return arclength(p, angle1) - arclength(p, angle2);
4132 }
4133 
4134 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="arclength(parabola p)"><code></asyxml>*/
4135 real arclength(parabola p)
4136 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the length of the arc of the parabola bounded to the bounding
4137  box of the current picture.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4138  real[] b = bangles(p);
4139  return arclength(p, b[0], b[1]);
4140 }
4141 // *........................CONICS.........................*
4142 // *=======================================================*
4143 
4144 // *=======================================================*
4145 // *.......................ABSCISSA........................*
4146 /*<asyxml><struct signature="abscissa"><code></asyxml>*/
4147 struct abscissa
4148 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide abscissa structure on a curve used in the routine-like 'point(object, abscissa)'
4149  where object can be 'line','segment','ellipse','circle','conic'...</documentation><property type = "real" signature="x"><code></asyxml>*/
4150  real x;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The abscissa value.</documentation></property><property type = "int" signature="system"><code></asyxml>*/
4151  int system;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>0 = relativesystem; 1 = curvilinearsystem; 2 = angularsystem; 3 = nodesystem</documentation></property><property type = "polarconicroutine" signature="polarconicroutine"><code></asyxml>*/
4152  polarconicroutine polarconicroutine = fromCenter;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The routine used with angular system and two foci conic section.
4153  Possible values are 'formCenter' and 'formFocus'.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
4154  /*<asyxml><method type = "abscissa" signature="copy()"><code></asyxml>*/
4155  abscissa copy()
4156  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return a copy of this abscissa.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
4157  abscissa oa = new abscissa;
4158  oa.x = this.x;
4159  oa.system = this.system;
4160  oa.polarconicroutine = this.polarconicroutine;
4161  return oa;
4162  }
4163 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
4164 
4165 /*<asyxml><constant type = "int" signature="relativesystem,curvilinearsystem,angularsystem,nodesystem"><code></asyxml>*/
4166 restricted int relativesystem = 0, curvilinearsystem = 1, angularsystem = 2, nodesystem = 3;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Constant used to set the abscissa system.</documentation></constant></asyxml>*/
4167 
4168 /*<asyxml><operator type = "abscissa" signature="cast(explicit position)"><code></asyxml>*/
4169 abscissa operator cast(explicit position position)
4170 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast position to abscissa.
4171  If 'position' is relative, the abscissa is relative else it's a curvilinear abscissa.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
4172  abscissa oarcc;
4173  oarcc.x = position.position.x;
4174  oarcc.system = position.relative ? relativesystem : curvilinearsystem;
4175  return oarcc;
4176 }
4177 
4178 /*<asyxml><operator type = "abscissa" signature="+(real,explicit abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
4179 abscissa operator +(real x, explicit abscissa a)
4180 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide 'real + abscissa'.
4181  Return abscissa b so that b.x = a.x + x.
4182  +(explicit abscissa, real), -(real, explicit abscissa) and -(explicit abscissa, real) are also defined.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
4183  abscissa oa = a.copy();
4184  oa.x = a.x + x;
4185  return oa;
4186 }
4187 
4188 abscissa operator +(explicit abscissa a, real x)
4189 {
4190  return x + a;
4191 }
4192 abscissa operator +(int x, explicit abscissa a)
4193 {
4194  return ((real)x) + a;
4195 }
4196 
4197 /*<asyxml><operator type = "abscissa" signature="-(explicit abscissa a)"><code></asyxml>*/
4198 abscissa operator -(explicit abscissa a)
4199 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the abscissa b so that b.x = -a.x.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
4200  abscissa oa;
4201  oa.system = a.system;
4202  oa.x = -a.x;
4203  return oa;
4204 }
4205 
4206 abscissa operator -(real x, explicit abscissa a)
4207 {
4208  abscissa oa;
4209  oa.system = a.system;
4210  oa.x = x - a.x;
4211  return oa;
4212 }
4213 abscissa operator -(explicit abscissa a, real x)
4214 {
4215  abscissa oa;
4216  oa.system = a.system;
4217  oa.x = a.x - x;
4218  return oa;
4219 }
4220 abscissa operator -(int x, explicit abscissa a)
4221 {
4222  return ((real)x) - a;
4223 }
4224 
4225 /*<asyxml><operator type = "abscissa" signature="*(real,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
4226 abscissa operator *(real x, explicit abscissa a)
4227 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide 'real * abscissa'.
4228  Return abscissa b so that b.x = x * a.x.
4229  *(explicit abscissa, real), /(real, explicit abscissa) and /(explicit abscissa, real) are also defined.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
4230  abscissa oa;
4231  oa.system = a.system;
4232  oa.x = a.x * x;
4233  return oa;
4234 }
4235 abscissa operator *(explicit abscissa a, real x)
4236 {
4237  return x * a;
4238 }
4239 
4240 abscissa operator /(real x, explicit abscissa a)
4241 {
4242  abscissa oa;
4243  oa.system = a.system;
4244  oa.x = x/a.x;
4245  return oa;
4246 }
4247 abscissa operator /(explicit abscissa a, real x)
4248 {
4249  abscissa oa;
4250  oa.system = a.system;
4251  oa.x = a.x/x;
4252  return oa;
4253 }
4254 
4255 abscissa operator /(int x, explicit abscissa a)
4256 {
4257  return ((real)x)/a;
4258 }
4259 
4260 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="relabscissa(real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4261 abscissa relabscissa(real x)
4262 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return a relative abscissa.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4263  return (abscissa)(Relative(x));
4264 }
4265 abscissa relabscissa(int x)
4266 {
4267  return (abscissa)(Relative(x));
4268 }
4269 
4270 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="curabscissa(real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4271 abscissa curabscissa(real x)
4272 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return a curvilinear abscissa.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4273  return (abscissa)((position)x);
4274 }
4275 abscissa curabscissa(int x)
4276 {
4277  return (abscissa)((position)x);
4278 }
4279 
4280 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="angabscissa(real,polarconicroutine)"><code></asyxml>*/
4281 abscissa angabscissa(real x, polarconicroutine polarconicroutine = currentpolarconicroutine)
4282 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return a angular abscissa.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4283  abscissa oarcc;
4284  oarcc.x = x;
4285  oarcc.polarconicroutine = polarconicroutine;
4286  oarcc.system = angularsystem;
4287  return oarcc;
4288 }
4289 abscissa angabscissa(int x, polarconicroutine polarconicroutine = currentpolarconicroutine)
4290 {
4291  return angabscissa((real)x, polarconicroutine);
4292 }
4293 
4294 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="nodabscissa(real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4295 abscissa nodabscissa(real x)
4296 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return an abscissa as time on the path.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4297  abscissa oarcc;
4298  oarcc.x = x;
4299  oarcc.system = nodesystem;
4300  return oarcc;
4301 }
4302 abscissa nodabscissa(int x)
4303 {
4304  return nodabscissa((real)x);
4305 }
4306 
4307 /*<asyxml><operator type = "abscissa" signature="cast(real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4308 abscissa operator cast(real x)
4309 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast real to abscissa, precisely 'nodabscissa'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
4310  return nodabscissa(x);
4311 }
4312 abscissa operator cast(int x)
4313 {
4314  return nodabscissa((real)x);
4315 }
4316 
4317 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(circle,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
4318 point point(circle c, abscissa l)
4319 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'c' which has the abscissa 'l.x'
4320  according to the abscissa system 'l.system'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4321  coordsys R = c.C.coordsys;
4322  if (l.system == nodesystem)
4323  return point(R, point((path)c, l.x)/R);
4324  if (l.system == relativesystem)
4325  return c.C + point(R, R.polar(c.r, 2 * pi * l.x));
4326  if (l.system == curvilinearsystem)
4327  return c.C + point(R, R.polar(c.r, l.x/c.r));
4328  if (l.system == angularsystem)
4329  return c.C + point(R, R.polar(c.r, radians(l.x)));
4330  abort("point: bad abscissa system.");
4331  return (0, 0);
4332 }
4333 
4334 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(ellipse,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
4335 point point(ellipse el, abscissa l)
4336 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'el' which has the abscissa 'l.x'
4337  according to the abscissa system 'l.system'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4338  if(el.e == 0) return point((circle)el, l);
4339  coordsys R = coordsys(el);
4340  if (l.system == nodesystem)
4341  return point(R, point((path)el, l.x)/R);
4342  if (l.system == relativesystem) {
4343  return point(el, curabscissa((l.x%1) * arclength(el)));
4344  }
4345  if (l.system == curvilinearsystem) {
4346  real a1 = 0, a2 = 360, cx = 0;
4347  real aout = a1;
4348  real x = abs(l.x)%arclength(el);
4349  while (abs(cx - x) > epsgeo) {
4350  aout = (a1 + a2)/2;
4351  cx = arclength(el, 0, aout, CCW, fromCenter); //fromCenter is speeder
4352  if(cx > x) a2 = (a1 + a2)/2; else a1 = (a1 + a2)/2;
4353  }
4354  path pel = fromCenter(el, sgn(l.x) * aout, sgn(l.x) * aout, 1, CCW);
4355  return point(R, point(pel, 0)/R);
4356  }
4357  if (l.system == angularsystem) {
4358  return point(R, point(l.polarconicroutine(el, l.x, l.x, 1, CCW), 0)/R);
4359  }
4360  abort("point: bad abscissa system.");
4361  return (0, 0);
4362 }
4363 
4364 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(parabola,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
4365 point point(parabola p, abscissa l)
4366 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'p' which has the abscissa 'l.x'
4367  according to the abscissa system 'l.system'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4368  coordsys R = coordsys(p);
4369  if (l.system == nodesystem)
4370  return point(R, point((path)p, l.x)/R);
4371  if (l.system == relativesystem) {
4372  real[] b = bangles(p);
4373  real al = sgn(l.x) > 0 ? arclength(p, 180, b[1]) : arclength(p, 180, b[0]);
4374  return point(p, curabscissa(abs(l.x) * al));
4375  }
4376  if (l.system == curvilinearsystem) {
4377  real a1 = 1e-3, a2 = 360 - 1e-3, cx = infinity;
4378  while (abs(cx - l.x) > epsgeo) {
4379  cx = arclength(p, 180, (a1 + a2)/2);
4380  if(cx > l.x) a2 = (a1 + a2)/2; else a1 = (a1 + a2)/2;
4381  }
4382  path pp = fromFocus(p, a1, a1, 1, CCW);
4383  return point(R, point(pp, 0)/R);
4384  }
4385  if (l.system == angularsystem) {
4386  return point(R, point(fromFocus(p, l.x, l.x, 1, CCW), 0)/R);
4387  }
4388  abort("point: bad abscissa system.");
4389  return (0, 0);
4390 }
4391 
4392 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(hyperbola,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
4393 point point(hyperbola h, abscissa l)
4394 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'h' which has the abscissa 'l.x'
4395  according to the abscissa system 'l.system'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4396  coordsys R = coordsys(h);
4397  if (l.system == nodesystem)
4398  return point(R, point((path)h, l.x)/R);
4399  if (l.system == relativesystem) {
4400  abort("point(hyperbola, relativeSystem) is not implemented...
4401 Try relpoint((path)your_hyperbola, x);");
4402  }
4403  if (l.system == curvilinearsystem) {
4404  abort("point(hyperbola, curvilinearSystem) is not implemented...");
4405  }
4406  if (l.system == angularsystem) {
4407  return point(R, point(l.polarconicroutine(h, l.x, l.x, 1, CCW), 0)/R);
4408  }
4409  abort("point: bad abscissa system.");
4410  return (0, 0);
4411 }
4412 
4413 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="point(conic,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4414 point point(explicit conic co, abscissa l)
4415 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the curvilinear abscissa of 'M' on the conic 'co'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4416  if(co.e == 0) return point((circle)co, l);
4417  if(co.e < 1) return point((ellipse)co, l);
4418  if(co.e == 1) return point((parabola)co, l);
4419  return point((hyperbola)co, l);
4420 }
4421 
4422 
4423 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(line,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
4424 point point(line l, abscissa x)
4425 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'l' which has the abscissa 'l.x' according to the abscissa system 'l.system'.
4426  Note that the origin is l.A, and point(l, relabscissa(x)) returns l.A + x.x * vector(l.B - l.A).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4427  coordsys R = l.A.coordsys;
4428  if (x.system == nodesystem)
4429  return l.A + (x.x < 0 ? 0 : x.x > 1 ? 1 : x.x) * vector(l.B - l.A);
4430  if (x.system == relativesystem)
4431  return l.A + x.x * vector(l.B - l.A);
4432  if (x.system == curvilinearsystem)
4433  return l.A + x.x * l.u;
4434  if (x.system == angularsystem)
4435  abort("point: what the meaning of angular abscissa on line ?.");
4436  abort("point: bad abscissa system.");
4437  return (0, 0);
4438 }
4439 
4440 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(line,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4441 point point(line l, explicit real x)
4442 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point between node l.A and l.B (x <= 0 means l.A, x >=1 means l.B).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4443  return point(l, nodabscissa(x));
4444 }
4445 point point(line l, explicit int x)
4446 {
4447  return point(l, nodabscissa(x));
4448 }
4449 
4450 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="point(explicit circle,explicit real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4451 point point(explicit circle c, explicit real x)
4452 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point between node floor(x) and floor(x) + 1.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4453  return point(c, nodabscissa(x));
4454 }
4455 point point(explicit circle c, explicit int x)
4456 {
4457  return point(c, nodabscissa(x));
4458 }
4459 
4460 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(explicit ellipse,explicit real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4461 point point(explicit ellipse el, explicit real x)
4462 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point between node floor(x) and floor(x) + 1.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4463  return point(el, nodabscissa(x));
4464 }
4465 point point(explicit ellipse el, explicit int x)
4466 {
4467  return point(el, nodabscissa(x));
4468 }
4469 
4470 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(explicit parabola,explicit real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4471 point point(explicit parabola p, explicit real x)
4472 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point between node floor(x) and floor(x) + 1.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4473  return point(p, nodabscissa(x));
4474 }
4475 point point(explicit parabola p, explicit int x)
4476 {
4477  return point(p, nodabscissa(x));
4478 }
4479 
4480 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(explicit hyperbola,explicit real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4481 point point(explicit hyperbola h, explicit real x)
4482 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point between node floor(x) and floor(x) + 1.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4483  return point(h, nodabscissa(x));
4484 }
4485 point point(explicit hyperbola h, explicit int x)
4486 {
4487  return point(h, nodabscissa(x));
4488 }
4489 
4490 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(explicit conic,explicit real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4491 point point(explicit conic co, explicit real x)
4492 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point between node floor(x) and floor(x) + 1.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4493  point op;
4494  if(co.e == 0) op = point((circle)co, nodabscissa(x));
4495  else if(co.e < 1) op = point((ellipse)co, nodabscissa(x));
4496  else if(co.e == 1) op = point((parabola)co, nodabscissa(x));
4497  else op = point((hyperbola)co, nodabscissa(x));
4498  return op;
4499 }
4500 point point(explicit conic co, explicit int x)
4501 {
4502  return point(co, (real)x);
4503 }
4504 
4505 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="relpoint(line,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4506 point relpoint(line l, real x)
4507 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the relative point of 'l' (0 means l.A,
4508  1 means l.B, x means l.A + x * vector(l.B - l.A) ).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4509  return point(l, Relative(x));
4510 }
4511 
4512 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="relpoint(explicit circle,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4513 point relpoint(explicit circle c, real x)
4514 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the relative point of 'c' (0 means origin, 1 means end).
4515  Origin is c.center + c.r * (1, 0).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4516  return point(c, Relative(x));
4517 }
4518 
4519 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="relpoint(explicit ellipse,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4520 point relpoint(explicit ellipse el, real x)
4521 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the relative point of 'el' (0 means origin, 1 means end).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4522  return point(el, Relative(x));
4523 }
4524 
4525 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="relpoint(explicit parabola,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4526 point relpoint(explicit parabola p, real x)
4527 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the relative point of the path of the parabola
4528  bounded by the bounding box of the current picture.
4529  0 means origin, 1 means end, where the origin is the vertex of 'p'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4530  return point(p, Relative(x));
4531 }
4532 
4533 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="relpoint(explicit hyperbola,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4534 point relpoint(explicit hyperbola h, real x)
4535 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Not yet implemented... <look href = "point(hyperbola, abscissa)"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4536  return point(h, Relative(x));
4537 }
4538 
4539 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="relpoint(explicit conic,explicit real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4540 point relpoint(explicit conic co, explicit real x)
4541 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the relative point of 'co' (0 means origin, 1 means end).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4542  point op;
4543  if(co.e == 0) op = point((circle)co, Relative(x));
4544  else if(co.e < 1) op = point((ellipse)co, Relative(x));
4545  else if(co.e == 1) op = point((parabola)co, Relative(x));
4546  else op = point((hyperbola)co, Relative(x));
4547  return op;
4548 }
4549 point relpoint(explicit conic co, explicit int x)
4550 {
4551  return relpoint(co, (real)x);
4552 }
4553 
4554 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="angpoint(explicit circle,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4555 point angpoint(explicit circle c, real x)
4556 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'c' in the direction 'x' measured in degrees.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4557  return point(c, angabscissa(x));
4558 }
4559 
4560 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="angpoint(explicit ellipse,real,polarconicroutine)"><code></asyxml>*/
4561 point angpoint(explicit ellipse el, real x,
4562  polarconicroutine polarconicroutine = currentpolarconicroutine)
4563 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'el' in the direction 'x'
4564  measured in degrees according to 'polarconicroutine'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4565  return el.e == 0 ? angpoint((circle) el, x) : point(el, angabscissa(x, polarconicroutine));
4566 }
4567 
4568 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="angpoint(explicit parabola,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4569 point angpoint(explicit parabola p, real x)
4570 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'p' in the direction 'x' measured in degrees.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4571  return point(p, angabscissa(x));
4572 }
4573 
4574 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="angpoint(explicit hyperbola,real,polarconicroutine)"><code></asyxml>*/
4575 point angpoint(explicit hyperbola h, real x,
4576  polarconicroutine polarconicroutine = currentpolarconicroutine)
4577 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'h' in the direction 'x'
4578  measured in degrees according to 'polarconicroutine'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4579  return point(h, angabscissa(x, polarconicroutine));
4580 }
4581 
4582 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="curpoint(line,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4583 point curpoint(line l, real x)
4584 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'l' which has the curvilinear abscissa 'x'.
4585  Origin is l.A.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4586  return point(l, curabscissa(x));
4587 }
4588 
4589 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="curpoint(explicit circle,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4590 point curpoint(explicit circle c, real x)
4591 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'c' which has the curvilinear abscissa 'x'.
4592  Origin is c.center + c.r * (1, 0).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4593  return point(c, curabscissa(x));
4594 }
4595 
4596 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="curpoint(explicit ellipse,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4597 point curpoint(explicit ellipse el, real x)
4598 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'el' which has the curvilinear abscissa 'el'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4599  return point(el, curabscissa(x));
4600 }
4601 
4602 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="curpoint(explicit parabola,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4603 point curpoint(explicit parabola p, real x)
4604 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'p' which has the curvilinear abscissa 'x'.
4605  Origin is the vertex of 'p'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4606  return point(p, curabscissa(x));
4607 }
4608 
4609 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="curpoint(conic,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4610 point curpoint(conic co, real x)
4611 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'co' which has the curvilinear abscissa 'x'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4612  point op;
4613  if(co.e == 0) op = point((circle)co, curabscissa(x));
4614  else if(co.e < 1) op = point((ellipse)co, curabscissa(x));
4615  else if(co.e == 1) op = point((parabola)co, curabscissa(x));
4616  else op = point((hyperbola)co, curabscissa(x));
4617  return op;
4618 }
4619 
4620 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="angabscissa(circle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4621 abscissa angabscissa(circle c, point M)
4622 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angular abscissa of 'M' on the circle 'c'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4623  if(!(M @ c)) abort("angabscissa: the point is not on the circle.");
4624  abscissa oa;
4625  oa.system = angularsystem;
4626  oa.x = degrees(M - c.C);
4627  if(oa.x < 0) oa.x+=360;
4628  return oa;
4629 }
4630 
4631 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="angabscissa(ellipse,point,polarconicroutine)"><code></asyxml>*/
4632 abscissa angabscissa(ellipse el, point M,
4633  polarconicroutine polarconicroutine = currentpolarconicroutine)
4634 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angular abscissa of 'M' on the ellipse 'el' according to 'polarconicroutine'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4635  if(!(M @ el)) abort("angabscissa: the point is not on the ellipse.");
4636  abscissa oa;
4637  oa.system = angularsystem;
4638  oa.polarconicroutine = polarconicroutine;
4639  oa.x = polarconicroutine == fromCenter ? degrees(M - el.C) : degrees(M - el.F1);
4640  oa.x -= el.angle;
4641  if(oa.x < 0) oa.x += 360;
4642  return oa;
4643 }
4644 
4645 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="angabscissa(hyperbola,point,polarconicroutine)"><code></asyxml>*/
4646 abscissa angabscissa(hyperbola h, point M,
4647  polarconicroutine polarconicroutine = currentpolarconicroutine)
4648 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angular abscissa of 'M' on the hyperbola 'h' according to 'polarconicroutine'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4649  if(!(M @ h)) abort("angabscissa: the point is not on the hyperbola.");
4650  abscissa oa;
4651  oa.system = angularsystem;
4652  oa.polarconicroutine = polarconicroutine;
4653  oa.x = polarconicroutine == fromCenter ? degrees(M - h.C) : degrees(M - h.F1) + 180;
4654  oa.x -= h.angle;
4655  if(oa.x < 0) oa.x += 360;
4656  return oa;
4657 }
4658 
4659 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="angabscissa(parabola,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4660 abscissa angabscissa(parabola p, point M)
4661 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angular abscissa of 'M' on the parabola 'p'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4662  if(!(M @ p)) abort("angabscissa: the point is not on the parabola.");
4663  abscissa oa;
4664  oa.system = angularsystem;
4665  oa.polarconicroutine = fromFocus;// Not used
4666  oa.x = degrees(M - p.F);
4667  oa.x -= p.angle;
4668  if(oa.x < 0) oa.x += 360;
4669  return oa;
4670 }
4671 
4672 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="angabscissa(conic,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4673 abscissa angabscissa(explicit conic co, point M)
4674 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angular abscissa of 'M' on the conic 'co'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4675  if(co.e == 0) return angabscissa((circle)co, M);
4676  if(co.e < 1) return angabscissa((ellipse)co, M);
4677  if(co.e == 1) return angabscissa((parabola)co, M);
4678  return angabscissa((hyperbola)co, M);
4679 }
4680 
4681 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="curabscissa(line,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4682 abscissa curabscissa(line l, point M)
4683 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the curvilinear abscissa of 'M' on the line 'l'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4684  if(!(M @ extend(l))) abort("curabscissa: the point is not on the line.");
4685  abscissa oa;
4686  oa.system = curvilinearsystem;
4687  oa.x = sgn(dot(M - l.A, l.B - l.A)) * abs(M - l.A);
4688  return oa;
4689 }
4690 
4691 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="curabscissa(circle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4692 abscissa curabscissa(circle c, point M)
4693 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the curvilinear abscissa of 'M' on the circle 'c'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4694  if(!(M @ c)) abort("curabscissa: the point is not on the circle.");
4695  abscissa oa;
4696  oa.system = curvilinearsystem;
4697  oa.x = pi * angabscissa(c, M).x * c.r/180;
4698  return oa;
4699 }
4700 
4701 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="curabscissa(ellipse,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4702 abscissa curabscissa(ellipse el, point M)
4703 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the curvilinear abscissa of 'M' on the ellipse 'el'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4704  if(!(M @ el)) abort("curabscissa: the point is not on the ellipse.");
4705  abscissa oa;
4706  oa.system = curvilinearsystem;
4707  real a = angabscissa(el, M, fromCenter).x;
4708  oa.x = arclength(el, 0, a, fromCenter);
4709  oa.polarconicroutine = fromCenter;
4710  return oa;
4711 }
4712 
4713 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="curabscissa(parabola,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4714 abscissa curabscissa(parabola p, point M)
4715 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the curvilinear abscissa of 'M' on the parabola 'p'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4716  if(!(M @ p)) abort("curabscissa: the point is not on the parabola.");
4717  abscissa oa;
4718  oa.system = curvilinearsystem;
4719  real a = angabscissa(p, M).x;
4720  oa.x = arclength(p, 180, a);
4721  oa.polarconicroutine = fromFocus; // Not used.
4722  return oa;
4723 }
4724 
4725 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="curabscissa(conic,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4726 abscissa curabscissa(conic co, point M)
4727 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the curvilinear abscissa of 'M' on the conic 'co'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4728  if(co.e > 1) abort("curabscissa: not implemented for this hyperbola.");
4729  if(co.e == 0) return curabscissa((circle)co, M);
4730  if(co.e < 1) return curabscissa((ellipse)co, M);
4731  return curabscissa((parabola)co, M);
4732 }
4733 
4734 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="nodabscissa(line,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4735 abscissa nodabscissa(line l, point M)
4736 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the node abscissa of 'M' on the line 'l'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4737  if(!(M @ (segment)l)) abort("nodabscissa: the point is not on the segment.");
4738  abscissa oa;
4739  oa.system = nodesystem;
4740  oa.x = abs(M - l.A)/abs(l.A - l.B);
4741  return oa;
4742 }
4743 
4744 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="nodabscissa(circle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4745 abscissa nodabscissa(circle c, point M)
4746 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the node abscissa of 'M' on the circle 'c'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4747  if(!(M @ c)) abort("nodabscissa: the point is not on the circle.");
4748  abscissa oa;
4749  oa.system = nodesystem;
4750  oa.x = intersect((path)c, locate(M))[0];
4751  return oa;
4752 }
4753 
4754 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="nodabscissa(ellipse,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4755 abscissa nodabscissa(ellipse el, point M)
4756 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the node abscissa of 'M' on the ellipse 'el'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4757  if(!(M @ el)) abort("nodabscissa: the point is not on the ellipse.");
4758  abscissa oa;
4759  oa.system = nodesystem;
4760  oa.x = intersect((path)el, M)[0];
4761  return oa;
4762 }
4763 
4764 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="nodabscissa(parabola,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4765 abscissa nodabscissa(parabola p, point M)
4766 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the node abscissa OF 'M' on the parabola 'p'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4767  if(!(M @ p)) abort("nodabscissa: the point is not on the parabola.");
4768  abscissa oa;
4769  oa.system = nodesystem;
4770  path pg = p;
4771  real[] t = intersect(pg, M, 1e-5);
4772  if(t.length == 0) abort("nodabscissa: the point is not on the path of the parabola.");
4773  oa.x = t[0];
4774  return oa;
4775 }
4776 
4777 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="nodabscissa(conic,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4778 abscissa nodabscissa(conic co, point M)
4779 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the node abscissa of 'M' on the conic 'co'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4780  if(co.e > 1) abort("nodabscissa: not implemented for hyperbola.");
4781  if(co.e == 0) return nodabscissa((circle)co, M);
4782  if(co.e < 1) return nodabscissa((ellipse)co, M);
4783  return nodabscissa((parabola)co, M);
4784 }
4785 
4786 
4787 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="relabscissa(line,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4788 abscissa relabscissa(line l, point M)
4789 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the relative abscissa of 'M' on the line 'l'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4790  if(!(M @ extend(l))) abort("relabscissa: the point is not on the line.");
4791  abscissa oa;
4792  oa.system = relativesystem;
4793  oa.x = sgn(dot(M - l.A, l.B - l.A)) * abs(M - l.A)/abs(l.A - l.B);
4794  return oa;
4795 }
4796 
4797 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="relabscissa(circle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4798 abscissa relabscissa(circle c, point M)
4799 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the relative abscissa of 'M' on the circle 'c'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4800  if(!(M @ c)) abort("relabscissa: the point is not on the circle.");
4801  abscissa oa;
4802  oa.system = relativesystem;
4803  oa.x = angabscissa(c, M).x/360;
4804  return oa;
4805 }
4806 
4807 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="relabscissa(ellipse,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4808 abscissa relabscissa(ellipse el, point M)
4809 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the relative abscissa of 'M' on the ellipse 'el'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4810  if(!(M @ el)) abort("relabscissa: the point is not on the ellipse.");
4811  abscissa oa;
4812  oa.system = relativesystem;
4813  oa.x = curabscissa(el, M).x/arclength(el);
4814  oa.polarconicroutine = fromFocus;
4815  return oa;
4816 }
4817 
4818 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="relabscissa(conic,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
4819 abscissa relabscissa(conic co, point M)
4820 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the relative abscissa of 'M'
4821  on the conic 'co'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4822  if(co.e > 1) abort("relabscissa: not implemented for hyperbola and parabola.");
4823  if(co.e == 1) return relabscissa((parabola)co, M);
4824  if(co.e == 0) return relabscissa((circle)co, M);
4825  return relabscissa((ellipse)co, M);
4826 }
4827 // *.......................ABSCISSA........................*
4828 // *=======================================================*
4829 
4830 // *=======================================================*
4831 // *.........................ARCS..........................*
4832 /*<asyxml><struct signature="arc"><code></asyxml>*/
4833 struct arc {
4834  /*<asyxml></code><documentation>Implement oriented ellipse (included circle) arcs.
4835  All the calculus with this structure will be as exact as Asymptote can do.
4836  For a full precision, you must not cast 'arc' to 'path' excepted for drawing routines.
4837  </documentation><property type = "ellipse" signature="el"><code></asyxml>*/
4838  ellipse el;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The support of the arc.</documentation></property><property type = "real" signature="angle0"><code></asyxml>*/
4839  restricted real angle0 = 0;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Internal use: rotating a circle does not modify the origin point,this variable stocks the eventual angle rotation. This value is not used for ellipses which are not circles.</documentation></property><property type = "real" signature="angle1,angle2"><code></asyxml>*/
4840  restricted real angle1, angle2;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Values (in degrees) in ]-360, 360[.</documentation></property><property type = "bool" signature="direction"><code></asyxml>*/
4841  bool direction = CCW;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The arc will be drawn from 'angle1' to 'angle2' rotating in the direction 'direction'.</documentation></property><property type = "polarconicroutine" signature="polarconicroutine"><code></asyxml>*/
4842  polarconicroutine polarconicroutine = currentpolarconicroutine;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The routine to which the angles refer.
4843  If 'el' is a circle 'fromCenter' is always used.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
4844 
4845  /*<asyxml><method type = "void" signature="setangles(real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4846  void setangles(real a0, real a1, real a2)
4847  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Set the angles.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
4848  if (a1 < 0 && a2 < 0) {
4849  a1 += 360;
4850  a2 += 360;
4851  }
4852  this.angle0 = a0%(sgnd(a0) * 360);
4853  this.angle1 = a1%(sgnd(a1) * 360);
4854  this.angle2 = a2%(sgnd(2) * 360);
4855  }
4856 
4857  /*<asyxml><method type = "void" signature="init(ellipse,real,real,real,polarconicroutine,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
4858  void init(ellipse el, real angle0 = 0, real angle1, real angle2,
4859  polarconicroutine polarconicroutine,
4860  bool direction = CCW)
4861  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Constructor.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
4862  if(abs(angle1 - angle2) > 360) abort("arc: |angle1 - angle2| > 360.");
4863  this.el = el;
4864  this.setangles(angle0, angle1, angle2);
4865  this.polarconicroutine = polarconicroutine;
4866  this.direction = direction;
4867  }
4868 
4869  /*<asyxml><method type = "arc" signature="copy()"><code></asyxml>*/
4870  arc copy()
4871  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Copy the arc.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
4872  arc oa = new arc;
4873  oa.el = this.el;
4874  oa.direction = this.direction;
4875  oa.polarconicroutine = this.polarconicroutine;
4876  oa.angle1 = this.angle1;
4877  oa.angle2 = this.angle2;
4878  oa.angle0 = this.angle0;
4879  return oa;
4880  }
4881 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
4882 
4883 /*<asyxml><function type="polarconicroutine" signature="polarconicroutine(ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
4884 polarconicroutine polarconicroutine(conic co)
4885 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the default routine used to draw a conic.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4886  if(co.e == 0) return fromCenter;
4887  if(co.e == 1) return fromFocus;
4888  return currentpolarconicroutine;
4889 }
4890 
4891 /*<asyxml><function type="arc" signature="arc(ellipse,real,real,polarconicroutine,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
4892 arc arc(ellipse el, real angle1, real angle2,
4893  polarconicroutine polarconicroutine = polarconicroutine(el),
4894  bool direction = CCW)
4895 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the ellipse arc from 'angle1' to 'angle2' with respect to 'polarconicroutine' and rotating in the direction 'direction'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4896  arc oa;
4897  oa.init(el, 0, angle1, angle2, polarconicroutine, direction);
4898  return oa;
4899 }
4900 
4901 /*<asyxml><function type="arc" signature="complementary(arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
4902 arc complementary(arc a)
4903 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the complementary of 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4904  arc oa;
4905  oa.init(a.el, a.angle0, a.angle2, a.angle1, a.polarconicroutine, a.direction);
4906  return oa;
4907 }
4908 
4909 /*<asyxml><function type="arc" signature="reverse(arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
4910 arc reverse(arc a)
4911 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return arc 'a' oriented in reverse direction.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4912  arc oa;
4913  oa.init(a.el, a.angle0, a.angle2, a.angle1, a.polarconicroutine, !a.direction);
4914  return oa;
4915 }
4916 
4917 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="degrees(arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
4918 real degrees(arc a)
4919 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the measure in degrees of the oriented arc 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4920  real or;
4921  real da = a.angle2 - a.angle1;
4922  if(a.direction) {
4923  or = a.angle1 < a.angle2 ? da : 360 + da;
4924  } else {
4925  or = a.angle1 < a.angle2 ? -360 + da : da;
4926  }
4927  return or;
4928 }
4929 
4930 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="angle(a)"><code></asyxml>*/
4931 real angle(arc a)
4932 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the measure in radians of the oriented arc 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4933  return radians(degrees(a));
4934 }
4935 
4936 /*<asyxml><function type="int" signature="arcnodesnumber(explicit arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
4937 int arcnodesnumber(explicit arc a)
4938 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the number of nodes to draw the arc 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4939  return ellipsenodesnumber(a.el.a, a.el.b, a.angle1, a.angle2, a.direction);
4940 }
4941 
4942 private path arctopath(arc a, int n)
4943 {
4944  if(a.el.e == 0) return arcfromcenter(a.el, a.angle0 + a.angle1, a.angle0 + a.angle2, a.direction, n);
4945  if(a.el.e != 1) return a.polarconicroutine(a.el, a.angle1, a.angle2, n, a.direction);
4946  return arcfromfocus(a.el, a.angle1, a.angle2, n, a.direction);
4947 }
4948 
4949 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="angpoint(arc,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
4950 point angpoint(arc a, real angle)
4951 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point given by its angular position (in degrees) relative to the arc 'a'.
4952  If 'angle > degrees(a)' or 'angle < 0' the returned point is on the extended arc.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
4953  pair p;
4954  if(a.el.e == 0) {
4955  real gle = a.angle0 + a.angle1 + (a.direction ? angle : -angle);
4956  p = point(arcfromcenter(a.el, gle, gle, CCW, 1), 0);
4957  }
4958  else {
4959  real gle = a.angle1 + (a.direction ? angle : -angle);
4960  p = point(a.polarconicroutine(a.el, gle, gle, 1, CCW), 0);
4961  }
4962  return point(coordsys(a.el), p/coordsys(a.el));
4963 }
4964 
4965 /*<asyxml><operator type = "path" signature="cast(explicit arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
4966 path operator cast(explicit arc a)
4967 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast arc to path.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
4968  return arctopath(a, arcnodesnumber(a));
4969 }
4970 
4971 /*<asyxml><operator type = "guide" signature="cast(explicit arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
4972 guide operator cast(explicit arc a)
4973 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast arc to guide.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
4974  return arctopath(a, arcnodesnumber(a));
4975 }
4976 
4977 /*<asyxml><operator type = "arc" signature="*(transform,explicit arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
4978 arc operator *(transform t, explicit arc a)
4979 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide transform * arc.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
4980  pair[] P, PP;
4981  path g = arctopath(a, 3);
4982  real a0, a1 = a.angle1, a2 = a.angle2, ap1, ap2;
4983  bool dir = a.direction;
4984  P[0] = t * point(g, 0);
4985  P[1] = t * point(g, 2);
4986  ellipse el = t * a.el;
4987  arc oa;
4988  a0 = (a.angle0 + angle(shiftless(t)))%360;
4989  pair C;
4990  if(a.polarconicroutine == fromCenter) C = el.C; else C = el.F1;
4991  real d = abs(locate(el.F2 - el.F1)) > epsgeo ?
4992  degrees(locate(el.F2 - el.F1)) : a0 + degrees(el.C.coordsys.i);
4993  ap1 = (degrees(P[0]-C, false) - d)%360;
4994  ap2 = (degrees(P[1]-C, false) - d)%360;
4995  oa.init(el, a0, ap1, ap2, a.polarconicroutine, dir);
4996  g = arctopath(oa, 3);
4997  PP[0] = point(g, 0);
4998  PP[1] = point(g, 2);
4999  if((a1 - a2) * (ap1 - ap2) < 0) {// Handle reflection.
5000  dir=!a.direction;
5001  oa.init(el, a0, ap1, ap2, a.polarconicroutine, dir);
5002  }
5003  return oa;
5004 }
5005 
5006 /*<asyxml><operator type = "arc" signature="*(real,explicit arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
5007 arc operator *(real x, explicit arc a)
5008 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide real * arc.
5009  Return the arc subtracting and adding '(x - 1) * degrees(a)/2' to 'a.angle1' and 'a.angle2' respectively.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5010  real a1, a2, gle;
5011  gle = (x - 1) * degrees(a)/2;
5012  a1 = a.angle1 - gle;
5013  a2 = a.angle2 + gle;
5014  arc oa;
5015  oa.init(a.el, a.angle0, a1, a2, a.polarconicroutine, a.direction);
5016  return oa;
5017 }
5018 arc operator *(int x, explicit arc a){return (real)x * a;}
5019 /*<asyxml><operator type = "arc" signature="/(real,explicit arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
5020 arc operator /(explicit arc a, real x)
5021 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide arc/real.
5022  Return the arc subtracting and adding '(1/x - 1) * degrees(a)/2' to 'a.angle1' and 'a.angle2' respectively.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5023  return (1/x) * a;
5024 }
5025 /*<asyxml><operator type = "arc" signature="+(explicit arc,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5026 arc operator +(explicit arc a, point M)
5027 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide arc + point.
5028  Return shifted arc.
5029  'operator +(explicit arc, point)', 'operator +(explicit arc, vector)' and 'operator -(explicit arc, vector)' are also defined.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5030  return shift(M) * a;
5031 }
5032 arc operator -(explicit arc a, point M){return a + (-M);}
5033 arc operator +(explicit arc a, vector v){return shift(locate(v)) * a;}
5034 arc operator -(explicit arc a, vector v){return a + (-v);}
5035 
5036 
5037 /*<asyxml><operator type = "bool" signature="@(point,arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
5038 bool operator @(point M, arc a)
5039 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return true iff 'M' is on the arc 'a'.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5040  if (!(M @ a.el)) return false;
5041  coordsys R = defaultcoordsys;
5042  path ap = arctopath(a, 3);
5043  line l = line(point(R, point(ap, 0)), point(R, point(ap, 2)));
5044  return sameside(M, point(R, point(ap, 1)), l);
5045 }
5046 
5047 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="draw(picture,Label,arc,align,pen,arrowbar,arrowbar,margin,Label,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
5048 void draw(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L = "", arc a,
5049  align align = NoAlign, pen p = currentpen,
5050  arrowbar arrow = None, arrowbar bar = None, margin margin = NoMargin,
5051  Label legend = "", marker marker = nomarker)
5052 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw 'arc' adding the pen returned by 'addpenarc(p)' to the pen 'p'.
5053  <look href = "#addpenarc"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5054  draw(pic, L, (path)a, align, addpenarc(p), arrow, bar, margin, legend, marker);
5055 }
5056 
5057 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="arclength(arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
5058 real arclength(arc a)
5059 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The arc length of 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5060  return arclength(a.el, a.angle1, a.angle2, a.direction, a.polarconicroutine);
5061 }
5062 
5063 private point ppoint(arc a, real x)
5064 {// Return the point of the arc proportionally to its length.
5065  point oP;
5066  if(a.el.e == 0) { // Case of circle.
5067  oP = angpoint(a, x * abs(degrees(a)));
5068  } else { // Ellipse and not circle.
5069  if(!a.direction) {
5070  transform t = reflect(line(a.el.F1, a.el.F2));
5071  return t * ppoint(t * a, x);
5072  }
5073 
5074  real angle1 = a.angle1, angle2 = a.angle2;
5075  if(a.polarconicroutine == fromFocus) {
5076  // dot(point(fromFocus(a.el, angle1, angle1, 1, CCW), 0), 2mm + blue);
5077  // dot(point(fromFocus(a.el, angle2, angle2, 1, CCW), 0), 2mm + blue);
5078  // write("fromfocus1 = ", angle1);
5079  // write("fromfocus2 = ", angle2);
5080  real gle1 = focusToCenter(a.el, angle1);
5081  real gle2 = focusToCenter(a.el, angle2);
5082  if((gle1 - gle2) * (angle1 - angle2) > 0) {
5083  angle1 = gle1; angle2 = gle2;
5084  } else {
5085  angle1 = gle2; angle2 = gle1;
5086  }
5087  // write("fromcenter1 = ", angle1);
5088  // write("fromcenter2 = ", angle2);
