5089  // dot(point(fromCenter(a.el, angle1, angle1, 1, CCW), 0), 1mm + red);
5090  // dot(point(fromCenter(a.el, angle2, angle2, 1, CCW), 0), 1mm + red);
5091  }
5092 
5093  if(angle1 > angle2) {
5094  arc ta = a.copy();
5095  ta.polarconicroutine = fromCenter;
5096  ta.setangles(a0 = a.angle0, a1 = angle1 - 360, a2 = angle2);
5097  return ppoint(ta, x);
5098  }
5099  ellipse co = a.el;
5100  real gle, a1, a2, cx = 0;
5101  bool direction;
5102  if(x >= 0) {
5103  a1 = angle1;
5104  a2 = a1 + 360;
5105  direction = CCW;
5106  } else {
5107  a1 = angle1 - 360;
5108  a2 = a1 - 360;
5109  direction = CW;
5110  }
5111  gle = a1;
5112  real L = arclength(co, angle1, angle2, a.direction, fromCenter);
5113  real tx = L * abs(x)%arclength(co);
5114  real aout = a1;
5115  while(abs(cx - tx) > epsgeo) {
5116  aout = (a1 + a2)/2;
5117  cx = abs(arclength(co, gle, aout, direction, fromCenter));
5118  if(cx > tx) a2 = (a1 + a2)/2 ; else a1 = (a1 + a2)/2;
5119  }
5120  pair p = point(arcfromcenter(co, aout, aout, CCW, 1), 0);
5121  oP = point(coordsys(co), p/coordsys(co));
5122  }
5123  return oP;
5124 }
5125 
5126 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(arc,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
5127 point point(arc a, abscissa l)
5128 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'a' which has the abscissa 'l.x'
5129  according to the abscissa system 'l.system'.
5130  Note that 'a.polarconicroutine' is used instead of 'l.polarconicroutine'.
5131  <look href = "#struct abscissa"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5132  real posx;
5133  arc ta = a.copy();
5134  ellipse co = a.el;
5135  if (l.system == relativesystem) {
5136  posx = l.x;
5137  } else
5138  if (l.system == curvilinearsystem) {
5139  real tl;
5140  if(co.e == 0) {
5141  tl = curabscissa(a.el, angpoint(a.el, a.angle0 + a.angle1)).x;
5142  return curpoint(a.el, tl + (a.direction ? l.x : -l.x));
5143  } else {
5144  tl = curabscissa(a.el, angpoint(a.el, a.angle1, a.polarconicroutine)).x;
5145  return curpoint(a.el, tl + (a.direction ? l.x : -l.x));
5146  }
5147  } else
5148  if (l.system == nodesystem) {
5149  coordsys R = coordsys(co);
5150  return point(R, point((path)a, l.x)/R);
5151  } else
5152  if (l.system == angularsystem) {
5153  return angpoint(a, l.x);
5154  } else abort("point: bad abscissa system.");
5155  return ppoint(ta, posx);
5156 }
5157 
5158 
5159 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(arc,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
5160 point point(arc a, real x)
5161 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point between node floor(t) and floor(t) + 1.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5162  return point(a, nodabscissa(x));
5163 }
5164 pair point(explicit arc a, int x)
5165 {
5166  return point(a, nodabscissa(x));
5167 }
5168 
5169 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="relpoint(arc,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
5170 point relpoint(arc a, real x)
5171 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the relative point of 'a'.
5172  If x > 1 or x < 0, the returned point is on the extended arc.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5173  return point(a, relabscissa(x));
5174 }
5175 
5176 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="curpoint(arc,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
5177 point curpoint(arc a, real x)
5178 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point of 'a' which has the curvilinear abscissa 'x'.
5179  If x < 0 or x > arclength(a), the returned point is on the extended arc.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5180  return point(a, curabscissa(x));
5181 }
5182 
5183 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="angabscissa(arc,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5184 abscissa angabscissa(arc a, point M)
5185 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the angular abscissa of 'M' according to the arc 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5186  if(!(M @ a.el))
5187  abort("angabscissa: the point is not on the extended arc.");
5188  abscissa oa;
5189  oa.system = angularsystem;
5190  oa.polarconicroutine = a.polarconicroutine;
5191  real am = angabscissa(a.el, M, a.polarconicroutine).x;
5192  oa.x = (am - a.angle1 - (a.el.e == 0 ? a.angle0 : 0))%360;
5193  oa.x = a.direction ? oa.x : 360 - oa.x;
5194  return oa;
5195 }
5196 
5197 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="curabscissa(arc,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5198 abscissa curabscissa(arc a, point M)
5199 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the curvilinear abscissa according to the arc 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5200  ellipse el = a.el;
5201  if(!(M @ el))
5202  abort("angabscissa: the point is not on the extended arc.");
5203  abscissa oa;
5204  oa.system = curvilinearsystem;
5205  real xm = curabscissa(el, M).x;
5206  real a0 = el.e == 0 ? a.angle0 : 0;
5207  real am = curabscissa(el, angpoint(el, a.angle1 + a0, a.polarconicroutine)).x;
5208  real l = arclength(el);
5209  oa.x = (xm - am)%l;
5210  oa.x = a.direction ? oa.x : l - oa.x;
5211  return oa;
5212 }
5213 
5214 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="nodabscissa(arc,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5215 abscissa nodabscissa(arc a, point M)
5216 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the node abscissa according to the arc 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5217  if(!(M @ a))
5218  abort("nodabscissa: the point is not on the arc.");
5219  abscissa oa;
5220  oa.system = nodesystem;
5221  oa.x = intersect((path)a, M)[0];
5222  return oa;
5223 }
5224 
5225 /*<asyxml><function type="abscissa" signature="relabscissa(arc,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5226 abscissa relabscissa(arc a, point M)
5227 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the relative abscissa according to the arc 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5228  ellipse el = a.el;
5229  if(!( M @ el))
5230  abort("relabscissa: the point is not on the prolonged arc.");
5231  abscissa oa;
5232  oa.system = relativesystem;
5233  oa.x = curabscissa(a, M).x/arclength(a);
5234  return oa;
5235 }
5236 
5237 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="markarc(picture,Label,int,real,real,arc,arrowbar,pen,pen,margin,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
5238 void markarc(picture pic = currentpicture,
5239  Label L = "",
5240  int n = 1, real radius = 0, real space = 0,
5241  arc a,
5242  pen sectorpen = currentpen,
5243  pen markpen = sectorpen,
5244  margin margin = NoMargin,
5245  arrowbar arrow = None,
5246  marker marker = nomarker)
5247 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5248  real Da = degrees(a);
5249  pair p1 = point(a, 0);
5250  pair p2 = relpoint(a, 1);
5251  pair c = a.polarconicroutine == fromCenter ? locate(a.el.C) : locate(a.el.F1);
5252  if(radius == 0) radius = markangleradius(markpen);
5253  if(abs(Da) > 180) radius = -radius;
5254  radius = (a.direction ? 1 : -1) * sgnd(Da) * radius;
5255  draw(c--p1^^c--p2, sectorpen);
5256  markangle(pic = pic, L = L, n = n, radius = radius, space = space,
5257  A = p1, O = c, B = p2,
5258  arrow = arrow, p = markpen, margin = margin,
5259  marker = marker);
5260 }
5261 // *.........................ARCS..........................*
5262 // *=======================================================*
5263 
5264 // *=======================================================*
5265 // *........................MASSES.........................*
5266 /*<asyxml><struct signature="mass"><code></asyxml>*/
5267 struct mass {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation><property type = "point" signature="M"><code></asyxml>*/
5268  point M;/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></property><property type = "real" signature="m"><code></asyxml>*/
5269  real m;/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></property></asyxml>*/
5270 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
5271 
5272 /*<asyxml><function type="mass" signature="mass(point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
5273 mass mass(point M, real m)
5274 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Constructor of mass point.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5275  mass om;
5276  om.M = M;
5277  om.m = m;
5278  return om;
5279 }
5280 
5281 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="cast(mass)"><code></asyxml>*/
5282 point operator cast(mass m)
5283 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast mass point to point.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5284  point op;
5285  op = m.M;
5286  op.m = m.m;
5287  return op;
5288 }
5289 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(explicit mass)"><code></asyxml>*/
5290 point point(explicit mass m){return m;}/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast
5291  'm' to point</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5292 
5293 /*<asyxml><operator type = "mass" signature="cast(point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5294 mass operator cast(point M)
5295 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast point to mass point.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5296  mass om;
5297  om.M = M;
5298  om.m = M.m;
5299  return om;
5300 }
5301 /*<asyxml><function type="mass" signature="mass(explicit point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5302 mass mass(explicit point P)
5303 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast 'P' to mass.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5304  return mass(P, P.m);
5305 }
5306 
5307 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point[]" signature="cast(mass[])"><code></asyxml>*/
5308 point[] operator cast(mass[] m)
5309 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast mass[] to point[].</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5310  point[] op;
5311  for(mass am : m) op.push(point(am));
5312  return op;
5313 }
5314 
5315 /*<asyxml><operator type = "mass[]" signature="cast(point[])"><code></asyxml>*/
5316 mass[] operator cast(point[] P)
5317 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast point[] to mass[].</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5318  mass[] om;
5319  for(point op : P) om.push(mass(op));
5320  return om;
5321 }
5322 
5323 /*<asyxml><function type="mass" signature="mass(coordsys,explicit pair,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
5324 mass mass(coordsys R, explicit pair p, real m)
5325 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the mass which has coordinates
5326  'p' with respect to 'R' and weight 'm'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5327  return point(R, p, m);// Using casting.
5328 }
5329 
5330 /*<asyxml><operator type = "mass" signature="cast(pair)"><code></asyxml>*/
5331 mass operator cast(pair m){return mass((point)m, 1);}/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast pair to mass point.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5332 /*<asyxml><operator type = "path" signature="cast(mass)"><code></asyxml>*/
5333 path operator cast(mass M){return M.M;}/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast mass point to path.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5334 /*<asyxml><operator type = "guide" signature="cast(mass)"><code></asyxml>*/
5335 guide operator cast(mass M){return M.M;}/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast mass to guide.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5336 
5337 /*<asyxml><operator type = "mass" signature="+(mass,mass)"><code></asyxml>*/
5338 mass operator +(mass M1, mass M2)
5339 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide mass + mass.
5340  mass - mass is also defined.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5341  return mass(M1.M + M2.M, M1.m + M2.m);
5342 }
5343 mass operator -(mass M1, mass M2)
5344 {
5345  return mass(M1.M - M2.M, M1.m - M2.m);
5346 }
5347 
5348 /*<asyxml><operator type = "mass" signature="*(real,mass)"><code></asyxml>*/
5349 mass operator *(real x, explicit mass M)
5350 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide real * mass.
5351  The resulted mass is the mass of 'M' multiplied by 'x' .
5352  mass/real, mass + real and mass - real are also defined.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5353  return mass(M.M, x * M.m);
5354 }
5355 mass operator *(int x, explicit mass M){return mass(M.M, x * M.m);}
5356 mass operator /(explicit mass M, real x){return mass(M.M, M.m/x);}
5357 mass operator /(explicit mass M, int x){return mass(M.M, M.m/x);}
5358 mass operator +(explicit mass M, real x){return mass(M.M, M.m + x);}
5359 mass operator +(explicit mass M, int x){return mass(M.M, M.m + x);}
5360 mass operator -(explicit mass M, real x){return mass(M.M, M.m - x);}
5361 mass operator -(explicit mass M, int x){return mass(M.M, M.m - x);}
5362 /*<asyxml><operator type = "mass" signature="*(transform,mass)"><code></asyxml>*/
5363 mass operator *(transform t, mass M)
5364 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide transform * mass.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5365  return mass(t * M.M, M.m);
5366 }
5367 
5368 /*<asyxml><function type="mass" signature="masscenter(... mass[])"><code></asyxml>*/
5369 mass masscenter(... mass[] M)
5370 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the center of the masses 'M'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5371  point[] P;
5372  for (int i = 0; i < M.length; ++i)
5373  P.push(M[i].M);
5374  P = standardizecoordsys(currentcoordsys, true ... P);
5375  real m = M[0].m;
5376  point oM = M[0].m * P[0];
5377  for (int i = 1; i < M.length; ++i) {
5378  oM += M[i].m * P[i];
5379  m += M[i].m;
5380  }
5381  if (m == 0) abort("masscenter: the sum of masses is null.");
5382  return mass(oM/m, m);
5383 }
5384 
5385 /*<asyxml><function type="string" signature="massformat(string,string,mass)"><code></asyxml>*/
5386 string massformat(string format = defaultmassformat,
5387  string s, mass M)
5388 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the string formated by 'format' with the mass value.
5389  In the parameter 'format', %L will be replaced by 's'.
5390  <look href = "#defaultmassformat"/>.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5391  return format == "" ? s :
5392  format(replace(format, "%L", replace(s, "$", "")), M.m);
5393 }
5394 
5395 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="label(picture,Label,explicit mass,align,string,pen,filltype)"><code></asyxml>*/
5396 void label(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L, explicit mass M,
5397  align align = NoAlign, string format = defaultmassformat,
5398  pen p = nullpen, filltype filltype = NoFill)
5399 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw label returned by massformat(format, L, M) at coordinates of M.
5400  <look href = "#massformat(string, string, mass)"/>.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5401  Label lL = L.copy();
5402  lL.s = massformat(format, lL.s, M);
5403  Label L = Label(lL, M.M, align, p, filltype);
5404  add(pic, L);
5405 }
5406 
5407 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="dot(picture,Label,explicit mass,align,string,pen)"><code></asyxml>*/
5408 void dot(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L, explicit mass M, align align = NoAlign,
5409  string format = defaultmassformat, pen p = currentpen)
5410 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw a dot with label 'L' as
5411  label(picture, Label, explicit mass, align, string, pen, filltype) does.
5412  <look href = "#label(picture, Label, mass, align, string, pen, filltype)"/>.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5413  Label lL = L.copy();
5414  lL.s = massformat(format, lL.s, M);
5415  lL.position(locate(M.M));
5416  lL.align(align, E);
5417  lL.p(p);
5418  dot(pic, M.M, p);
5419  add(pic, lL);
5420 }
5421 // *........................MASSES.........................*
5422 // *=======================================================*
5423 
5424 // *=======================================================*
5425 // *.......................TRIANGLES.......................*
5426 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="orthocenter(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5427 point orthocenter(point A, point B, point C)
5428 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the orthocenter of the triangle ABC.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5429  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(A, B, C);
5430  coordsys R = P[0].coordsys;
5431  pair pp = extension(A, projection(P[1], P[2]) * P[0], B, projection(P[0], P[2]) * P[1]);
5432  return point(R, pp/R);
5433 }
5434 
5435 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="centroid(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5436 point centroid(point A, point B, point C)
5437 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the centroid of the triangle ABC.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5438  return (A + B + C)/3;
5439 }
5440 
5441 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="incenter(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5442 point incenter(point A, point B, point C)
5443 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the center of the incircle of the triangle ABC.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5444  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(A, B, C);
5445  coordsys R = P[0].coordsys;
5446  pair a = A, b = B, c = C;
5447  pair pp = extension(a, a + dir(a--b, a--c), b, b + dir(b--a, b--c));
5448  return point(R, pp/R);
5449 }
5450 
5451 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="inradius(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5452 real inradius(point A, point B, point C)
5453 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the radius of the incircle of the triangle ABC.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5454  point IC = incenter(A, B, C);
5455  return abs(IC - projection(A, B) * IC);
5456 }
5457 
5458 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="incircle(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5459 circle incircle(point A, point B, point C)
5460 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the incircle of the triangle ABC.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5461  point IC = incenter(A, B, C);
5462  return circle(IC, abs(IC - projection(A, B) * IC));
5463 }
5464 
5465 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="excenter(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5466 point excenter(point A, point B, point C)
5467 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the center of the excircle of the triangle tangent with (AB).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5468  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(A, B, C);
5469  coordsys R = P[0].coordsys;
5470  pair a = A, b = B, c = C;
5471  pair pp = extension(a, a + rotate(90) * dir(a--b, a--c), b, b + rotate(90) * dir(b--a, b--c));
5472  return point(R, pp/R);
5473 }
5474 
5475 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="exradius(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5476 real exradius(point A, point B, point C)
5477 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the radius of the excircle of the triangle ABC with (AB).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5478  point EC = excenter(A, B, C);
5479  return abs(EC - projection(A, B) * EC);
5480 }
5481 
5482 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="excircle(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5483 circle excircle(point A, point B, point C)
5484 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the excircle of the triangle ABC tangent with (AB).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5485  point center = excenter(A, B, C);
5486  real radius = abs(center - projection(B, C) * center);
5487  return circle(center, radius);
5488 }
5489 
5490 private int[] numarray = {1, 2, 3};
5491 numarray.cyclic = true;
5492 
5493 /*<asyxml><struct signature="triangle"><code></asyxml>*/
5494 struct triangle {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></asyxml>*/
5495 
5496  /*<asyxml><struct signature="vertex"><code></asyxml>*/
5497  struct vertex {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Structure used to communicate the vertex of a triangle.</documentation><property type = "int" signature="n"><code></asyxml>*/
5498  int n;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>1 means VA,2 means VB,3 means VC,4 means VA etc...</documentation></property><property type = "triangle" signature="triangle"><code></asyxml>*/
5499  triangle t;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The triangle to which the vertex refers.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
5500  }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
5501 
5502  /*<asyxml><property type = "point" signature="A,B,C"><code></asyxml>*/
5503  restricted point A, B, C;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The vertices of the triangle (as point).</documentation></property><property type = "vertex" signature="VA, VB, VC"><code></asyxml>*/
5504  restricted vertex VA, VB, VC;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The vertices of the triangle (as vertex).
5505  Note that the vertex structure contains the triangle to wish it refers.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
5506  VA.n = 1;VB.n = 2;VC.n = 3;
5507 
5508  /*<asyxml><method type = "vertex" signature="vertex(int)"><code></asyxml>*/
5509  vertex vertex(int n)
5510  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return numbered vertex.
5511  'n' is 1 means VA, 2 means VB, 3 means VC, 4 means VA etc...</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
5512  n = numarray[n - 1];
5513  if(n == 1) return VA;
5514  else if(n == 2) return VB;
5515  return VC;
5516  }
5517 
5518  /*<asyxml><method type = "point" signature="point(int)"><code></asyxml>*/
5519  point point(int n)
5520  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return numbered point.
5521  n is 1 means A, 2 means B, 3 means C, 4 means A etc...</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
5522  n = numarray[n - 1];
5523  if(n == 1) return A;
5524  else if(n == 2) return B;
5525  return C;
5526  }
5527 
5528  /*<asyxml><method type = "void" signature="init(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5529  void init(point A, point B, point C)
5530  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Constructor.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
5531  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(A, B, C);
5532  this.A = P[0];
5533  this.B = P[1];
5534  this.C = P[2];
5535  VA.t = this; VB.t = this; VC.t = this;
5536  }
5537 
5538  /*<asyxml><method type = "void" signature="operator init(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5539  void operator init(point A, point B, point C)
5540  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>For backward compatibility.
5541  Provide the routine 'triangle(point A, point B, point C)'.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
5542  this.init(A, B, C);
5543  }
5544 
5545  /*<asyxml><method type = "void" signature="init(real,real,real,real,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5546  void operator init(real b, real alpha, real c, real angle = 0, point A = (0, 0))
5547  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>For backward compatibility.
5548  Provide the routine 'triangle(real b, real alpha, real c, real angle = 0, point A = (0, 0))
5549  which returns the triangle ABC rotated by 'angle' (in degrees) and where b = AC, degrees(A) = alpha, AB = c.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
5550  coordsys R = A.coordsys;
5551  this.init(A, A + R.polar(c, radians(angle)), A + R.polar(b, radians(angle + alpha)));
5552  }
5553 
5554  /*<asyxml><method type = "real" signature="a(),b(),c()"><code></asyxml>*/
5555  real a()
5556  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the length BC.
5557  b() and c() are also defined and return the length AC and AB respectively.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
5558  return length(C - B);
5559  }
5560  real b() {return length(A - C);}
5561  real c() {return length(B - A);}
5562 
5563  private real det(pair a, pair b) {return a.x * b.y - a.y * b.x;}
5564 
5565  /*<asyxml><method type = "real" signature="area()"><code></asyxml>*/
5566  real area()
5567  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></method></asyxml>*/
5568  pair a = locate(A), b = locate(B), c = locate(C);
5569  return 0.5 * abs(det(a, b) + det(b, c) + det(c, a));
5570  }
5571 
5572  /*<asyxml><method type = "real" signature="alpha(),beta(),gamma()"><code></asyxml>*/
5573  real alpha()
5574  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the measure (in degrees) of the angle A.
5575  beta() and gamma() are also defined and return the measure of the angles B and C respectively.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
5576  return degrees(acos((b()^2 + c()^2 - a()^2)/(2b() * c())));
5577  }
5578  real beta() {return degrees(acos((c()^2 + a()^2 - b()^2)/(2c() * a())));}
5579  real gamma() {return degrees(acos((a()^2 + b()^2 - c()^2)/(2a() * b())));}
5580 
5581  /*<asyxml><method type = "path" signature="Path()"><code></asyxml>*/
5582  path Path() // retained for backward compatibility
5583  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The path of the triangle.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
5584  return A--B--C--cycle;
5585  }
5586 
5587  /*<asyxml><struct signature="side"><code></asyxml>*/
5588  struct side
5589  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Structure used to communicate the side of a triangle.</documentation><property type = "int" signature="n"><code></asyxml>*/
5590  int n;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>1 or 0 means [AB],-1 means [BA],2 means [BC],-2 means [CB] etc.</documentation></property><property type = "triangle" signature="triangle"><code></asyxml>*/
5591  triangle t;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The triangle to which the side refers.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
5592  }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
5593 
5594  /*<asyxml><property type = "side" signature="AB"><code></asyxml>*/
5595  side AB;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>For the routines using the structure 'side', triangle.AB means 'side AB'.
5596  BA, AC, CA etc are also defined.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
5597  AB.n = 1; AB.t = this;
5598  side BA; BA.n = -1; BA.t = this;
5599  side BC; BC.n = 2; BC.t = this;
5600  side CB; CB.n = -2; CB.t = this;
5601  side CA; CA.n = 3; CA.t = this;
5602  side AC; AC.n = -3; AC.t = this;
5603 
5604  /*<asyxml><method type = "side" signature="side(int)"><code></asyxml>*/
5605  side side(int n)
5606  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return numbered side.
5607  n is 1 means AB, -1 means BA, 2 means BC, -2 means CB, etc.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
5608  if(n == 0) abort('Invalid side number.');
5609  int an = numarray[abs(n)-1];
5610  if(an == 1) return n > 0 ? AB : BA;
5611  else if(an == 2) return n > 0 ? BC : CB;
5612  return n > 0 ? CA : AC;
5613  }
5614 
5615  /*<asyxml><method type = "line" signature="line(int)"><code></asyxml>*/
5616  line line(int n)
5617  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the numbered line.</documentation></method></asyxml>*/
5618  if(n == 0) abort('Invalid line number.');
5619  int an = numarray[abs(n)-1];
5620  if(an == 1) return n > 0 ? line(A, B) : line(B, A);
5621  else if(an == 2) return n > 0 ? line(B, C) : line(C, B);
5622  return n > 0 ? line(C, A) : line(A, C);
5623  }
5624 
5625 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
5626 
5627 path operator cast(triangle t) { return t.A -- t.B -- t.C -- cycle; }
5628 
5629 from triangle unravel side; // The structure 'side' is now available outside the triangle structure.
5630 from triangle unravel vertex; // The structure 'vertex' is now available outside the triangle structure.
5631 
5632 triangle[] operator ^^(triangle[] t1, triangle t2)
5633 {
5634  triangle[] T;
5635  for (int i = 0; i < t1.length; ++i) T.push(t1[i]);
5636  T.push(t2);
5637  return T;
5638 }
5639 
5640 triangle[] operator ^^(... triangle[] t)
5641 {
5642  triangle[] T;
5643  for (int i = 0; i < t.length; ++i) {
5644  T.push(t[i]);
5645  }
5646  return T;
5647 }
5648 
5649 /*<asyxml><operator type = "line" signature="cast(side)"><code></asyxml>*/
5650 line operator cast(side side)
5651 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast side to (infinite) line.
5652  Most routine with line parameters works with side parameters.
5653  One can use the code 'segment(a_side)' to obtain a line segment.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5654  triangle t = side.t;
5655  return t.line(side.n);
5656 }
5657 
5658 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="line(explicit side)"><code></asyxml>*/
5659 line line(explicit side side)
5660 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'side' as line.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5661  return (line)side;
5662 }
5663 
5664 /*<asyxml><function type="segment" signature="segment(explicit side)"><code></asyxml>*/
5665 segment segment(explicit side side)
5666 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return 'side' as segment.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5667  return (segment)(line)side;
5668 }
5669 
5670 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="cast(vertex)"><code></asyxml>*/
5671 point operator cast(vertex V)
5672 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast vertex to point.
5673  Most routine with point parameters works with vertex parameters.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5674  return V.t.point(V.n);
5675 }
5676 
5677 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(explicit vertex)"><code></asyxml>*/
5678 point point(explicit vertex V)
5679 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the point corresponding to the vertex 'V'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5680  return (point)V;
5681 }
5682 
5683 /*<asyxml><function type="side" signature="opposite(vertex)"><code></asyxml>*/
5684 side opposite(vertex V)
5685 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the opposite side of vertex 'V'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5686  return V.t.side(numarray[abs(V.n)]);
5687 }
5688 
5689 /*<asyxml><function type="vertex" signature="opposite(side)"><code></asyxml>*/
5690 vertex opposite(side side)
5691 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the opposite vertex of side 'side'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5692  return side.t.vertex(numarray[abs(side.n) + 1]);
5693 }
5694 
5695 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="midpoint(side)"><code></asyxml>*/
5696 point midpoint(side side)
5697 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5698  return midpoint(segment(side));
5699 }
5700 
5701 /*<asyxml><operator type = "triangle" signature="*(transform,triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5702 triangle operator *(transform T, triangle t)
5703 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide transform * triangle.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5704  return triangle(T * t.A, T * t.B, T * t.C);
5705 }
5706 
5707 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="triangleAbc(real,real,real,real,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5708 triangle triangleAbc(real alpha, real b, real c, real angle = 0, point A = (0, 0))
5709 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the triangle ABC rotated by 'angle' with BAC = alpha, AC = b and AB = c.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5710  triangle T;
5711  coordsys R = A.coordsys;
5712  T.init(A, A + R.polar(c, radians(angle)), A + R.polar(b, radians(angle + alpha)));
5713  return T;
5714 }
5715 
5716 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="triangleabc(real,real,real,real,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5717 triangle triangleabc(real a, real b, real c, real angle = 0, point A = (0, 0))
5718 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the triangle ABC rotated by 'angle' with BC = a, AC = b and AB = c.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5719  triangle T;
5720  coordsys R = A.coordsys;
5721  T.init(A, A + R.polar(c, radians(angle)), A + R.polar(b, radians(angle) + acos((b^2 + c^2 - a^2)/(2 * b * c))));
5722  return T;
5723 }
5724 
5725 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="triangle(line,line,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
5726 triangle triangle(line l1, line l2, line l3)
5727 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the triangle defined by three line.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5728  point P1, P2, P3;
5729  P1 = intersectionpoint(l1, l2);
5730  P2 = intersectionpoint(l1, l3);
5731  P3 = intersectionpoint(l2, l3);
5732  if(!(defined(P1) && defined(P2) && defined(P3))) abort("triangle: two lines are parallel.");
5733  return triangle(P1, P2, P3);
5734 }
5735 
5736 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="foot(vertex)"><code></asyxml>*/
5737 point foot(vertex V)
5738 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the endpoint of the altitude from V.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5739  return projection((line)opposite(V)) * ((point)V);
5740 }
5741 
5742 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="foot(side)"><code></asyxml>*/
5743 point foot(side side)
5744 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the endpoint of the altitude on 'side'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5745  return projection((line)side) * point(opposite(side));
5746 }
5747 
5748 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="altitude(vertex)"><code></asyxml>*/
5749 line altitude(vertex V)
5750 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the altitude passing through 'V'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5751  return line(point(V), foot(V));
5752 }
5753 
5754 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="altitude(vertex)"><code></asyxml>*/
5755 line altitude(side side)
5756 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the altitude cutting 'side'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5757  return altitude(opposite(side));
5758 }
5759 
5760 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="orthocenter(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5761 point orthocenter(triangle t)
5762 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the orthocenter of the triangle t.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5763  return orthocenter(t.A, t.B, t.C);
5764 }
5765 
5766 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="centroid(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5767 point centroid(triangle t)
5768 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the centroid of the triangle 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5769  return (t.A + t.B + t.C)/3;
5770 }
5771 
5772 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="circumcenter(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5773 point circumcenter(triangle t)
5774 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the circumcenter of the triangle 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5775  return circumcenter(t.A, t.B, t.C);
5776 }
5777 
5778 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="circle(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5779 circle circle(triangle t)
5780 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the circumcircle of the triangle 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5781  return circle(t.A, t.B, t.C);
5782 }
5783 
5784 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="circumcircle(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5785 circle circumcircle(triangle t)
5786 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the circumcircle of the triangle 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5787  return circle(t.A, t.B, t.C);
5788 }
5789 
5790 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="incenter(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5791 point incenter(triangle t)
5792 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the center of the incircle of the triangle 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5793  return incenter(t.A, t.B, t.C);
5794 }
5795 
5796 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="inradius(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5797 real inradius(triangle t)
5798 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the radius of the incircle of the triangle 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5799  return inradius(t.A, t.B, t.C);
5800 }
5801 
5802 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="incircle(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5803 circle incircle(triangle t)
5804 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the the incircle of the triangle 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5805  return incircle(t.A, t.B, t.C);
5806 }
5807 
5808 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="excenter(side,triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5809 point excenter(side side)
5810 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the center of the excircle tangent with the side 'side' of its triangle.
5811  side = 0 means AB, 1 means AC, other means BC.
5812  One must use the predefined sides t.AB, t.AC where 't' is a triangle....</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5813  point op;
5814  triangle t = side.t;
5815  int n = numarray[abs(side.n) - 1];
5816  if(n == 1) op = excenter(t.A, t.B, t.C);
5817  else if(n == 2) op = excenter(t.B, t.C, t.A);
5818  else op = excenter(t.C, t.A, t.B);
5819  return op;
5820 }
5821 
5822 /*<asyxml><function type="real" signature="exradius(side,triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5823 real exradius(side side)
5824 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return radius of the excircle tangent with the side 'side' of its triangle.
5825  side = 0 means AB, 1 means BC, other means CA.
5826  One must use the predefined sides t.AB, t.AC where 't' is a triangle....</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5827  real or;
5828  triangle t = side.t;
5829  int n = numarray[abs(side.n) - 1];
5830  if(n == 1) or = exradius(t.A, t.B, t.C);
5831  else if(n == 2) or = exradius(t.B, t.C, t.A);
5832  else or = exradius(t.A, t.C, t.B);
5833  return or;
5834 }
5835 
5836 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="excircle(side,triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5837 circle excircle(side side)
5838 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the excircle tangent with the side 'side' of its triangle.
5839  side = 0 means AB, 1 means AC, other means BC.
5840  One must use the predefined sides t.AB, t.AC where 't' is a triangle....</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5841  circle oc;
5842  int n = numarray[abs(side.n) - 1];
5843  triangle t = side.t;
5844  if(n == 1) oc = excircle(t.A, t.B, t.C);
5845  else if(n == 2) oc = excircle(t.B, t.C, t.A);
5846  else oc = excircle(t.A, t.C, t.B);
5847  return oc;
5848 }
5849 
5850 /*<asyxml><struct signature="trilinear"><code></asyxml>*/
5851 struct trilinear
5852 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Trilinear coordinates 'a:b:c' relative to triangle 't'.
5853  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/TrilinearCoordinates.html"/></documentation><property type = "real" signature="a,b,c"><code></asyxml>*/
5854  real a,b,c;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The trilinear coordinates.</documentation></property><property type = "triangle" signature="t"><code></asyxml>*/
5855  triangle t;/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The reference triangle.</documentation></property></asyxml>*/
5856 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
5857 
5858 /*<asyxml><function type="trilinear" signature="trilinear(triangle,real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
5859 trilinear trilinear(triangle t, real a, real b, real c)
5860 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the trilinear coordinates relative to 't'.
5861  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/TrilinearCoordinates.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5862  trilinear ot;
5863  ot.a = a; ot.b = b; ot.c = c;
5864  ot.t = t;
5865  return ot;
5866 }
5867 
5868 /*<asyxml><function type="trilinear" signature="trilinear(triangle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5869 trilinear trilinear(triangle t, point M)
5870 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the trilinear coordinates of 'M' relative to 't'.
5871  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/TrilinearCoordinates.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5872  trilinear ot;
5873  pair m = locate(M);
5874  int sameside(pair A, pair B, pair m, pair p)
5875  {// Return 1 if 'm' and 'p' are same side of line (AB) else return -1.
5876  pair mil = (A + B)/2;
5877  pair mA = rotate(90, mil) * A;
5878  pair mB = rotate(-90, mil) * A;
5879  return (abs(m - mA) <= abs(m - mB)) == (abs(p - mA) <= abs(p - mB)) ? 1 : -1;
5880  }
5881  real det(pair a, pair b) {return a.x * b.y - a.y * b.x;}
5882  real area(pair a, pair b, pair c){return 0.5 * abs(det(a, b) + det(b, c) + det(c, a));}
5883  pair A = t.A, B = t.B, C = t.C;
5884  real t1 = area(B, C, m), t2 = area(C, A, m), t3 = area(A, B, m);
5885  ot.a = sameside(B, C, A, m) * t1/t.a();
5886  ot.b = sameside(A, C, B, m) * t2/t.b();
5887  ot.c = sameside(A, B, C, m) * t3/t.c();
5888  ot.t = t;
5889  return ot;
5890 }
5891 
5892 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="write(trilinear)"><code></asyxml>*/
5893 void write(trilinear tri)
5894 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5895  write(format("%f : ", tri.a) + format("%f : ", tri.b) + format("%f", tri.c));
5896 }
5897 
5898 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="trilinear(triangle,real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
5899 point point(trilinear tri)
5900 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the trilinear coordinates relative to 't'.
5901  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/TrilinearCoordinates.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5902  triangle t = tri.t;
5903  return masscenter(0.5 * t.a() * mass(t.A, tri.a),
5904  0.5 * t.b() * mass(t.B, tri.b),
5905  0.5 * t.c() * mass(t.C, tri.c));
5906 }
5907 
5908 /*<asyxml><function type="int[]" signature="tricoef(side)"><code></asyxml>*/
5909 int[] tricoef(side side)
5910 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return an array of integer (values are 0 or 1) which represents 'side'.
5911  For example, side = t.BC will be represented by {0, 1, 1}.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5912  int[] oi;
5913  int n = numarray[abs(side.n) - 1];
5914  oi.push((n == 1 || n == 3) ? 1 : 0);
5915  oi.push((n == 1 || n == 2) ? 1 : 0);
5916  oi.push((n == 2 || n == 3) ? 1 : 0);
5917  return oi;
5918 }
5919 
5920 /*<asyxml><operator type = "point" signature="cast(trilinear)"><code></asyxml>*/
5921 point operator cast(trilinear tri)
5922 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Cast trilinear to point.
5923  One may use the routine 'point(trilinear)' to force the casting.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
5924  return point(tri);
5925 }
5926 
5927 /*<asyxml><typedef type = "centerfunction" return = "real" params = "real, real, real"><code></asyxml>*/
5928 typedef real centerfunction(real, real, real);/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/TriangleCenterFunction.html"/></documentation></typedef></asyxml>*/
5929 
5930 /*<asyxml><function type="trilinear" signature="trilinear(triangle,centerfunction,real,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
5931 trilinear trilinear(triangle t, centerfunction f, real a = t.a(), real b = t.b(), real c = t.c())
5932 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/TriangleCenterFunction.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5933  return trilinear(t, f(a, b, c), f(b, c, a), f(c, a, b));
5934 }
5935 
5936 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="symmedian(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5937 point symmedian(triangle t)
5938 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the symmedian point of 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5939  point A, B, C;
5940  real a = t.a(), b = t.b(), c = t.c();
5941  A = trilinear(t, 0, b, c);
5942  B = trilinear(t, a, 0, c);
5943  return intersectionpoint(line(t.A, A), line(t.B, B));
5944 }
5945 
5946 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="symmedian(side)"><code></asyxml>*/
5947 point symmedian(side side)
5948 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The symmedian point on the side 'side'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5949  triangle t = side.t;
5950  int n = numarray[abs(side.n) - 1];
5951  if(n == 1) return trilinear(t, t.a(), t.b(), 0);
5952  if(n == 2) return trilinear(t, 0, t.b(), t.c());
5953  return trilinear(t, t.a(), 0, t.c());
5954 }
5955 
5956 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="symmedian(vertex)"><code></asyxml>*/
5957 line symmedian(vertex V)
5958 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the symmedian passing through 'V'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5959  return line(point(V), symmedian(V.t));
5960 }
5961 
5962 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="cevian(triangle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5963 triangle cevian(triangle t, point P)
5964 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the Cevian triangle with respect of 'P'
5965  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/CevianTriangle.html"/>.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5966  trilinear tri = trilinear(t, locate(P));
5967  point A = point(trilinear(t, 0, tri.b, tri.c));
5968  point B = point(trilinear(t, tri.a, 0, tri.c));
5969  point C = point(trilinear(t, tri.a, tri.b, 0));
5970  return triangle(A, B, C);
5971 }
5972 
5973 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="cevian(side,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5974 point cevian(side side, point P)
5975 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the Cevian point on 'side' with respect of 'P'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5976  triangle t = side.t;
5977  trilinear tri = trilinear(t, locate(P));
5978  int[] s = tricoef(side);
5979  return point(trilinear(t, s[0] * tri.a, s[1] * tri.b, s[2] * tri.c));
5980 }
5981 
5982 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="cevian(vertex,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
5983 line cevian(vertex V, point P)
5984 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return line passing through 'V' and its Cevian image with respect of 'P'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5985  return line(point(V), cevian(opposite(V), P));
5986 }
5987 
5988 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="gergonne(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5989 point gergonne(triangle t)
5990 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the Gergonne point of 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5991  real f(real a, real b, real c){return 1/(a * (b + c - a));}
5992  return point(trilinear(t, f));
5993 }
5994 
5995 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="fermat(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
5996 point[] fermat(triangle t)
5997 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the Fermat points of 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
5998  point[] P;
5999  real A = t.alpha(), B = t.beta(), C = t.gamma();
6000  P.push(point(trilinear(t, 1/Sin(A + 60), 1/Sin(B + 60), 1/Sin(C + 60))));
6001  P.push(point(trilinear(t, 1/Sin(A - 60), 1/Sin(B - 60), 1/Sin(C - 60))));
6002  return P;
6003 }
6004 
6005 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="isotomicconjugate(triangle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6006 point isotomicconjugate(triangle t, point M)
6007 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/IsotomicConjugate.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6008  if(!inside(t.Path(), locate(M))) abort("isotomic: the point must be inside the triangle.");
6009  trilinear tr = trilinear(t, M);
6010  return point(trilinear(t, 1/(t.a()^2 * tr.a), 1/(t.b()^2 * tr.b), 1/(t.c()^2 * tr.c)));
6011 }
6012 
6013 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="isotomic(vertex,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6014 line isotomic(vertex V, point M)
6015 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/IsotomicConjugate.html"/>.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6016  side op = opposite(V);
6017  return line(V, rotate(180, midpoint(op)) * cevian(op, M));
6018 }
6019 
6020 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="isotomic(side,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6021 point isotomic(side side, point M)
6022 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/IsotomicConjugate.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6023  return intersectionpoint(isotomic(opposite(side), M), side);
6024 }
6025 
6026 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="isotomic(triangle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6027 triangle isotomic(triangle t, point M)
6028 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/IsotomicConjugate.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6029  return triangle(isotomic(t.BC, M), isotomic(t.CA, M), isotomic(t.AB, M));
6030 }
6031 
6032 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="isogonalconjugate(triangle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6033 point isogonalconjugate(triangle t, point M)
6034 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/IsogonalConjugate.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6035  trilinear tr = trilinear(t, M);
6036  return point(trilinear(t, 1/tr.a, 1/tr.b, 1/tr.c));
6037 }
6038 
6039 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="isogonal(side,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6040 point isogonal(side side, point M)
6041 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/IsogonalConjugate.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6042  return cevian(side, isogonalconjugate(side.t, M));
6043 }
6044 
6045 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="isogonal(vertex,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6046 line isogonal(vertex V, point M)
6047 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/IsogonalConjugate.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6048  return line(V, isogonal(opposite(V), M));
6049 }
6050 
6051 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="isogonal(triangle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6052 triangle isogonal(triangle t, point M)
6053 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/IsogonalConjugate.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6054  return triangle(isogonal(t.BC, M), isogonal(t.CA, M), isogonal(t.AB, M));
6055 }
6056 
6057 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="pedal(triangle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6058 triangle pedal(triangle t, point M)
6059 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the pedal triangle of 'M' in 't'.
6060  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/PedalTriangle.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6061  return triangle(projection(t.BC) * M, projection(t.AC) * M, projection(t.AB) * M);
6062 }
6063 
6064 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="pedal(triangle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6065 line pedal(side side, point M)
6066 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the pedal line of 'M' cutting 'side'.
6067  <url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/PedalTriangle.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6068  return line(M, projection(side) * M);
6069 }
6070 
6071 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="antipedal(triangle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6072 triangle antipedal(triangle t, point M)
6073 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href = "http://mathworld.wolfram.com/AntipedalTriangle.html"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6074  trilinear Tm = trilinear(t, M);
6075  real a = Tm.a, b = Tm.b, c = Tm.c;
6076  real CA = Cos(t.alpha()), CB = Cos(t.beta()), CC = Cos(t.gamma());
6077  point A = trilinear(t, -(b + a * CC) * (c + a * CB), (c + a * CB) * (a + b * CC), (b + a * CC) * (a + c * CB));
6078  point B = trilinear(t, (c + b * CA) * (b + a * CC), -(c + b * CA) * (a + b * CC), (a + b * CC) * (b + c * CA));
6079  point C = trilinear(t, (b + c * CA) * (c + a * CB), (a + c * CB) * (c + b * CA), -(a + c * CB) * (b + c * CA));
6080  return triangle(A, B, C);
6081 }
6082 
6083 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="extouch(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6084 triangle extouch(triangle t)
6085 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the extouch triangle of the triangle 't'.
6086  The extouch triangle of 't' is the triangle formed by the points
6087  of tangency of a triangle 't' with its excircles.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6088  point A, B, C;
6089  real a = t.a(), b = t.b(), c = t.c();
6090  A = trilinear(t, 0, (a - b + c)/b, (a + b - c)/c);
6091  B = trilinear(t, (-a + b + c)/a, 0, (a + b - c)/c);
6092  C = trilinear(t, (-a + b + c)/a, (a - b + c)/b, 0);
6093  return triangle(A, B, C);
6094 }
6095 
6096 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="incentral(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6097 triangle incentral(triangle t)
6098 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the incentral triangle of the triangle 't'.
6099  It is the triangle whose vertices are determined by the intersections of the
6100  reference triangle's angle bisectors with the respective opposite sides.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6101  point A, B, C;
6102  // real a = t.a(), b = t.b(), c = t.c();
6103  A = trilinear(t, 0, 1, 1);
6104  B = trilinear(t, 1, 0, 1);
6105  C = trilinear(t, 1, 1, 0);
6106  return triangle(A, B, C);
6107 }
6108 
6109 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="extouch(side)"><code></asyxml>*/
6110 triangle extouch(side side)
6111 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the triangle formed by the points of tangency of the triangle referenced by 'side' with its excircles.
6112  One vertex of the returned triangle is on the segment 'side'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6113  triangle t = side.t;
6114  transform p1 = projection((line)t.AB);
6115  transform p2 = projection((line)t.AC);
6116  transform p3 = projection((line)t.BC);
6117  point EP = excenter(side);
6118  return triangle(p3 * EP, p2 * EP, p1 * EP);
6119 }
6120 
6121 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="bisectorpoint(side)"><code></asyxml>*/
6122 point bisectorpoint(side side)
6123 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The intersection point of the angle bisector from the
6124  opposite point of 'side' with the side 'side'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6125  triangle t = side.t;
6126  int n = numarray[abs(side.n) - 1];
6127  if(n == 1) return trilinear(t, 1, 1, 0);
6128  if(n == 2) return trilinear(t, 0, 1, 1);
6129  return trilinear(t, 1, 0, 1);
6130 }
6131 
6132 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="bisector(vertex,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
6133 line bisector(vertex V, real angle = 0)
6134 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the interior bisector passing through 'V' rotated by angle (in degrees)
6135  around 'V'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6136  return rotate(angle, point(V)) * line(point(V), incenter(V.t));
6137 }
6138 
6139 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="bisector(side)"><code></asyxml>*/
6140 line bisector(side side)
6141 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the bisector of the line segment 'side'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6142  return bisector(segment(side));
6143 }
6144 
6145 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="intouch(side)"><code></asyxml>*/
6146 point intouch(side side)
6147 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The point of tangency on the side 'side' of its incircle.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6148  triangle t = side.t;
6149  real a = t.a(), b = t.b(), c = t.c();
6150  int n = numarray[abs(side.n) - 1];
6151  if(n == 1) return trilinear(t, b * c/(-a + b + c), a * c/(a - b + c), 0);
6152  if(n == 2) return trilinear(t, 0, a * c/(a - b + c), a * b/(a + b - c));
6153  return trilinear(t, b * c/(-a + b + c), 0, a * b/(a + b - c));
6154 }
6155 
6156 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="intouch(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6157 triangle intouch(triangle t)
6158 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the intouch triangle of the triangle 't'.
6159  The intouch triangle of 't' is the triangle formed by the points
6160  of tangency of a triangle 't' with its incircles.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6161  point A, B, C;
6162  real a = t.a(), b = t.b(), c = t.c();
6163  A = trilinear(t, 0, a * c/(a - b + c), a * b/(a + b - c));
6164  B = trilinear(t, b * c/(-a + b + c), 0, a * b/(a + b - c));
6165  C = trilinear(t, b * c/(-a + b + c), a * c/(a - b + c), 0);
6166  return triangle(A, B, C);
6167 }
6168 
6169 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="tangential(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6170 triangle tangential(triangle t)
6171 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangential triangle of the triangle 't'.
6172  The tangential triangle of 't' is the triangle formed by the lines
6173  tangent to the circumcircle of the given triangle 't' at its vertices.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6174  point A, B, C;
6175  real a = t.a(), b = t.b(), c = t.c();
6176  A = trilinear(t, -a, b, c);
6177  B = trilinear(t, a, -b, c);
6178  C = trilinear(t, a, b, -c);
6179  return triangle(A, B, C);
6180 }
6181 
6182 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="medial(triangle t)"><code></asyxml>*/
6183 triangle medial(triangle t)
6184 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the triangle whose vertices are midpoints of the sides of 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6185  return triangle(midpoint(t.BC), midpoint(t.AC), midpoint(t.AB));
6186 }
6187 
6188 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="median(vertex)"><code></asyxml>*/
6189 line median(vertex V)
6190 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return median from 'V'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6191  return line(point(V), midpoint(segment(opposite(V))));
6192 }
6193 
6194 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="median(side)"><code></asyxml>*/
6195 line median(side side)
6196 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return median from the opposite vertex of 'side'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6197  return median(opposite(side));
6198 }
6199 
6200 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="orthic(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6201 triangle orthic(triangle t)
6202 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the triangle whose vertices are endpoints of the altitudes from each of the vertices of 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6203  return triangle(foot(t.BC), foot(t.AC), foot(t.AB));
6204 }
6205 
6206 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="symmedial(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6207 triangle symmedial(triangle t)
6208 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the symmedial triangle of 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6209  point A, B, C;
6210  real a = t.a(), b = t.b(), c = t.c();
6211  A = trilinear(t, 0, b, c);
6212  B = trilinear(t, a, 0, c);
6213  C = trilinear(t, a, b, 0);
6214  return triangle(A, B, C);
6215 }
6216 
6217 /*<asyxml><function type="triangle" signature="anticomplementary(triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6218 triangle anticomplementary(triangle t)
6219 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the triangle which has the given triangle 't' as its medial triangle.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6220  real a = t.a(), b = t.b(), c = t.c();
6221  real ab = a * b, bc = b * c, ca = c * a;
6222  point A = trilinear(t, -bc, ca, ab);
6223  point B = trilinear(t, bc, -ca, ab);
6224  point C = trilinear(t, bc, ca, -ab);
6225  return triangle(A, B, C);
6226 }
6227 
6228 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(triangle,line,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
6229 point[] intersectionpoints(triangle t, line l, bool extended = false)
6230 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the intersection points.
6231  If 'extended' is true, the sides are lines else the sides are segments.
6232  intersectionpoints(line, triangle, bool) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6233  point[] OP;
6234  void addpoint(point P)
6235  {
6236  if(defined(P)) {
6237  bool exist = false;
6238  for (int i = 0; i < OP.length; ++i) {
6239  if(P == OP[i]) {exist = true; break;}
6240  }
6241  if(!exist) OP.push(P);
6242  }
6243  }
6244  if(extended) {
6245  for (int i = 1; i <= 3; ++i) {
6246  addpoint(intersectionpoint(t.line(i), l));
6247  }
6248  } else {
6249  for (int i = 1; i <= 3; ++i) {
6250  addpoint(intersectionpoint((segment)t.line(i), l));
6251  }
6252  }
6253  return OP;
6254 }
6255 
6256 point[] intersectionpoints(line l, triangle t, bool extended = false)
6257 {
6258  return intersectionpoints(t, l, extended);
6259 }
6260 
6261 /*<asyxml><function type="vector" signature="dir(vertex)"><code></asyxml>*/
6262 vector dir(vertex V)
6263 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>The direction (towards the outside of the triangle) of the interior angle bisector of 'V'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6264  triangle t = V.t;
6265  if(V.n == 1) return vector(defaultcoordsys, (-dir(t.A--t.B, t.A--t.C)));
6266  if(V.n == 2) return vector(defaultcoordsys, (-dir(t.B--t.A, t.B--t.C)));
6267  return vector(defaultcoordsys, (-dir(t.C--t.A, t.C--t.B)));
6268 }
6269 
6270 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="lvoid label(picture,Label,vertex,pair,real,pen,filltype)"><code></asyxml>*/
6271 void label(picture pic = currentpicture, Label L, vertex V,
6272  pair align = dir(V),
6273  real alignFactor = 1,
6274  pen p = nullpen, filltype filltype = NoFill)
6275 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw 'L' on picture 'pic' at vertex 'V' aligned by 'alignFactor * align'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6276  label(pic, L, locate(point(V)), alignFactor * align, p, filltype);
6277 }
6278 
6279 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="label(picture,Label,Label,Label,triangle,real,real,pen,filltype)"><code></asyxml>*/
6280 void label(picture pic = currentpicture, Label LA = "$A$",
6281  Label LB = "$B$", Label LC = "$C$",
6282  triangle t,
6283  real alignAngle = 0,
6284  real alignFactor = 1,
6285  pen p = nullpen, filltype filltype = NoFill)
6286 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw labels LA, LB and LC aligned in the rotated (by 'alignAngle' in degrees) direction
6287  (towards the outside of the triangle) of the interior angle bisector of vertices.
6288  One can individually modify the alignment by setting the Label parameter 'align'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6289  Label lla = LA.copy();
6290  lla.align(lla.align, rotate(alignAngle) * locate(dir(t.VA)));
6291  label(pic, LA, t.VA, align = lla.align.dir, alignFactor = alignFactor, p, filltype);
6292  Label llb = LB.copy();
6293  llb.align(llb.align, rotate(alignAngle) * locate(dir(t.VB)));
6294  label(pic, llb, t.VB, align = llb.align.dir, alignFactor = alignFactor, p, filltype);
6295  Label llc = LC.copy();
6296  llc.align(llc.align, rotate(alignAngle) * locate(dir(t.VC)));
6297  label(pic, llc, t.VC, align = llc.align.dir, alignFactor = alignFactor, p, filltype);
6298 }
6299 
6300 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="show(picture,Label,Label,Label,Label,Label,Label,triangle,pen,filltype)"><code></asyxml>*/
6301 void show(picture pic = currentpicture,
6302  Label LA = "$A$", Label LB = "$B$", Label LC = "$C$",
6303  Label La = "$a$", Label Lb = "$b$", Label Lc = "$c$",
6304  triangle t, pen p = currentpen, filltype filltype = NoFill)
6305 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw triangle and labels of sides and vertices.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6306  pair a = locate(t.A), b = locate(t.B), c = locate(t.C);
6307  draw(pic, a--b--c--cycle, p);
6308  label(pic, LA, a, -dir(a--b, a--c), p, filltype);
6309  label(pic, LB, b, -dir(b--a, b--c), p, filltype);
6310  label(pic, LC, c, -dir(c--a, c--b), p, filltype);
6311  pair aligna = I * unit(c - b), alignb = I * unit(c - a), alignc = I * unit(b - a);
6312  pair mAB = locate(midpoint(t.AB)), mAC = locate(midpoint(t.AC)), mBC = locate(midpoint(t.BC));
6313  label(pic, La, b--c, align = rotate(dot(a - mBC, aligna) > 0 ? 180 :0) * aligna, p);
6314  label(pic, Lb, a--c, align = rotate(dot(b - mAC, alignb) > 0 ? 180 :0) * alignb, p);
6315  label(pic, Lc, a--b, align = rotate(dot(c - mAB, alignc) > 0 ? 180 :0) * alignc, p);
6316 }
6317 
6318 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="draw(picture,triangle,pen,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
6319 void draw(picture pic = currentpicture, triangle t, pen p = currentpen, marker marker = nomarker)
6320 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw sides of the triangle 't' on picture 'pic' using pen 'p'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6321  draw(pic, (path)t, p, marker);
6322 }
6323 
6324 void fill(picture pic = currentpicture, triangle t, pen p = currentpen)
6325 {
6326  fill(pic, (path)t, p);
6327 }
6328 
6329 void filldraw(picture pic = currentpicture, triangle t, pen fillpen = currentpen, pen drawpen = currentpen)
6330 {
6331  fill(pic, t, fillpen);
6332  draw(pic, t, drawpen);
6333 }
6334 
6335 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="draw(picture,triangle[],pen,marker)"><code></asyxml>*/
6336 void draw(picture pic = currentpicture, triangle[] ts, pen p = currentpen, marker marker = nomarker)
6337 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw sides of the triangles 't' on picture 'pic' using pen 'p'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6338  for(triangle t: ts) draw(pic, t, p, marker);
6339 }
6340 
6341 void fill(picture pic = currentpicture, triangle[] ts, pen p = currentpen)
6342 {
6343  for(triangle t: ts) fill(pic, t, p);
6344 }
6345 
6346 void filldraw(picture pic = currentpicture, triangle[] ts, pen fillpen = currentpen, pen drawpen = currentpen)
6347 {
6348  for(triangle t: ts) filldraw(pic, t, fillpen, drawpen);
6349 }
6350 
6351 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="drawline(picture,triangle,pen)"><code></asyxml>*/
6352 void drawline(picture pic = currentpicture, triangle t, pen p = currentpen)
6353 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw lines of the triangle 't' on picture 'pic' using pen 'p'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6354  draw(t, p);
6355  draw(pic, line(t.A, t.B), p);
6356  draw(pic, line(t.A, t.C), p);
6357  draw(pic, line(t.B, t.C), p);
6358 }
6359 
6360 /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="dot(picture,triangle,pen)"><code></asyxml>*/
6361 void dot(picture pic = currentpicture, triangle t, pen p = currentpen)
6362 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Draw a dot at each vertex of 't'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6363  dot(pic, t.A^^t.B^^t.C, p);
6364 }
6365 // *.......................TRIANGLES.......................*
6366 // *=======================================================*
6367 
6368 // *=======================================================*
6369 // *.......................INVERSIONS......................*
6370 /*<asyxml><struct signature="inversion"><code></asyxml>*/
6371 struct inversion
6372 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>https://mathworld.wolfram.com/Inversion.html</documentation></asyxml>*/
6373  point C;
6374  real k;
6375 
6376  /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="init(point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
6377  void operator init(point C, real k)
6378  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the inversion with respect to 'C' having circle power 'k'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6379  this.C = C;
6380  this.k = k;
6381  }
6382  /*<asyxml><function type="void" signature="init(real,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6383  void operator init(real k, point C)
6384  {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the inversion with respect to 'C' having circle power 'k'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6385  this.C = C;
6386  this.k = k;
6387  }
6388 }/*<asyxml></struct></asyxml>*/
6389 
6390 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="inverse(inversion,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6391 point inverse(inversion i, point P)
6392 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the inverse point of 'P' with respect to 'i'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6393  pair C = locate(i.C), P1 = locate(P);
6394  pair P2 = C + i.k / conj(P1 - C);
6395  return P2 / currentcoordsys;
6396 }
6397 
6398 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="radicalcenter(circle,circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6399 point radicalcenter(circle c1, circle c2)
6400 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href="http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puissance_d'un_point_par_rapport_%C3%A0_un_cercle"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6401  real k = c1.r^2 - c2.r^2;
6402  pair C1 = locate(c1.C), C2 = locate(c2.C);
6403  pair D = C2 - C1;
6404  pair K = C1 == C2 ?
6405  (infinity, infinity) :
6406  0.5 * (C1 + C2 + k * D / abs2(D));
6407  return K / currentcoordsys;
6408 }
6409 
6410 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="radicalline(circle,circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6411 line radicalline(circle c1, circle c2)
6412 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href="http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puissance_d'un_point_par_rapport_%C3%A0_un_cercle"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6413  if (c1.C == c2.C) abort("radicalline: the centers must be distinct");
6414  return perpendicular(radicalcenter(c1, c2), line(c1.C, c2.C));
6415 }
6416 
6417 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="radicalcenter(circle,circle,circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6418 point radicalcenter(circle c1, circle c2, circle c3)
6419 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation><url href="http://fr.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puissance_d'un_point_par_rapport_%C3%A0_un_cercle"/></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6420  return intersectionpoint(radicalline(c1, c2), radicalline(c1, c3));
6421 }
6422 
6423 /*<asyxml><function type="inversion" signature="inversion(circle,circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6424 inversion inversion(circle c1, circle c2, real sgn = 1)
6425 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the inversion which transforms 'c1' to
6426  • 'c2' and positive inversion radius if 'sgn > 0';
6427  • 'c2' and negative inversion radius if 'sgn < 0';
6428  • 'c1' and 'c2' to 'c2' if 'sgn = 0'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6429  if(sgn == 0) {
6430  point O = radicalcenter(c1, c2);
6431  return inversion(O, O^c1);
6432  }
6433  pair C1 = locate(c1.C), C2 = locate(c2.C);
6434  real r1 = c1.r, r2 = sgn(sgn) * c2.r;
6435  pair O = (r2 * C1 + r1 * C2) / (r1 + r2);
6436  real k = r1 * r2 * (1 - abs2(C2 - C1) / (r1 + r2)^2);
6437  return inversion(O / currentcoordsys, k);
6438 }
6439 
6440 /*<asyxml><function type="inversion" signature="inversion(circle,circle,circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6441 inversion inversion(circle c1, circle c2, circle c3)
6442 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the inversion which transform 'c1' to 'c1', 'c2' to 'c2' and 'c3' to 'c3'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6443  point Rc = radicalcenter(c1, c2, c3);
6444  return inversion(Rc, Rc^c1);
6445 }
6446 
6447 circle operator cast(inversion i)
6448 {
6449  return circle(i.C, sgn(i.k) * sqrt(abs(i.k)));
6450 }
6451 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="circle(inversion)"><code></asyxml>*/
6452 circle circle(inversion i)
6453 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the inversion circle of 'i'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6454  return i;
6455 }
6456 
6457 inversion operator cast(circle c)
6458 {
6459  return inversion(c.C, sgn(c.r) * c.r^2);
6460 }
6461 /*<asyxml><function type="inversion" signature="inversion(circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6462 inversion inversion(circle c)
6463 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the inversion represented by the circle of 'c'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6464  return c;
6465 }
6466 
6467 /*<asyxml><operator type="point" signature="*(inversion,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6468 point operator *(inversion i, point P)
6469 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide inversion * point.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
6470  return inverse(i, P);
6471 }
6472 
6473 void lineinversion()
6474 {
6475  warning("lineinversion", "the inversion of the line is not a circle.
6476 The returned circle has an infinite radius, circle.l has been set.");
6477 }
6478 
6479 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="inverse(inversion,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
6480 circle inverse(inversion i, line l)
6481 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the inverse circle of 'l' with respect to 'i'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6482  if(i.C @ l) {
6483  lineinversion();
6484  circle c = circle(i.C, infinity);
6485  c.l = l;
6486  return c;
6487  }
6488  point A = inverse(i, l.A), B = inverse(i, l.B);
6489  return circle(i.C, A, B);
6490 }
6491 
6492 /*<asyxml><operator type="circle" signature="*(inversion,line)"><code></asyxml>*/
6493 circle operator *(inversion i, line l)
6494 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide inversion * line for lines that don't pass through the inversion center.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
6495  return inverse(i, l);
6496 }
6497 
6498 /*<asyxml><function type="circle" signature="inverse(inversion,circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6499 circle inverse(inversion i, circle c)
6500 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the inverse circle of 'c' with respect to 'i'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6501  if(degenerate(c)) return inverse(i, c.l);
6502  if(i.C @ c) {
6503  lineinversion();
6504  point M1 = rotate(90, c.C) * i.C, M2 = rotate(-90, c.C) * i.C;
6505  circle c1 = circle(i.C, infinity);
6506  c1.l = line(inverse(i, M1), inverse(i, M2));
6507  return c1;
6508  }
6509  pair C1 = locate(i.C), C2 = locate(c.C);
6510  pair D = C2 - C1;
6511  real s = i.k / (abs2(D) - c.r^2);
6512  pair C3 = C1 + s * D;
6513  return circle((point)(C3 / currentcoordsys), abs(s) * c.r);
6514 }
6515 
6516 /*<asyxml><operator type="circle" signature="*(inversion,circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6517 circle operator *(inversion i, circle c)
6518 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide inversion * circle.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
6519  return inverse(i, c);
6520 }
6521 // *.......................INVERSIONS......................*
6522 // *=======================================================*
6523 
6524 // *=======================================================*
6525 // *........................FOOTER.........................*
6526 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(line,circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6527 point[] intersectionpoints(line l, circle c)
6528 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Note that the line 'l' may be a segment by casting.
6529  intersectionpoints(circle, line) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6530  if(degenerate(c)) return new point[]{intersectionpoint(l, c.l)};
6531  point[] op;
6532  coordsys R = samecoordsys(l.A, c.C) ?
6533  l.A.coordsys : defaultcoordsys;
6534  coordsys Rp = defaultcoordsys;
6535  circle cc = circle(changecoordsys(Rp, c.C), c.r);
6536  point proj = projection(l) * c.C;
6537  if(proj @ cc) { // The line is a tangente of the circle.
6538  if(proj @ l) op.push(proj);// line may be a segement...
6539  } else {
6540  coordsys Rc = cartesiansystem(c.C, (1, 0), (0, 1));
6541  line ll = changecoordsys(Rc, l);
6542  pair[] P = intersectionpoints(ll.A.coordinates, ll.B.coordinates,
6543  1, 0, 1, 0, 0, -c.r^2);
6544  for (int i = 0; i < P.length; ++i) {
6545  point inter = changecoordsys(R, point(Rc, P[i]));
6546  if(inter @ l) op.push(inter);
6547  }
6548  }
6549  return op;
6550 }
6551 
6552 point[] intersectionpoints(circle c, line l)
6553 {
6554  return intersectionpoints(l, c);
6555 }
6556 
6557 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(line,ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
6558 point[] intersectionpoints(line l, ellipse el)
6559 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Note that the line 'l' may be a segment by casting.
6560  intersectionpoints(ellipse, line) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6561  if(el.e == 0) return intersectionpoints(l, (circle)el);
6562  if(degenerate(el)) return new point[]{intersectionpoint(l, el.l)};
6563  point[] op;
6564  coordsys R = samecoordsys(l.A, el.C) ? l.A.coordsys : defaultcoordsys;
6565  coordsys Rp = defaultcoordsys;
6566  line ll = changecoordsys(Rp, l);
6567  ellipse ell = (ellipse) changecoordsys(Rp, el);
6568  circle C = circle(ell.C, ell.a);
6569  point[] Ip = intersectionpoints(ll, C);
6570  if (Ip.length > 0 &&
6571  (perpendicular(ll, line(ell.F1, Ip[0])) ||
6572  perpendicular(ll, line(ell.F2, Ip[0])))) {
6573  // http://www.mathcurve.com/courbes2d/ellipse/ellipse.shtml
6574  // Definition of the tangent at the antipodal point on the circle.
6575  // 'l' is a tangent of 'el'
6576  transform t = scale(el.a/el.b, el.F1, el.F2, el.C, rotate(90, el.C) * el.F1);
6577  point inter = inverse(t) * intersectionpoints(C, t * ll)[0];
6578  if(inter @ l) op.push(inter);
6579  } else {
6580  coordsys Rc = canonicalcartesiansystem(el);
6581  line ll = changecoordsys(Rc, l);
6582  pair[] P = intersectionpoints(ll.A.coordinates, ll.B.coordinates,
6583  1/el.a^2, 0, 1/el.b^2, 0, 0, -1);
6584  for (int i = 0; i < P.length; ++i) {
6585  point inter = changecoordsys(R, point(Rc, P[i]));
6586  if(inter @ l) op.push(inter);
6587  }
6588  }
6589  return op;
6590 }
6591 
6592 point[] intersectionpoints(ellipse el, line l)
6593 {
6594  return intersectionpoints(l, el);
6595 }
6596 
6597 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(line,parabola)"><code></asyxml>*/
6598 point[] intersectionpoints(line l, parabola p)
6599 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Note that the line 'l' may be a segment by casting.
6600  intersectionpoints(parabola, line) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6601  point[] op;
6602  coordsys R = coordsys(p);
6603  bool tgt = false;
6604  line ll = changecoordsys(R, l),
6605  lv = parallel(p.V, p.D);
6606  point M = intersectionpoint(lv, ll), tgtp;
6607  if(finite(M)) {// Test if 'l' is tangent to 'p'
6608  line l1 = bisector(line(M, p.F));
6609  line l2 = rotate(90, M) * lv;
6610  point P = intersectionpoint(l1, l2);
6611  tgtp = rotate(180, P) * p.F;
6612  tgt = (tgtp @ l);
6613  }
6614  if(tgt) {
6615  if(tgtp @ l) op.push(tgtp);
6616  } else {
6617  real[] eq = changecoordsys(defaultcoordsys, equation(p)).a;
6618  pair[] tp = intersectionpoints(locate(l.A), locate(l.B), eq);
6619  point inter;
6620  for (int i = 0; i < tp.length; ++i) {
6621  inter = point(R, tp[i]/R);
6622  if(inter @ l) op.push(inter);
6623  }
6624  }
6625  return op;
6626 }
6627 
6628 point[] intersectionpoints(parabola p, line l)
6629 {
6630  return intersectionpoints(l, p);
6631 }
6632 
6633 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(line,hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
6634 point[] intersectionpoints(line l, hyperbola h)
6635 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Note that the line 'l' may be a segment by casting.
6636  intersectionpoints(hyperbola, line) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6637  point[] op;
6638  coordsys R = coordsys(h);
6639  point A = intersectionpoint(l, h.A1), B = intersectionpoint(l, h.A2);
6640  point M = 0.5*(A + B);
6641  bool tgt = Finite(M) ? M @ h : false;
6642  if(tgt) {
6643  if(M @ l) op.push(M);
6644  } else {
6645  real[] eq = changecoordsys(defaultcoordsys, equation(h)).a;
6646  pair[] tp = intersectionpoints(locate(l.A), locate(l.B), eq);
6647  point inter;
6648  for (int i = 0; i < tp.length; ++i) {
6649  inter = point(R, tp[i]/R);
6650  if(inter @ l) op.push(inter);
6651  }
6652  }
6653  return op;
6654 }
6655 
6656 point[] intersectionpoints(hyperbola h, line l)
6657 {
6658  return intersectionpoints(l, h);
6659 }
6660 
6661 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(line,conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
6662 point[] intersectionpoints(line l, conic co)
6663 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Note that the line 'l' may be a segment by casting.
6664  intersectionpoints(conic, line) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6665  point[] op;
6666  if(co.e < 1) op = intersectionpoints((ellipse)co, l);
6667  else
6668  if(co.e == 1) op = intersectionpoints((parabola)co, l);
6669  else op = intersectionpoints((hyperbola)co, l);
6670  return op;
6671 }
6672 
6673 point[] intersectionpoints(conic co, line l)
6674 {
6675  return intersectionpoints(l, co);
6676 }
6677 
6678 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(bqe,bqe)"><code></asyxml>*/
6679 point[] intersectionpoints(bqe bqe1, bqe bqe2)
6680 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the intersection of the two conic sections whose equations are 'bqe1' and 'bqe2'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6681  coordsys R=canonicalcartesiansystem(conic(bqe1));
6682  real[] a=changecoordsys(R,bqe1).a;
6683  real[] b=changecoordsys(R,bqe2).a;
6684 
6685  static real e=100 * sqrt(realEpsilon);
6686  real[] x,y,c;
6687  point[] P;
6688  if(abs(a[0]-b[0]) > e || abs(a[1]-b[1]) > e || abs(a[2]-b[2]) > e) {
6689  c=new real[] {a[0]*a[2]*(-2*b[0]*b[2]+b[1]^2)+a[0]^2*b[2]^2+a[2]^2*b[0]^2,
6690 
6691  2*a[0]*a[2]*b[1]*b[4]-2*a[2]*a[3]*b[0]*b[2]
6692  -2*a[0]*a[2]*b[2]*b[3]+a[2]*a[3]*b[1]^2+2*a[2]^2*b[0]*b[3],
6693 
6694  a[2]*a[5]*b[1]^2-2*a[2]*a[3]*b[2]*b[3]+2*a[2]^2*b[0]*b[5]
6695  +2*a[0]*a[5]*b[2]^2+a[3]^2*b[2]^2-2*a[2]*a[5]*b[0]*b[2]
6696  -2*a[0]*a[2]*b[2]*b[5]+a[2]^2*b[3]^2+2*a[2]*a[3]*b[1]*b[4]
6697  +a[0]*a[2]*b[4]^2,
6698 
6699  a[2]*a[3]*b[4]^2+2*a[2]^2*b[3]*b[5]-2*a[2]*a[3]*b[2]*b[5]
6700  -2*a[2]*a[5]*b[2]*b[3]+2*a[2]*a[5]*b[1]*b[4],
6701 
6702  -2*a[2]*a[5]*b[2]*b[5]+a[5]^2*b[2]^2+a[2]*a[5]*b[4]^2
6703  +a[2]^2*b[5]^2};
6704  x=realquarticroots(c[0],c[1],c[2],c[3],c[4]);
6705  } else {
6706  if(abs(b[4]) > e) {
6707  real D=b[4]^2;
6708  c=new real[] {(a[0]*b[4]^2+a[2]*b[3]^2+
6709  (-2*a[2]*a[3])*b[3]+a[2]*a[3]^2)/D,
6710  -((-2*a[2]*b[3]+2*a[2]*a[3])*b[5]-a[3]*b[4]^2+
6711  (2*a[2]*a[5])*b[3])/D,a[2]*(a[5]-b[5])^2/D+a[5]};
6712  x=quadraticroots(c[0],c[1],c[2]);
6713  } else {
6714  if(abs(a[3]-b[3]) > e) {
6715  real D=b[3]-a[3];
6716  c=new real[] {a[2],0,a[0]*(a[5]-b[5])^2/D^2-a[3]*b[5]/D+a[5]};
6717  y=quadraticroots(c[0],c[1],c[2]);
6718  for(int i=0; i < y.length; ++i) {
6719  c=new real[] {a[0],a[3],a[2]*y[i]^2+a[5]};
6720  x=quadraticroots(c[0],c[1],c[2]);
6721  for(int j=0; j < x.length; ++j) {
6722  if(abs(b[0]*x[j]^2+b[1]*x[j]*y[i]+b[2]*y[i]^2+b[3]*x[j]
6723  +b[4]*y[i]+b[5]) < 1e-5)
6724  P.push(changecoordsys(currentcoordsys,point(R,(x[j],y[i]))));
6725  }
6726  }
6727  return P;
6728  } else {
6729  if(abs(a[5]-b[5]) < e)
6730  abort("intersectionpoints: intersection of identical conics.");
6731  }
6732  }
6733  }
6734  for(int i=0; i < x.length; ++i) {
6735  c=new real[] {a[2],0,a[0]*x[i]^2+a[3]*x[i]+a[5]};
6736  y=quadraticroots(c[0],c[1],c[2]);
6737  for(int j=0; j < y.length; ++j) {
6738  if(abs(b[0]*x[i]^2+b[1]*x[i]*y[j]+b[2]*y[j]^2+b[3]*x[i]+b[4]*y[j]+b[5])
6739  < 1e-5)
6740  P.push(changecoordsys(currentcoordsys,point(R,(x[i],y[j]))));
6741  }
6742  }
6743  return P;
6744 }
6745 
6746 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(conic,conic)"><code></asyxml>*/
6747 point[] intersectionpoints(conic co1, conic co2)
6748 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the intersection points of the two conics.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6749  if(degenerate(co1)) return intersectionpoints(co1.l[0], co2);
