6750  if(degenerate(co2)) return intersectionpoints(co1, co2.l[0]);
6751  return intersectionpoints(equation(co1), equation(co2));
6752 }
6753 
6754 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(triangle,conic,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
6755 point[] intersectionpoints(triangle t, conic co, bool extended = false)
6756 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the intersection points.
6757  If 'extended' is true, the sides are lines else the sides are segments.
6758  intersectionpoints(conic, triangle, bool) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6759  if(degenerate(co)) return intersectionpoints(t, co.l[0], extended);
6760  point[] OP;
6761  void addpoint(point P[])
6762  {
6763  for (int i = 0; i < P.length; ++i) {
6764  if(defined(P[i])) {
6765  bool exist = false;
6766  for (int j = 0; j < OP.length; ++j) {
6767  if(P[i] == OP[j]) {exist = true; break;}
6768  }
6769  if(!exist) OP.push(P[i]);
6770  }}}
6771  if(extended) {
6772  for (int i = 1; i <= 3; ++i) {
6773  addpoint(intersectionpoints(t.line(i), co));
6774  }
6775  } else {
6776  for (int i = 1; i <= 3; ++i) {
6777  addpoint(intersectionpoints((segment)t.line(i), co));
6778  }
6779  }
6780  return OP;
6781 }
6782 
6783 point[] intersectionpoints(conic co, triangle t, bool extended = false)
6784 {
6785  return intersectionpoints(t, co, extended);
6786 }
6787 
6788 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(ellipse,ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
6789 point[] intersectionpoints(ellipse a, ellipse b)
6790 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6791  // if(degenerate(a)) return intersectionpoints(a.l, b);
6792  // if(degenerate(b)) return intersectionpoints(a, b.l);;
6793  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6794 }
6795 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(ellipse,circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6796 point[] intersectionpoints(ellipse a, circle b)
6797 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6798  // if(degenerate(a)) return intersectionpoints(a.l, b);
6799  // if(degenerate(b)) return intersectionpoints(a, b.l);;
6800  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6801 }
6802 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(circle,ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
6803 point[] intersectionpoints(circle a, ellipse b)
6804 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6805  return intersectionpoints(b, a);
6806 }
6807 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(ellipse,parabola)"><code></asyxml>*/
6808 point[] intersectionpoints(ellipse a, parabola b)
6809 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6810  // if(degenerate(a)) return intersectionpoints(a.l, b);
6811  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6812 }
6813 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(parabola,ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
6814 point[] intersectionpoints(parabola a, ellipse b)
6815 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6816  return intersectionpoints(b, a);
6817 }
6818 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(ellipse,hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
6819 point[] intersectionpoints(ellipse a, hyperbola b)
6820 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6821  // if(degenerate(a)) return intersectionpoints(a.l, b);
6822  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6823 }
6824 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(hyperbola,ellipse)"><code></asyxml>*/
6825 point[] intersectionpoints(hyperbola a, ellipse b)
6826 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6827  return intersectionpoints(b, a);
6828 }
6829

6831 point[] intersectionpoints(circle a, parabola b)
6832 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6833  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6834 }

6836 point[] intersectionpoints(parabola a, circle b)
6837 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6838  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6839 }

6841 point[] intersectionpoints(circle a, hyperbola b)
6842 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6843  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6844 }

6846 point[] intersectionpoints(hyperbola a, circle b)
6847 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6848  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6849 }

6851 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(parabola,parabola)"><code></asyxml>*/
6852 point[] intersectionpoints(parabola a, parabola b)
6853 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6854  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6855 }
6856 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(parabola,hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
6857 point[] intersectionpoints(parabola a, hyperbola b)
6858 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6859  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6860 }
6861 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(hyperbola,parabola)"><code></asyxml>*/
6862 point[] intersectionpoints(hyperbola a, parabola b)
6863 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6864  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6865 }
6866 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(hyperbola,hyperbola)"><code></asyxml>*/
6867 point[] intersectionpoints(hyperbola a, hyperbola b)
6868 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6869  return intersectionpoints((conic)a, (conic)b);
6870 }
6871 
6872 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(circle,circle)"><code></asyxml>*/
6873 point[] intersectionpoints(circle c1, circle c2)
6874 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6875  if(degenerate(c1))
6876  return degenerate(c2) ?
6877  new point[]{intersectionpoint(c1.l, c2.l)} : intersectionpoints(c1.l, c2);
6878  if(degenerate(c2)) return intersectionpoints(c1, c2.l);
6879  return (c1.C == c2.C) ?
6880  new point[] :
6881  intersectionpoints(radicalline(c1, c2), c1);
6882 }
6883 
6884 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="tangent(circle,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
6885 line tangent(circle c, abscissa x)
6886 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangent of 'c' at 'point(c, x)'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6887  if(c.r == 0) abort("tangent: a circle with a radius equals zero has no tangent.");
6888  point M = point(c, x);
6889  return line(rotate(90, M) * c.C, M);
6890 }
6891 
6892 /*<asyxml><function type="line[]" signature="tangents(circle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6893 line[] tangents(circle c, point M)
6894 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangents of 'c' passing through 'M'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6895  line[] ol;
6896  if(inside(c, M)) return ol;
6897  if(M @ c) {
6898  ol.push(tangent(c, relabscissa(c, M)));
6899  } else {
6900  circle cc = circle(c.C, M);
6901  point[] inter = intersectionpoints(c, cc);
6902  for (int i = 0; i < inter.length; ++i)
6903  ol.push(tangents(c, inter[i])[0]);
6904  }
6905  return ol;
6906 }
6907 
6908 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(circle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6909 point point(circle c, point M)
6910 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the intersection point of 'c'
6911  with the half-line '[c.C M)'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6912  return intersectionpoints(c, line(c.C, false, M))[0];
6913 }
6914 
6915 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="tangent(circle,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6916 line tangent(circle c, point M)
6917 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangent of 'c' at the
6918  intersection point of the half-line'[c.C M)'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6919  return tangents(c, point(c, M))[0];
6920 }
6921 
6922 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="point(circle,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
6923 point point(circle c, explicit vector v)
6924 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the intersection point of 'c'
6925  with the half-line '[c.C v)'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6926  return point(c, c.C + v);
6927 }
6928 
6929 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="tangent(circle,explicit vector)"><code></asyxml>*/
6930 line tangent(circle c, explicit vector v)
6931 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangent of 'c' at the
6932  point M so that vec(c.C M) is collinear to 'v' with the same sense.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6933  line ol = tangent(c, c.C + v);
6934  return dot(ol.v, v) > 0 ? ol : reverse(ol);
6935 }
6936 
6937 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="tangent(ellipse,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
6938 line tangent(ellipse el, abscissa x)
6939 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangent of 'el' at 'point(el, x)'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6940  point M = point(el, x);
6941  line l1 = line(el.F1, M);
6942  line l2 = line(el.F2, M);
6943  line ol = (l1 == l2) ? perpendicular(M, l1) : bisector(l1, l2, 90, false);
6944  return ol;
6945 }
6946 
6947 /*<asyxml><function type="line[]" signature="tangents(ellipse,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6948 line[] tangents(ellipse el, point M)
6949 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangents of 'el' passing through 'M'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6950  line[] ol;
6951  if(inside(el, M)) return ol;
6952  if(M @ el) {
6953  ol.push(tangent(el, relabscissa(el, M)));
6954  } else {
6955  point Mp = samecoordsys(M, el.F2) ?
6956  M : changecoordsys(el.F2.coordsys, M);
6957  circle c = circle(Mp, abs(el.F1 - Mp));
6958  circle cc = circle(el.F2, 2 * el.a);
6959  point[] inter = intersectionpoints(c, cc);
6960  for (int i = 0; i < inter.length; ++i) {
6961  line tl = line(inter[i], el.F2, false);
6962  point[] P = intersectionpoints(tl, el);
6963  ol.push(line(Mp, P[0]));
6964  }
6965  }
6966  return ol;
6967 }
6968 
6969 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="tangent(parabola,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
6970 line tangent(parabola p, abscissa x)
6971 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangent of 'p' at 'point(p, x)' (use the Wells method).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6972  line lt = rotate(90, p.V) * line(p.V, p.F);
6973  point P = point(p, x);
6974  if(P == p.V) return lt;
6975  point M = midpoint(segment(P, p.F));
6976  line l = rotate(90, M) * line(P, p.F);
6977  return line(P, projection(lt) * M);
6978 }
6979 
6980 /*<asyxml><function type="line[]" signature="tangents(parabola,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
6981 line[] tangents(parabola p, point M)
6982 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangent of 'p' at 'M' (use the Wells method).</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
6983  line[] ol;
6984  if(inside(p, M)) return ol;
6985  if(M @ p) {
6986  ol.push(tangent(p, angabscissa(p, M)));
6987  }
6988  else {
6989  point Mt = changecoordsys(coordsys(p), M);
6990  circle c = circle(Mt, p.F);
6991  line l = rotate(90, p.V) * line(p.V, p.F);
6992  point[] R = intersectionpoints(l, c);
6993  for (int i = 0; i < R.length; ++i) {
6994  ol.push(line(Mt, R[i]));
6995  }
6996  // An other method: http://www.du.edu/~jcalvert/math/parabola.htm
6997  // point[] R = intersectionpoints(p.directrix, c);
6998  // for (int i = 0; i < R.length; ++i) {
6999  // ol.push(bisector(segment(p.F, R[i])));
7000  // }
7001  }
7002  return ol;
7003 }
7004 
7005 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="tangent(hyperbola,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
7006 line tangent(hyperbola h, abscissa x)
7007 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangent of 'h' at 'point(p, x)'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7008  point M = point(h, x);
7009  line ol = bisector(line(M, h.F1), line(M, h.F2));
7010  if(sameside(h.F1, h.F2, ol) || ol == line(h.F1, h.F2)) ol = rotate(90, M) * ol;
7011  return ol;
7012 }
7013 
7014 /*<asyxml><function type="line[]" signature="tangents(hyperbola,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
7015 line[] tangents(hyperbola h, point M)
7016 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangent of 'h' at 'M'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7017  line[] ol;
7018  if(M @ h) {
7019  ol.push(tangent(h, angabscissa(h, M, fromCenter)));
7020  } else {
7021  coordsys cano = canonicalcartesiansystem(h);
7022  bqe bqe = changecoordsys(cano, equation(h));
7023  real a = abs(1/(bqe.a[5] * bqe.a[0])), b = abs(1/(bqe.a[5] * bqe.a[2]));
7024  point Mp = changecoordsys(cano, M);
7025  real x0 = Mp.x, y0 = Mp.y;
7026  if(abs(x0) > epsgeo) {
7027  real c0 = a * y0^2/(b * x0)^2 - 1/b,
7028  c1 = 2 * a * y0/(b * x0^2), c2 = a/x0^2 - 1;
7029  real[] sol = quadraticroots(c0, c1, c2);
7030  for (real y:sol) {
7031  point tmp = changecoordsys(coordsys(h), point(cano, (a * (1 + y * y0/b)/x0, y)));
7032  ol.push(line(M, tmp));
7033  }
7034  } else if(abs(y0) > epsgeo) {
7035  real y = -b/y0, x = sqrt(a * (1 + b/y0^2));
7036  ol.push(line(M, changecoordsys(coordsys(h), point(cano, (x, y)))));
7037  ol.push(line(M, changecoordsys(coordsys(h), point(cano, (-x, y)))));
7038  }}
7039  return ol;
7040 }
7041 
7042 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(conic,arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
7043 point[] intersectionpoints(conic co, arc a)
7044 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>intersectionpoints(arc, circle) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7045  point[] op;
7046  point[] tp = intersectionpoints(co, (conic)a.el);
7047  for (int i = 0; i < tp.length; ++i)
7048  if(tp[i] @ a) op.push(tp[i]);
7049  return op;
7050 }
7051 
7052 point[] intersectionpoints(arc a, conic co)
7053 {
7054  return intersectionpoints(co, a);
7055 }
7056 
7057 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(arc,arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
7058 point[] intersectionpoints(arc a1, arc a2)
7059 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation></documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7060  point[] op;
7061  point[] tp = intersectionpoints(a1.el, a2.el);
7062  for (int i = 0; i < tp.length; ++i)
7063  if(tp[i] @ a1 && tp[i] @ a2) op.push(tp[i]);
7064  return op;
7065 }
7066 
7067 
7068 /*<asyxml><function type="point[]" signature="intersectionpoints(line,arc)"><code></asyxml>*/
7069 point[] intersectionpoints(line l, arc a)
7070 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>intersectionpoints(arc, line) is also defined.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7071  point[] op;
7072  point[] tp = intersectionpoints(a.el, l);
7073  for (int i = 0; i < tp.length; ++i)
7074  if(tp[i] @ a && tp[i] @ l) op.push(tp[i]);
7075  return op;
7076 }
7077 
7078 point[] intersectionpoints(arc a, line l)
7079 {
7080  return intersectionpoints(l, a);
7081 }
7082 
7083 /*<asyxml><function type="point" signature="arcsubtendedcenter(point,point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
7084 point arcsubtendedcenter(point A, point B, real angle)
7085 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the center of the arc retuned
7086  by the 'arcsubtended' routine.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7087  point OM;
7088  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(A, B);
7089  angle = angle%(sgnd(angle) * 180);
7090  line bis = bisector(P[0], P[1]);
7091  line AB = line(P[0], P[1]);
7092  return intersectionpoint(bis, rotate(90 - angle, A) * AB);
7093 }
7094 
7095 /*<asyxml><function type="arc" signature="arcsubtended(point,point,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
7096 arc arcsubtended(point A, point B, real angle)
7097 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the arc circle from which the segment AB is saw with
7098  the angle 'angle'.
7099  If the point 'M' is on this arc, the oriented angle (MA, MB) is
7100  equal to 'angle'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7101  point[] P = standardizecoordsys(A, B);
7102  line AB = line(P[0], P[1]);
7103  angle = angle%(sgnd(angle) * 180);
7104  point C = arcsubtendedcenter(P[0], P[1], angle);
7105  real BC = degrees(B - C)%360;
7106  real AC = degrees(A - C)%360;
7107  return arc(circle(C, abs(B - C)), BC, AC, angle > 0 ? CCW : CW);
7108 }
7109 
7110 /*<asyxml><function type="arc" signature="arccircle(point,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
7111 arc arccircle(point A, point M, point B)
7112 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the CCW arc circle 'AB' passing through 'M'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7113  circle tc = circle(A, M, B);
7114  real a = degrees(A - tc.C);
7115  real b = degrees(B - tc.C);
7116  real m = degrees(M - tc.C);
7117 
7118  arc oa = arc(tc, a, b);
7119  // TODO: use cross product to determine CWW or CW
7120  if (!(M @ oa)) {
7121  oa.direction = !oa.direction;
7122  }
7123 
7124  return oa;
7125 }
7126 
7127 /*<asyxml><function type="arc" signature="arc(ellipse,abscissa,abscissa,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
7128 arc arc(ellipse el, explicit abscissa x1, explicit abscissa x2, bool direction = CCW)
7129 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the arc from 'point(c, x1)' to 'point(c, x2)' in the direction 'direction'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7130  real a = degrees(point(el, x1) - el.C);
7131  real b = degrees(point(el, x2) - el.C);
7132  arc oa = arc(el, a - el.angle, b - el.angle, fromCenter, direction);
7133  return oa;
7134 }
7135 
7136 /*<asyxml><function type="arc" signature="arc(ellipse,point,point,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
7137 arc arc(ellipse el, point M, point N, bool direction = CCW)
7138 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the arc from 'M' to 'N' in the direction 'direction'.
7139  The points 'M' and 'N' must belong to the ellipse 'el'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7140  return arc(el, relabscissa(el, M), relabscissa(el, N), direction);
7141 }
7142 
7143 /*<asyxml><function type="arc" signature="arccircle(point,point,real,bool)"><code></asyxml>*/
7144 arc arccircle(point A, point B, real angle, bool direction = CCW)
7145 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the arc circle centered on A
7146  from B to rotate(angle, A) * B in the direction 'direction'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7147  point M = rotate(angle, A) * B;
7148  return arc(circle(A, abs(A - B)), B, M, direction);
7149 }
7150 
7151 /*<asyxml><function type="arc" signature="arc(explicit arc,abscissa,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
7152 arc arc(explicit arc a, abscissa x1, abscissa x2)
7153 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the arc from 'point(a, x1)' to 'point(a, x2)' traversed in the direction of the arc direction.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7154  real a1 = angabscissa(a.el, point(a, x1), a.polarconicroutine).x;
7155  real a2 = angabscissa(a.el, point(a, x2), a.polarconicroutine).x;
7156  return arc(a.el, a1, a2, a.polarconicroutine, a.direction);
7157 }
7158 
7159 /*<asyxml><function type="arc" signature="arc(explicit arc,point,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
7160 arc arc(explicit arc a, point M, point N)
7161 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the arc from 'M' to 'N'.
7162  The points 'M' and 'N' must belong to the arc 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7163  return arc(a, relabscissa(a, M), relabscissa(a, N));
7164 }
7165 
7166 /*<asyxml><function type="arc" signature="inverse(inversion,segment)"><code></asyxml>*/
7167 arc inverse(inversion i, segment s)
7168 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the inverse arc circle of 's'
7169  with respect to inversion 'i'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7170  point Ap = inverse(i, s.A), Bp = inverse(i, s.B),
7171  M = inverse(i, midpoint(s));
7172  return arccircle(Ap, M, Bp);
7173 }
7174 
7175 /*<asyxml><operator type="arc" signature="*(inversion,segment)"><code></asyxml>*/
7176 arc operator *(inversion i, segment s)
7177 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide
7178  inversion * segment.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
7179  return inverse(i, s);
7180 }
7181 
7182 /*<asyxml><operator type = "path" signature="*(inversion,triangle)"><code></asyxml>*/
7183 path operator *(inversion i, triangle t)
7184 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Provide inversion * triangle.</documentation></operator></asyxml>*/
7185  return (path)(i * segment(t.AB))--
7186  (path)(i * segment(t.BC))--
7187  (path)(i * segment(t.CA))&cycle;
7188 }
7189 
7190 /*<asyxml><function type="path" signature="compassmark(pair,pair,real,real)"><code></asyxml>*/
7191 path compassmark(pair O, pair A, real position, real angle = 10)
7192 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return an arc centered on O with the angle 'angle' so that the position
7193  of 'A' on this arc makes an angle 'position * angle'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7194  real a = degrees(A - O);
7195  real pa = (a - position * angle)%360,
7196  pb = (a - (position - 1) * angle)%360;
7197  real t1 = intersect(unitcircle, (0, 0)--2 * dir(pa))[0];
7198  real t2 = intersect(unitcircle, (0, 0)--2 * dir(pb))[0];
7199  int n = length(unitcircle);
7200  if(t1 >= t2) t1 -= n;
7201  return shift(O) * scale(abs(O - A)) * subpath(unitcircle, t1, t2);
7202 }
7203 
7204 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="tangent(explicit arc,abscissa)"><code></asyxml>*/
7205 line tangent(explicit arc a, abscissa x)
7206 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangent of 'a' at 'point(a, x)'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7207  abscissa ag = angabscissa(a, point(a, x));
7208  return tangent(a.el, ag + a.angle1 + (a.el.e == 0 ? a.angle0 : 0));
7209 }
7210 
7211 /*<asyxml><function type="line" signature="tangent(explicit arc,point)"><code></asyxml>*/
7212 line tangent(explicit arc a, point M)
7213 {/*<asyxml></code><documentation>Return the tangent of 'a' at 'M'.
7214  The points 'M' must belong to the arc 'a'.</documentation></function></asyxml>*/
7215  return tangent(a, angabscissa(a, M));
7216 }
7217 
7218 // *=======================================================*
7219 // *.......Routines for compatibility with original geometry module........*
7220 
7221 path square(pair z1, pair z2)
7222 {
7223  pair v = z2 - z1;
7224  pair z3 = z2 + I * v;
7225  pair z4 = z3 - v;
7226  return z1--z2--z3--z4--cycle;
7227 }
7228 
7229 // Draw a perpendicular symbol at z aligned in the direction align
7230 // relative to the path z--z + dir.
7231 void perpendicular(picture pic = currentpicture, pair z, pair align,
7232  pair dir = E, real size = 0, pen p = currentpen,
7233  margin margin = NoMargin, filltype filltype = NoFill)
7234 {
7235  perpendicularmark(pic, (point) z, align, dir, size, p, margin, filltype);
7236 }
7237 
7238 
7239 // Draw a perpendicular symbol at z aligned in the direction align
7240 // relative to the path z--z + dir(g, 0)
7241 void perpendicular(picture pic = currentpicture, pair z, pair align, path g,
7242  real size = 0, pen p = currentpen, margin margin = NoMargin,
7243  filltype filltype = NoFill)
7244 {
7245  perpendicularmark(pic, (point) z, align, dir(g, 0), size, p, margin, filltype);
7246 }
7247 
7248 // Return an interior arc BAC of triangle ABC, given a radius r > 0.
7249 // If r < 0, return the corresponding exterior arc of radius |r|.
7250 path arc(explicit pair B, explicit pair A, explicit pair C, real r)
7251 {
7252  real BA = degrees(B - A);
7253  real CA = degrees(C - A);
7254  return arc(A, abs(r), BA, CA, (r < 0) ^ ((BA-CA) % 360 < 180) ? CW : CCW);
7255 }
7256 
7257 point orthocentercenter(point A, point B, point C)
7258 {
7259  return orthocenter(A, B, C);
7260 }
7261 
7262 point orthocentercenter(triangle t)
7263 {
7264  return orthocenter(t.A, t.B, t.C);
7265 }
7266
